1EwKxZA3Id9o1AZsZewitQ.text: This place was delicious! The service was so phenomenal, and I would go back just for how I was treated.

peydFJ-JNwD1uH7M2BmVog.text: Probably the best Italian restaraunt I've ever been to. Literally AMAZING. The owner came up and talked to us a few times, my water was constantly filled, if the waiter didn't know about a specific wine he woukd ask the manager and he personally came to our table to give us additional information about Italian wine. Amazing shrimp & lobster raviolis. I wish I had more!!! 5 stars forsure.

esetTcJCFhUal1ip2ti2Og.text: I'm so happy there is a good.wait.. GREAT neighborhood restaurant nearby. My family and I walked in, literately, around 6pm for a quick dinner to this new restaurant we were eyeing.  We were expecting a cafe style restaurant and were pleasantly surprised at the elegant and inviting decor and atmosphere. The waiters were professional and the service overall was great. Now to the food.... AMAZING! Authentic and delicious! We ordered the lentil soup which was the soup of the day, so good! We ordered the heirloom caprese salad, so good! The margerita pizza was yummy, the house bread and oil was delicious. As an entree we had the shrimp paprika - to say it was delicious is an understatement. Each bite was mouthwatering. For dessert we had the gelato and shared it, also delicious. Coffee was good too!  We went with our four year old daughter and while we felt welcomed to dine as a family, we would likely opt to eat there for an adult night/date night in the future and maybe have a few glasses of wine with our meal. Great place to have dinner with friends or for a date night. Also great if you just want a meal guaranteed to hit the spot. When we arrived it was quiet, however, within minutes the place was full and you could hear laughter and great conversations happening. One of the owners even walked around with a smile on his face greeting everyone. It can't wait to go back again and again.  The prices seemed high when looking at the menu, but the food was quality and it was worth the price. Hard to find places like this that feel authentic and satisfy! I highly recommend this place!

C1xzTj55CjQOi96s5NX5-w.text: Best place ever ! Went there for my bf and I anniversary and it was such a great experience. The food is amazing and they went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of.

9YMBBc-vym9ulQkv8FKpLw.text: Best eggplant parm on the planet...so much so that I  pay $30 on Doordash to have it delivered. Omg. Delish

2bk4tdYrFp2TuITMAzNKtA.text: Great new neighborhood restaurant!  Especially convenient if you are doing "dinner and a movie" at the Regal Colonnade next door.  The dining atmosphere was upscale, the staff friendly and attentive.  The portions were ample, the pricing was fair, the menu was extensive and the presentation, artistic.  We started with warm, fresh crusty bread served with an olive oil tapenade.  Our entrees were the daily special, osso buco, the chicken Parm and the pasta with short rib.  All dishes were tasty and well-prepared.   Everything was superbly orchestrated under the watchful eye of Giuseppi, the owner.  Reservations recommended for weekend dining as this local gem has already been discovered.

O4I_XpgBYf5PpQ7Aa2Q4ag.text: We came here on a whim one Saturday night. The restaurant is very close to our house and we've been dying to try it. It was busy but we were seated quickly. The staff is attentive and friendly. Everything we ordered was fresh and cooked perfectly. The prosecco custard was something new for us and it was fabulous! One of the best meals we've had in a long time! Love that it's in our neighborhood but it could easily fit right in with some of the best restaurants on the Strip.

cKFTARWjvcz57NLEg7dKOw.text: Tonight my hubby and I ventured off (literally around the corner) to try a new dinning experience. We were pleasantly surprised to find this upscale Italian treasure. The staff greeted us with smiles and welcomed us in. So nice to have the choice of indoor or outdoor dinning, we chose indoor to soak up the ambiance. Which has an open floor plan so your able to take it all in, while soft Italian music plays in the background. Now for the food, which is what brought us there in the first place. The waiter told us the Chef's specials which had me change my mind and go with Chef's stuffed veal chop, my eye's are rolling back in my head, so delighted with this choice. My husband chose the fire roasted Lasagna. I'm sad to say he told me MY Lasagna doesn't hold a candle to this. But happy we found a new favorite Italian restaurant in our neighborhood.

Jbfoxmk7qnFPtWCFLOqLAw.text: Went for lunch. First time visit and I will become a regular. Great patio seating as well as indoor seating the atmosphere was excellent . The background music was at a level that allowed for pleasant conversation  I went with the spinach salad and added the grilled salmon. Salad was fresh and the salmon was perfect!  I was tempted by all the menu items so I will be returning soon and often. I would also rate it as a good value

qNyG9_eIsF_F2JfohxJ_UQ.text: Amazing foood .. Service was just one of a kind , this restaurant was at there best! Rohda was amazing

HB5ylXo97LV_oAujab7isw.text: Buyer beware. Food and service OK, however I ordered the "lunch" special assuming price would be the same as some of the pricier menu items $20-$30. When the check showed up with a $50 charge for an OK Osso Bucco , I kicked myself.It was OK but for the same fare I could have gone to Il-Mulino at the strip. 3 star food , 5 star price.

RJJclygijADmcFZ606SxAw.text: Excellent service and food high in quality. This place is a hidden gem. Tucked away in a corner on Eastern & Pebble Rd. We went on a Wednesday evening and this placed was packed.  The owner Giuseppe came and greeted us. I had veal osso buco and my girl had a veal dish that was to die for. Will be back very soon.

jwR_sM9ezwxz9Uqb9g5aLQ.text: Had.  Lunch today. With my.  2 senior church friends .we had calamari and stuffed pork chops,OMG so delish,we will definitely go back . Went to church after and we spread the word. Authentic Italian,owners from Venice and northern Italy. Very friendly ,excellent service.Classy atmosphere.Loved the Red chandeliers.

zIWyptQkpFXJu2Ng70yUBQ.text: We dined at Prosecco's last Saturday with another couple and had Rhonda as our server.  She was excellent in describing the specials and answered any questions and helped us decide on our choices.  We neded her advice because the choice of entrees was exceptional!  The pasta is all homemade, the bread was great as were the drinks.  We ordered the filet mignon, a shrimp and pasta dish, lasagna, and the osso buoco.  Fantastic! Food is so fresh and delicious.  We definitely plan on dining here again and will bring our out of town family and friends here when entertaining.  The owner stopped by our table a number of times to make sure our needs were being met, and Rhonda was outstanding as our server.

h_FnoLJdQ9ugIVIb6YiJFA.text: Another amazing local spot! If there are two of you, start with a glass of Prosecco. Get a bottle of Jordan. Share the Chef Platter for two and ravioli aragosta and finish with a cannoli! Amazing!!!

btCKmzDOG-QtJLtD47CISw.text: In moving to Henderson, we were lamenting the loss of all of our favorite Summerlin and Central Las Vegas restaurants. We found Prosecco on the first night of our move and we could not be more thrilled. The texture of the homemade pasta is perfect and everyone loved their meals. We ordered from them three times during our first four nights in the new house.

Ox31Y_JHz3INLnfUe4abrw.text: Love the pastas and strawberry crepe! Never had a bad dish and really appreciate the friendly staff. Very attentive! Definitely recommend to anyone in the mood for Italian food.

hxH0lLhUXO923l3f_LtvWw.text: Trendy ambiance but comfortable ! Good seafood and great bar! Good service and value for price! Very fresh ingredients. Will go back

0vWN5AqAzXu5y85Vki3GVg.text: The penne vodka was amazing. We ordered the Chilean seabass and it was amazing as well. The service was excellent. I'm looking forward to going back.

5UPIfZWNBTdBFTEbsTY4iA.text: Have been here twice now, and had wonderful experiences both times. Great service, great food. Highly recommend this great neighborhood restaurant.

9DdcERH4Fd-trnpOE6fx1w.text: Hands down the best Italian restaurant! We came here because I've been craving pasta for days and I specifically wanted carbonara..which is not easy to find. So looking through their menu I had a few options that caught my eyes but I was still stuck with the carbonara cravings, lol. So we asked our very courteous lady named Ronda if it was possible for them to make me a carbonara anything and that it was ok if it was not possible. Yes! Shortly after I had in front of me the BEST and most flavoured carbonara dish on earth! It was perfect!!! My husband got himself something I cant remember the name but it was also amazing (Yes, I tried it!).  A few things I want to point out besides the amazing food are the amazing decoration, this place is very inviting and beautiful, I absolutely love the images on the wall and the lamps; the  ladies room, I have never seen a restroom so fancy in a restaurant, and clean!!!  Also, the staff, everybody is very friendly and attentive and the chef is the best! Ronda and him made our  visit special!  This place is a must go to for the pasta lovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My amazing carbonara and what my husband ordered. Yummy!

mGA2Pd9JiRQ02igaO9c1Hw.text: This was a good lunch spot but it was not the greatest. It was my first time here today and I don't think I would go out of my way to come back here unless I'm in the area. Our waiter was extremely nice and the restaurant had a great look overall.   As an appetizer we got a chicken Caesar salad. When we told the waiter we were gonna share it, he was nice enough to split it into two separate bowls for a friend and I before bringing it out to us. The chicken was a bit dry and there were just way too many croutons. But on the bright side, there was just the right amount of dressing unlike most places I've been too where they don't put enough dressing. The portion was also surprisingly good even when shared with another person.   For the entree, I got the Pollo Marsala which was chicken breast with a wine Marsala sauce over it. It came with potatoes, sauteed string beans and carrots as the side. The sauce was great but again the chicken was a bit dry. The portion was also a great size for lunch.   Overall, great service, great look for the restaurant, but the food could've been better.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pollo Marsala
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Caesar salad (split between two bowls)

4R2Lwp_pwrcXFvqHGUmEkw.text: My favorite place for Italian food. The food is so Fresh and delicious and really taste homemade. Both times I've went service was very slow but it was totally worth the wait! I love this place and would recommend it to anyone that is looking to have some great Italian food!

6ZcJxOb1e-km78abEBZivg.text: Every dish has been great. The Chilean sea bass is the best I've ever had.  I highly recommend coming here.

6mjRfJsJtNujekFKGAo6-g.text: A friend from work recommended this resteraunt so we thought we would give it a try...and I am so glad we did!! We had the ravioli with squash, and the spaghetti and meatballs.  Both were delicious, exceeding our expectations.  We will defiantely be returning, and sharing our new find with others!!

s-jxU9HDykCrLzn04Yenvw.text: Mario and Emmanuel are amazing servers! From a 1-10 tonight's experience was a top 10. The Sea Bass with Lobster was amazing combination of flavors with beautiful presentation. Even the simple angel hair is incredibly tasty!! Lovely place.

WV5fD3Up-PV_1wDw0V1jcA.text: Been looking for a nice local Italian restaurant and finally found one. Nice interior and quite, I could actually hear my dinner partner talk. The food was very good. The only complaint was the service, one gal was working away, but the guy who was suppose to bring us the check was way to slow. And the hostess could have helped out.  Came back with my husband. I had the eggplant , burnt my mouth and the dish tasted of only cheese. My husband had a pasta dish that was supposed to be spicy but wasn't. Serve was still bad and this time the food was subpar. Won't come back.

cRqSY3kOuGIojzo1n6s56Q.text: Outstanding! Quintessential, "If you build it they will come !" story!! Pesto black olive tapenade  Mango, avocado, tomato, cucumber salad   Caprese salad Pepperoni pizza Salmon tagliatelle  Veal piccata   Four cheese agnolotti  Tiramisu

iXYJCejUWYJFuAjMgOXJVw.text: If u haven't tried prosecco then your missing out on the best italian restaurant in vegas!. The lasagna is my favorite and they offer half off wine bottles every tuesday and wednesday. Amazing service from all of the staff and the owners are very attentive. Finaly a great local restaurant with a very authentic feel.

zwG-3dB7f8D4ENnRLe9xuQ.text: Not quite sure why I'm not giving this place five stars. There was nothing wrong with it. It just didn't have that special pizazz that would motivate me to give it five stars, I guess. Anyway, don't hesitate to go there - it's good.

87SUtafiSZb4QDot6DcWXg.text: I've now been here two more times since my initial review and I don't hesitate to bump Prosecco up to the big 5*. The food I've tried is an easy 4-4.5*, and rounding up is a no-brainer given their solid wine list, availability of daily specials, and that they are open not just for lunch but all day as well.  On my last visit, my party did mostly specials - the octopus appetizer special was absolutely fantastic, perfectly cooked with lovely texture. We also split up a salmon fettuccine in vodka sauce, which was divine. I opted for the sea bass special which was also very well cooked, and a friend did the osso bucco over risotto. After I tried some, I had some regrets about not getting it!  Don't skip dessert either. I'm not a huge fan of the cannoli here but the prosecco-infused custard is to die for. I also enjoyed the small bit of tiramisu I managed to steal from another friend's plate.  All in all, super lucky to have another quality Italian option on this side of town.

5tBMZxQ41o15WXMkOnI8cA.text: Snooty Italian staff to greet you. Overpriced off the Strip food with decent portion sizes but not worth the hype. The flavors of the dishes we sampled were bland (calamari $13, shrimp paprika $29, and chicken parm $24)...we skipped dessert as even their Gelato was $8 and for two people with drinks we were already reached $100.  Price wasn't the driving decision here it certainly would be worth it for the taste and service were lackluster. No plans to refer or return.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

afJokovbgRCctfEwIHJzyg.text: What a great place I just left there about an hour ago. Very nice place great food and wonderful hospitality. Highly recommend this place!!

v_bGVUdPH9m_ygwTzw0YzA.text: This restaurant is awesome. A nice variety on the menu, & the bread & pesto is very tasty! The food is always good, service is pretty good. Not on top of water refills, salt & pepper, etc. Great scrub soap in the ladies room. Highly recommend, nice local place, with great food!

xEz9FSrvNqp-pUBVmOkd2Q.text: Wonderful meal , what a great treat by John Crist in honor of our wedding , thank you John . The food was fantastic, the company made it even better. Every dish was wonderful , 9 people were in our party and everyone was pleased.  The staff was excellent and very attentive. I recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great Italian dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

khlBTNGr2tdJRTeW4O1O2A.text: The food is consitantly great. Good wine selection and friendly staff of which most are from Italy. We are regulars at this restaurant. Good quality, fresh food. Carpaccio and Chefs platter are delicious appetizers.

f9_SG061TIbkr2ePq6GrOg.text: First time here had short rib served with egg pasta fettuccine.  Very nice!  Brewed ice tea, nice coffee and dessert.  Will definitely come again,

giVFouAvAYEoAYq0tbK6Fg.text: Definitely a cut above the standard Italian fare around here. Great service. Real artistry in the food prep and presentation. Very nice bruschetta appetizer, and a terrific beet salad; maybe the best I've ever had, and I'm a big fan of that type of salad. Wife had lasagna, which was excellent. I had the fettuccine with braised short ribs; total standout. Good sized servings; we each brought half of our order home.  Wife had strawberry crepe for dessert. I had the cannoli. Both very good. Left full and very satisfied. Will return.

MGQsOYdW3eO7VJjPxgSFbA.text: This place was amazing. I'm sorry it took me so long to get here. Owner and staff were all very friendly. I've been to a lot of Italian restaurants across the country and this was the first one I've ever been to that plays Modern Italian music. It was very refreshing.   Interior is beautiful with a lot of versatile seating for booths, seats and 1/2 and 1/2 style tables.  Bread served before our meal was great.  My husband had the eggplant parmigiano. Very good and he has been dreaming about the delicious sauce it came with ever since.  I had the sausage with broccolini and golden potatoes. Great spice and flavoring on the entire dish. I can tell they make their own sausage in house and it was the best sausage i've had in Vegas so far.  Highly recommend this place. We're certainly going to be returning here often.

uYkpA70lJwNh8su4srq_HA.text: I have been meaning to check this place out for a while. So glad we stopped. Rhonda was very helpful and menu looked great. We tried a few dishes, and we were very pleased. Looking forward to going back and exploring the menu further. The decor is beautiful and spacious, so don't let the strip mall location deter you. It was lovely.

EhP799JepeYGenfMPgux5w.text: First time here. Great atmosphere BUT...had to wait forever to get everything!!!! Wasn't crowded for a friday night and the restaurant wasn't that big for such a long wait time. Food was decent but staff neefs to step it up. Might give one more try...

oecadq1PR_eFYghqbDBHNg.text: Amazing !!! The pizza was amazing - that the kids had. We had the chicken parm and the ceaser salad - both where amazing !!! The portions were big! The sauce on the spaghetti and parmigiana was amazing . Very cheesy and delicious . We will be back for sure!

Ph83EmN7b-LaRqTT39goCA.text: My first time was with my parents. My father loved the cannellonis. I had a salad with shrimps...fresh, tasty shrimps.  Second time with my partner tried their lunch specials....wow meatballs.

C5F5hPuBEmpAHOy7fevbRA.text: We went here for our wedding anniversary. The food was absolutely spot on, fairly priced too. The wife had linguine with lobster tail and I had smoked salmon tagliatelle with vodka sauce, amazing food quality and flavors. Desserts where good too! The only reason I wouldn't give them five stars is due to service front of house, it is spotty at best and seemed awkward and absent at times. The top guy Niko checked on us at the end, we told him we were celebrating our anniversary and he realized his staff had dropped the ball on even acknowledging that (was noted in our open table reservation) so he comped us two after dinner Limoncello drinks, very nice of him. A bit noisy,acoustics could be dampened. As a side note, some dishes were finished by table side service, like filleting a cooked fish table side and also fettuccine Alfredo prepared table side. Table side service is pretty cool and fun, not seen much these days. Already anticipating our return!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nicely presented desserts

YaipwSaw1q6zmZQUmMXqWg.text: Cute little place! Friendly staff and great, reasonably priced food! I had the Fettuccine Tocco which was fabulous! The short ribs melted in your mouth! My sister had the ravioli formaggio which was good as well (not as good as mine...teehee). Also had the strawberry crepe which was a nice, tasty, light dessert. The only reason I did not give it a 5 star is that it is a tad bit noisy and it was a little difficult having a conversation.

Oh , and our bartender Teya- True Rock star! Amazing drinks!  They also have nice happy hour 3-6 everyday including weekend!  My new favorite local spot!

I love the open kitchen as well. 6 stars if I could!

Atpu3bxlPXp82G3QVdeK5A.text: Outstanding service and real Italian food! Very pleased with my experience. Definitely going back!

sQ-xvvLxhQyvPaQNQkI6Zw.text: Great food and great service. Authentic Italian cuisine. Only complaint I have is the pricing for the amount of food. I will for sure return when I don't have 4 kids to pay for.

jA38ALz1GYoUpsvrve6crA.text: Great food. Great atmosphere. Great bar.  The staff is very friendly. The place is very clean. The pizza here is some of the best in town. And the bread and oil dip is amazing.  I always ask for some dip to go which they happily oblige. Love this place!!!  And it's open for lunch which is very nice.

voZllhiMy3FFflK5gFj7fQ.text: We just tried this place through yelp24 because we saw that they delivered and we couldn't be happier! This will definitely be our new go to delivery food but now I'm anxious to go dine in as well. Coming from a super authentic Italian family of chefs, I'm really critical of Italian food but this place was one of the better Italian restaurants I've had in the valley. We tried the spinach salad, minestrone, and tiramisu and it was all perfect. They even included a little bundle of bread and dip, which was a great touch! Highly recommend this place.

L7u7nvcNYPmjvZLuS9RquA.text: First time and not the last!  They serve you bread with olive oil dipping sauce. The food is made fresh! The food tastes great! It is authentic Italian! Friendly atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S3rJP_ytKXPelmoBdikZ2g.text: I've been here once before and I had an amazing first experience. The food was good and the service was also pretty good. So, I came here with family (6 total) we got seated pretty quickly however, it took them over 20 mins to even get us water. I even had to ask for the complimentary bread. Our server never really greeted us and if he did it was brief and felt cold. I'm also sure the owner/manager was here our entire meal and we saw him go over to every table and say hello yet he never came over to ours, not even once. I'm a little disappointed in the service and overall experience I had here during my second visit.

myx1FGEBuMqTkEd301V_LQ.text: First time here! Saw it on Yelp and decided to try it out as the photos of all the food looked amazing. The inside was much nicer than I anticipated & we were seated promptly. We came in around 5:30pm on a Wednesday so it wasn't too busy.  The server was very nice and the busser was awesome he kept refilling our water so quickly.   Cajun shrimp pasta was awesome! It was a white sauce and their seasoning was so good not too salty but so much flavor. The shrimp was served on a skewer and they were charred and delicious!   Fettuccini Tocca with short rib (beef) was a red sauce and very flavorful, a little more heart. The beef was tender.  We also got the grilled octopus appetizer which was soooo good!! We also got the tiramisu for desert along with the cappuccino. Although they don't have milk alternatives...  All in all the service and food was awesome. The only reason I couldn't give this place a 5 star was that l, the owner/manager there, greeted and checked in with all seated and newly seated tables while we were there. He checked on them asking how their service was, food, even having small chats with a few regarding wine and such. Never once did he approach our table. He even stopped by the table next to us just to say hi and see how the guy was. New tables of families were seated and be greeted them all. I just thought it was odd and rude that for whatever reason, not once did he ever stop by our table to say hi or ask how everything was. I even mentioned it to my bf who said that he noticed as well. That kind of rubbed me the wrong way...I mentioned it on a note card they provided with the bill...so hopefully in the future it's something they can keep in mind. If you're going to treat your customers and build that relationship and atmosphere, perhaps that should be done with all. As it seemed they did, with ALL, except one!

VGXw_IbYo6f5ZC0F9MafZg.text: Honestly, I don't like giving out poor reviews on places. I usually only give 5 stars and if I feel it was less than that I won't write a review but this was unacceptable. My cousin and I went in tonight for dinner after a really long day of work for me and I wanted to enjoy my birthday dinner. We got there at 915pm and they close at 10. I knew it was kind of late but I thought it looked like a nice place to enjoy ourselves. I expected a lot better service being that I do work in the service industry. We waited for our water more than 10 minutes and there were only 2 other tables still in the restaurant. So being that it was slow I felt like I could've gotten serviced faster. As I sat down at the table, I could see into their kitchen area where I saw multiple employees just standing and talking while we waited for WATER! We almost got up and left but we were hungry and decided to stay. As we sat there we saw the 2 tables next to us get treated way better than us and actually serviced. We then decided to have our food to go because we felt rushed and unwanted there. The server didn't even tell us his name probably because he didn't care to give us the quality we deserved.  It's sad that we experienced this type of service because the food was delicious. Since the food was good but the service was poor this is not a place I would come back to or even tell a friend to try. Management should really talk to their employees and remind them that this is a customer service/hospitality based job and they should never make their guests feel unwanted or like a burden.

sAhGoZzR6yLaCACpsyWbgg.text: Ah. Prosecco. People, you are wasting your time and money going anywhere else. This is a True and very authentic Italian restaurant where the food is high QUALITY and from the very best ingredients. The calamari, wonderful. The service, excellent. We have had the lasagne ( correct spelling), pizza, tiramisu, an amazing special dish with shrimp from the Mediterranean,  the other night a bottle of Chianti from Tuscany that made me swoon and of course, Giuseppe the friendly owner takes pride in welcoming everybody. Must go. Must. ] Just read a review where they say it takes too long. PEOPLE SLOW DOWN!!! This is how it is done outside the worker bee fast paced USA where people rush to eat and simply gobble down their food and sprint out. This is a place to kick back, laugh, socialize, linger over drinks and dining with friends and family. The idea is to slow you down and RELAX you. Do not miss the whole point. It is not Chili's or Outback. This is an Italian RESTAURANT, an experience. Just breathe and enjoy the wonderful flavors, atmosphere and good company of your dining partner/s.

oIUlcSp8w2YIbRcAOw68nw.text: This place is absolutely amazing!  This was our second time dining here and it was once again a delicious experience.  Had dinner here last night with my husband and daughter and EVERYTHING was outstanding: the service, the food, the desserts, the ambiance.  Joaquin - BEST server in Las Vegas, hands down!  Giuseppe and Nico are super friendly and accommodating.  It's not often that you see the owners mingling with their customers and every table they visited, the guests had smiles on their faces.    We started with the Burratina Dinner antipasti.  For dinner, I ordered the Sea Bass special, my husband ordered the Fettuccine Tocco, and my 2-year-old had the children's pasta with marinara sauce (which she loved!).  For dessert, the delicious tiramisu and gelato.   We are planning a special birthday celebration here for my MIL and Nico took the time to sit down with us and offered suggestions on what to serve.  He created a delicious menu and we're so excited to celebrate here.  If you haven't dined here yet.....it is a MUST!!!

S9tN0m8enBqVutIj3LB4Fg.text: Atmosphere was great. Such a beautiful restaurant! Food was pretty terrible. For sure the worst Italian I have ever had. I felt the prices were high so they can try to make the money back that they spent on renovations . When I was asked if I wanted a glass of wine I really felt that the waiter wanted me to spend more money , he didn't genuinely want me to have wine. Maybe I only felt this way because I was the ONLY person in the restaurant so there was awkward silence. Will not return. If this place stays open for 8 more mothers I will be shocked.

1QR6BgzXhpo7ngGEw-BW4w.text: Had the ruby salad, carpaccio, salmon, and ravioli...... everything was literally amazing. We had an amazing server as well. I have not one thing bad to say about this restaurant.

UwkniJTsURny16GEbKPcMg.text: After reading Roger E.'s many reviews of this local restaurant we thought we would give it a try.    The location is twice the size of the old Round Table Pizza and very, very nicely decorated.   From the very first greeting you receive from  "Nicco" and the staff at the front, you know you are in an establishment that caters to the customer. We were seated near the bar in a single sided booth with tables right next to us.  Not my favorite seating, especially for a cozy dinner with friends.  But, that was overshadowed by all the good aspects of this restaurant.  Our waitress was "Teya" who was also the bartender.  Sharp, classy and efficient.  She checked on us periodically and her assistants always kept our glasses full.  Our group started with the Ruby salad which was very fresh and cold.  It would make an excellent lunch as it was large and tasty. For our main courses my guests had a chicken and veal dishe and I had the veal chop.  All very good with excellent accompanying sauces.  Dessert was a treat with our favorite being the banana Nutella crepe. My only regret was waiting so long to try this place. We have been missing out on a great local dining establishment.  We might request a normal table or booth next time, and hope Teya can be our server once again !!!

0zuf1ikGNwBUZiFplb4jmg.text: Again in this restaurant and again everything in a highest level!  Thank you guys for the perfect food and perfect evening!

COQTAHXTIN4QfstGybpNRw.text: Boutique restaurant. This place is uniquely decorated with a romantic ambiance. I like that it wasn't darkly lit, you can see the person across from you. The service was great, very attentive and on point. The owner is noticed helping his employees and also servicing the tables which is pretty awesome to me.   The food is phenomenal. We had the bruschetta to share and it was one of the bruschetta I've ever had. The tomatoes were fresh and the cheese was so delicious.  They brought some bread and an olive oil with crush olives dip, which is delicious and complimentary. I've had the chicken Limone and I love it. Chicken was juicy and  with the capers and butter perfectly seasoned the chicken. Their steak and chicken Marsala were also quite delicious. My husband had the ravioli and I thought it was great even though I don't like creamy too much. Over all this is a great dining experience and we love bringing our family here.

_xaP1RU8QEtKxolHtDDCHw.text: I have been to this lovely restaurant several times but recently went for lunch a couple of days ago.  Right now, the heirloom tomatoes are AMAZING and we enjoyed them in the caprese and the house salad.  I would order just the heirloom tomatoes with some balsamic if I could!  When we had gone for dinner, I loved the marinara sauce they house made.  It was so flavorful and had the right amount of garlic in it.  We liked it so much we asked for a side of it when we ordered the pizza.  Be sure to ask them which pastas are 'fresh' pastas.  That makes a difference in your pasta dishes.  If they have the cheese wheel (aged in-house) with shaved truffles-- I highly recommend it.  It is a beautiful dish and is quite a show as well!  One suggestion but I don't know if it's possible-- I had stayed a month in Hermosa Beach and loved the Italian restaurant Fritto Misto.  There you can build your own pasta choosing your type of pasta, sauce and any add ins you want-- meats, veggies etc.  They had ALL fresh pasta there and it was so satisfying ordering exactly what you want on your pasta.  Just a suggestion.....

t-Ch8TCSXvSprSAypf6pcQ.text: Stopped here for lunch, tried chicken limone with capers sauce and it was absolutely delicious! Staff are friendly, clean restaurant and very tasty food. Definitely coming back again! Gianni was our server and he was delightful!

FJJB_FWrtSMWYoqAtJuGGg.text: Love this restaurant, excellent food, excellent service. We always sit at bar and enjoy the knowledgeable bartender who always surprise us with good wine and food pairings. Thank you Carolina.

f4Q6IIqD-nUG1rPBh5XYJw.text: I sat at the bar as a last minute decision. The dining area was full and busy. I was pleasantly directed around the corner and chose a seat. I was instantly and happily greeted by Tracy. She is a certified sommelier and got my taste immediately. The delicious suggested wine followed by the tastiest wagyu burger I've ever had was well received. Giuseppe, the owner, is hands on, and checked in on every table personally. The ambiance, service, and quality are top notch. My mom owned/ran a very successful restaurant, so I don't say this lightly.  I'm a forever fan of Prosecco.

_IBSfLVSTf6sj9-vsuEhbQ.text: Super cute restaurant! It has a very welcoming vibe and the staff is very friendly.  We came here for brunch and we ordered steak & eggs the steak had great flavor and was cooked to the temperature we ordered. The eggs and potatoes also have very nice flavor. We also ordered a crepe which was amazing!! The chocolate is very hot and they add nuts to give it a little crunch this is by far one of the best crepes I've had! Love the live music as well. AfD9wj8YaIRKYtL9ZyolWQ.text: Don't let the strip mall location or outside fool you, everything about Prosecco is elegant, yet warm and comfortable.  The entire staff is genuinely interested in ensuring you have a good experience besides enjoying the meal. I have been here a few times for lunch and happy hour. The happy hour is the best bang for your buck with $5 drinks (and decent selection) and quality bar food selection most are between $5 and $9, but all impressive... Bruschetta with roasted tomatoes and ricotta cheese, Wood fire oven Naples style meatballs, Beef Carpaccio with arugula, capers and shaved parmesan cheese*...  I mean a generous plate of  Carpaccio during Happy Hour is $7!   I feel so lucky to have this gem in the neighborhood.

Ls0Ix3B4yt8__bP3QmYa-A.text: We stopped here because of the nice patio.  The Prosecco salad was delicious, the half order was more than enough as a side salad and only $5.  The cheese ravioli were homemade pastas and the cream sauce was light and not too heavy with a bit of asparagus mixed in.    Servers were friendly and knowledgeable. Prices were good and they offered lunch specials although we chose to order off the regular menu.    The only thing I disliked were the fake plants, but that is simply a personal preference.  The decor was beautiful and the ambiance comfortable.     Would definitely recommend this spot for lunch again and would try for dinner. They have a large wine selection also!

k8gkU9Jtgd_1zoinDH8X0A.text: Came in here for an early lunch on a Monday morning because the wife had a craving for tiramisu. I thought the place seemed oddly familiar - 3 years ago when I came out this way it was a dark and dingy pizza joint and now it's a bright and beautiful Italian restaurant.  We were very quickly seated and greeted with a warm welcome. There were two servers working at the time and they were very polite and attentive.  We ordered ravioli, a pasta with bolognese sauce and a pizza for my 2 year old. The ravioli and pasta flavors were amazing, you could definitely tell they were freshly made. As a precaution though, their sauces seem to be a little heavier on the wine content than most other places (but I didn't mind!) The pizza we got for the kid was HUGE for a kids meal, and was oddly topped with a handful of fries - which was a little weird.  Oh, we also had the calamari appetizer - the portion size was great and it was fried to perfection (with clean oil) and served with a slightly tangy but light marinara sauce. I don't normally like marinara because it's so thick and chunky at most places, but I feel they really perfected it for this appetizer by keeping it on the lighter side.   You could really tell that this place pays close attention to detail - from the homemade croutons, to the amazing olive oil dipping sauce for the bread, all the way to the completely spot free glasses they pour your drink in.  This was a truly wonderful casual lunch experience. I hope their dinner service is equally as good because I want to go back and try the seafood linguine!  In summary, it's a wonderful local Italian restaurant that really hits the spot.  Keep up the good work!

GX9oaRKK3fx28gJlm1dRKA.text: We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary here. The ambience is wonderful! Bar is off to one side so either option works well. We took a booth.  We split a salad and pizza as appetizers. Asked server about spinach in the salad before ordering since I am allergic. He said it was in there and unfortunately couldn't remove it since it was a mix. We ordered anyway because I could make it work. He brought the salad out already separated to be shared and had managed to give all of the spinach to my husband without being asked!  The pizza was delicious. I will go back just for it!  Main course was the lobster pasta at a steal for $29 each. The lobster was excellent and the sauce had a nice surprise flavor to it. We were too full for dessert. We will be back!

uSJR8JuNuzyrHRg3JdG1CQ.text: My first visit with my family and friends was exactly what we expected.  Great customer service from start to finish.  Excellent, authentic Italian cuisine.  My Italian friend was impressed! We shared carpaccio, ravioli, lasagna, and the sea bass with some lovely wines. Will be returning soon as I'm back in town and pray they have added my favorite dessert to the menu... panna cotta. Special Thank you to Joaquin and Rhonda

1wXyDWRyRJrkJnBjewEsfQ.text: Absolutely love this place!! Stumbled upon it by accident, and we have loved coming here since! You wouldn't think of it as a good place for Sunday brunch, but the very inexpensive bottomless mimosas and lox and bagels had us hooked! Not to mention the gorgeous patio and the guitar player! 1NWoh6Zi8rwHWQOSRhlC6w.text: We went here for Valentine's day and I have to say the service was great, the bread and Olive tapanade was very good, salad wonderful... I am unfortunately deducting stars for the main dishes. Because it's an Italian restaurant I ordered a pasta and seafood dish. The dish was very salty with the pasta sauce tasting very bland and smooth similar to a jar. I was also disappointed that the Parmesan cheese that they bought to the table was not the same shaved real cheese that was on the salad..it was the powdery kind from a shaker. My husband had a chicken dish. He said the chicken was cooked nicely but lacked flavor. I would come here for a lunch salad. But this is an expensive restaurant and I feel the main dishes did not live up to what is expected at these prices.

oAga2-EaNSePmqfCU4v6UA.text: This truly is a little gem. The pastas are fresh and homemade, the service is great, and the owner is such a nice man. The restaurant made me a special dish (funny eating habits) that was great; my husband had the lasagna and said it was outstanding; our friend had the lobster linguine and she said it was amazing. _k_iFHadrwLCszTXfmDbgg.text: I have a friend on fb who was saying that she absolutely loved this place so i wanted to check it out. Now for the pros....The restaurant is nice it was completely remodeled. Our server was super friendly and attentive. Cons...As far as the food and prices I wasn't too impressed. I had the Cannelloni Gratinati it was ok but not for the price. It says on the yelp menu $14.00 it's actually $16.00 once you get there. Please change the prices on here :/. Also surprising is that with these price you don't get a side salad? My sister had the lasagna and my mom the eggplant both were ok but again not for the price. I could see having these prices if your on the strip but your not. I probably won't visit again there's too many other Italian restaurants in town with better prices and better food. Giving three stars for decor and server.

RjrEFmvAQe-YDDPmP9aU8g.text: I'm always a pretty big fan when it comes to early italian dinners. This is one of the best places in the city in my opinion for some good italian. I like getting the penne; or the grilled octopus. The mozzarella, the fresh basil everything is so great. As a chef, it's really hard to find places that you might feel are on par to y our own cooking. This place is up there.

HnIyeFSjMRUe_xV2QNd7ag.text: I had lunch here for the first time today. Sadly, for such wonderful food, the place wasn't busy. We were a party of four and shared the ruby and caprese salads, then the bianca and margherita pizzas. All were wonderful, and we had enough pizza left over for another meal! Our waiter, Nicholas, suggested a bottle of white wine from Argentina, a fabulous wine I had never tried. Service was equally great. Nicholas was friendly and attentive and the man who bussed our table was very courteous and did not allow our water glasses to get less than half full, a blessing on a hot July day. To top it off, Ladies, there is a wonderfully scented scrub in the restroom. This is definitely on my list to visit again!

QQj0kqccSfMV9ZtLGOm7Dw.text: Food was pretty good. I had eggplant parm with pasta. He had an alfredo dish with Cajun shrimp. The marinara was a little orange and a little too sweet for my liking, but that is just personal preference. If you like tangy sauce, you may not like it. The eggplant tasted like it had a little nutmeg. Excellent. The alfredo and shrimp. Excellent.   They bring fresh bread after you order your drink with a thick pesto olive oil. Very good.   We had the tuna tartare for an appetizer. Very good.   Now, the reason for only three stars. You guessed it - service. Marco G was prompt when we arrived, getting our drinks fairly quickly.    A few minutes later when the bread was gone, so was Marco. The kitchen area has a glass window, so you can see all of the guys in back - talking, laughing, eating with their mouths open, and showing each other stuff on their cell phones. More laughing. Meanwhile, boyfriend's drink runs out, and it's 30 minutes later and we don't have our entrees.   I can see this being the type of restaurant where it's about Italian family (most of the men had hair to their shoulders) where everyone is one big family and guests are included. This could be okay for someone who is drinking wine and hanging out for a two hour dinner. We were not.   Oh, and the fungus nats from the plants were bothersome. I told the girl on the way out that if they put an inch of sand in their plants, it should stop that problem. They are attracted to vinegar, which of course, I had balsamic on the table in a little bowl that I had to constantly watch.   So overall, good food for a decent price, if you have a couple hours. We will not be returning.

H0A3SfYoeTYRwuvyFouXOQ.text: Great service, great environment, amazing specials that'll make you completely forget about what's on the menu.

UiUsDNiwUEtpc8KVfuGEgQ.text: This restaurant is located in a strip mall so you wouldn't think that the place would be that nice bit it is. Food and service were great! Decor and atmosphere were kind of romantic. I recommend it.

I love that everyone working there is Italian makes it feel so authentic. You can't go wrong on anything you order. Sure to make you a regular. This place is perfect for foodies.

kUycCWsas_dpXBA-KG3_cw.text: Prosecco where the food is just the beginning, we started with wood-fire pizza principessa style and the service was amazing. vCxW13JFv1Sv0VAtAECa-A.text: I'm fairly new to Vegas and was in the mood for Italian. Working at a fantastic fine dinning Italian place for years I find myself somewhat picky. To my supreme satisfaction Prosecco far exceeded my expectations. I had the Lobster and my girlfriend had the chicken parm. I cant say enough about the sauce and the hand rolled pasta but it was excellent. Marco was are server and really made us feel welcomed and at home. Finally if you do have a chance to make it out you need to have the tiramisu for dessert, it will change your life.

hAaYOBPK871qQYoaR6xMmg.text: My husband and I came here for our anniversary tonight. This place came highly recommended so we decided to give it a try. It was pretty slow in there so we were greeted by the server quickly & he got our drink order. Nothing crazy, just some waters & an iced tea. Then he quickly went over the specials, which didn't seem to special just like slight variations from menu items. We ordered the Burratini appetizer and a ruby salad. They came out relatively quickly & tasted great. Then we ordered our entrees. I got some raviolis & my husband got the special filet medium rare. My food was good, there was one tough piece of asparagus, but whatever, the rest was good. My husbands steak, however, was over cooked. When the server came over, he informed him the steak was over cooked, the server kind of froze and another server came over, the steak was brought back to the kitchen where the cook poked at it, then she brought it back & said "it looks pinker in the kitchen light". My husband was so shocked he didn't know what to say so he just decided to eat it. My husband didn't want to cause a scene, but he's a chef, he knows how a medium rare steak should look. Pro tip: when the customer says the steak is over cooked, YOU GET THEM A NEW STEAK. Don't argue, that's not cool. Dinner started off well enough, but we won't be back. Bad customer service.

GlopgmVUm6eEYjEBoaSeCg.text: Nice atmosphere. Good selection on the menu. Prosecco salad was delicious! Margherita pizza was good. All food was light and not greasy which I enjoyed. A lot of fresh ingredients. Fettuccine bolognese was a little bland but it did the trick for lunch. Fairly priced.

7C2pFEf4CXUz8BbLO7THew.text: Great Italian food. While driving back from boulder to Vegas we decided to give Prosecco a shot and we were not disappointed. They started us out with their amazing house baked bread served with an incredibly tasty olive spread; which I could have eaten 4 baskets on my own if you let me. For appetizers we had 2 orders of the Bruschetta and a Calamari Dorati- a perfect start. For the Insalati we ordered two: 1. the Heirloom Caprese, the Burratta (mozzarella) was perfectly creamy and salted and the heirloom tomatoes were tender and sweet and the EVOO they used was of the highest standard. 2. the Ruby, which is abeet salad with goat cheese, pecans, and greens drizzled with a sweet vinaigrette. The perfect combination of sweet, bitter and crunch We loved both For dinner we ordered family style: Margherita Pizza - this I did not get to taste my 15 year old devoured it before i looked up. He said it was good  Agnolotti di Zucca - a pasta filled with butternut squash and ricotta cheese in a sage sauce. Light and delicious Tagliatelle al Salmone - pasta sauteed with salmon and in a vodka sauce. Perfectly cooked pastawith just the right amount of cured salmon and vodka sauce not to overpwer it. Spaghetti e Polpette - spaghetti and meatballs. The pasta was a perect al-dente the meatballs very tender and the marinara scratch made Fettuccine Tocco - fettuccine with braised short ribs. OMG the short ribs were so tender you could eat it with a spoon We finished dinner with 3 desserts and coffee: Cannoli - reminded me of little Italy NY Banana Nutella Crepe - you can't go wrong with Nutella And the chef's special an Apple crisp served with a Tahitian Vanilla Gelato. We enjoyed everything here. The food, the service and the ambiance is 5 star

B-bwA7p6cSsy8X8siSHqsA.text: Place is perfect!  Food is amazing, Service is amazing and the Price is on point.  So happy to have discovered this place, and so happy it exists.

PxA0atOgthk06HGDdSKtWg.text: By far, some of the best pasta I've had in Vegas thus far (just moved from Chicago about a month ago). Came in for lunch yesterday with a coworker and ordered the butternut squash and sage butter lunch special. Had a side ceases salad as well. Everything was literally perfect. Even their bread and oil was delectable. Definitely planning to be back soon.

A definite stop if your craving great wine & some beautifully executed Northern Italian fare. Thank you Chef Danielle.

oVzGh5C2S0kzip3Y4bj3ow.text: Great atmosphere that accommodates to larger parties and/or for couples. Food is very fresh/authentic Italian and the staff are very professional. Dinner prices are reasonable, chicken limone was fantastic and the vegetables were cooked perfectly (not all come with sides though) . Appetizers are semi-expensive relative to the size, they are more proportioned to serve 1 person, we had the Brutta which was great. We will still like the restaurant and will go back, but please work with the back kitchen staff on maintaining quality and consistency. Hopefully it will be better next time.

cxlvGoBok1BVk4bDP_Z6rQ.text: I don't know what rock I've been under, but we dined here tonight for the first time and it was amazing! This is the kind of place Las Vegas needs more of. Fabulous upscale neighborhood restaurants that are authentic and food focused. We had the salmon special and a grilled pork chop special and both dishes were executed to perfection. From appetizer to dessert, nothing disappointed. Tonight they had a guitarist playing a great mix of contemporary and classic tunes. It really made the experience memorable, reminding me of the nights we spent in Rome dining al fresco with live music playing in the square. I look forward to returning so frequently we're considered "regulars". Perfection.

U4A5HNp3MmAqkX3iSyeLdw.text: Came in for dinner the other night... The place is really clean and the ambiance is nice.  Right as you enter, the smell of fine cuisine is in the air.  We get seated and start off with the calamari which was great.  The olive puree they have to dip your bread into was different, but delicious.  Most of the pasta dishes there are pretty standard.  However, my review is mainly about the special truffle cheese wheel pasta.  First of all, don't have your server make it... have one of your chefs come out to prepare it.  The server was splashing sauce everywhere and really didn't look like he has ever been in a kitchen before.  The special tasted horrendous.  I asked the server to taste it and we asked him, "Is it supposed to taste overly bitter?" Guess how he replied... "I don't know, I've never tasted it before".  Really?  REALLY???  They were kind enough to take the special off our check but go elsewhere for pasta.  Grand Lux inside Venetian or Giada at the Cromwell will satisfy you more than this spot.  "Thank you, next!"

_qnlucwfr49e9HDAEwT0EQ.text: Great Italian restaurant for those who live around the area! Highly recommend!  FOOD: Everything on the menu is made fresh. The chef is there every day and comes up with delicious daily specials. The pasta dishes I recommend are their raviolis and their pasta in the cheese wheel. The cheese ravioli is my favorite dish here because the sauce is made to perfection. The cheese wheel is not only a delicious dish, but is also comes with a table-side presentation where they mix the pasta in front of you.  DRINKS: They have an interest bar with a wide wine and cocktail selection. I highly recommend the Southside, it is my favorite drink here. The bartender is really great at making the drinks to you liking and will fix any drink if it doesn't come out how you want it.  SERVICE: The waiters here are very friendly. I am most shocked that they are very knowledgeable about the dishes. The waiters are able to tell you how the dishes are prepared, what dishes would be best for your liking, and they are even able to bring out the dishes and serve them properly. I had a fish dish and the waiter deboned the fish as well as split the serving without the customer having to ask. The manager and chef even came out to my table to introduce themselves and make sure everything tasted good.  ATMOSPHERE: The restaurant is beautiful. They bring out candles, bring up the blinds when the sun is setting, and have a gentleman playing the guitar and singing to set the mood for the restaurant.

FjHdiQ3ZT-VhPHFO3MxHjQ.text: I'm giving the three stars because the service was excellent. The food is mediocre. I ordered seafood linguine. It has a fancier name on the menu. My husband ordered the fettuccine tocco. We also had a carpaccio appetizer. I really don't want to be hyper critical or mean. There was so much wrong with the meal that I did not even want to tell the restaurant staff because it just sounded like too much. The seafood was overcooked except for one clam that was hiding under my Langostino. The pasta is cooked very well and the sauce was delicious. My husband's dish included fresh egg pasta which had been prepared very early in the day and reheated to a point of becoming like a pudding. The short ribs were slightly tough and bland the only flavor was the flavor of the red wine. If you were in the area, I would suggest that you try one of the other really amazing Italian restaurants that are very nearby. We tried. Something new instead of our usual choices and we regret our choice.

ip5AlEkvvUd_Cs2_IAKCxQ.text: Great, fresh, flavorful food. A unique menu with multiple dishes that you don't see elsewhere.   My new go to Italian place.

Kekq78B1RUdKR7-mOB35fw.text: We just finished dinner there no less than 20 minutes ago and to be honest we were very disappointed. We were dining with our my mother in law who was turning 69 today and we explained as such to the beautiful hostess.  But there was mention throughout the evening by any staff member of the special occasion, nor at dessert which is fairly commonplace.   To further add insult to injury, we arrived for an 8pm reservation  of 4 at 7:56 but weren't seated until 8:19.  I get that there are some uncontrollable aspects with multiple other parties not clearing their table as expected, but no offset was ever offered.  No compliementary cocktail, no appetizer compliementary of the chef, no apology whatsoever.  Overall the food was very mediocre at best. The bread was delicious and the large portion of herbal dipping oil appeared fantastic, but the reality is the oil was it was seriously lacking any seasoning and tasted more like grass/herbs than a typical higher-end dipping oil for the price points in this restaurant.  We ordered the special octopus, which was a huge portion but terribly under seasoned and nothing compared to the top octopus in the city at Milos at Cosmopolitan.  It was effectively chargrilled with no seasoning at all.  It was she first time I have ever had to salt octopus.  We ordered the sausage entree which was fairly spicy and fringe undercooked which hopefully does not come back to haunt us tonight.   We ordered two pasta dishes of which one was a B and the other C-.  Both were heavy on the pasta and light on the ancillary components that sold the dish: the meat, cheese, and veggies.  Finally we had the "people's favorite" pizza with artichoke and prosciutto which was okay.  It was a white pizza which the menu didn't describe, but the waitress happily brought a huge portion of marinara when requested to supplement.    Overall we were just sorely disappointed as first time guests for an avg check of $26 per person before alcohol.  With so many delicious Italian options on Eastern, I don't see any of us ever coming back to Prosecco.

S_8-qE5pLj58wIc73yIOeQ.text: Food was wonderful! Best Italian around. Chicken piccata is our favorite. Server was attentive and wine was great.

pCUp3qmUg5Xu6lytZd2z0g.text: We've been living in Vegas for 3 years and i thunk we've finally found an authentic Italian flavor and atmosphere.

2RLG4h1pOSkKthyZXPl7qg.text: Nothing was wrong here - in a sea of great Italian options in Vegas though, it just seemed a bit mediocre for me. Service was fine, not exceptional. I think we had a pasta dish and a pizza, and neither stood out. The decor was trying to be trendy and hip, but it wasn't quite there. If this was in a small town I'm sure it'd be the top Italian place, but there's a half dozen Italian places I'd go to in Vegas before returning here, I think.

zzeIMqLJvNNMluyQmZPk0A.text: SUMMARY: If possible, I'd rate 4.5. The food is very, very good---but portions quite small, and delivery charge is high at $6.  Overall, $40 spendy for 4 pieces of ravioli, 3 ping-pong-sized meatballs, and a piece of tiramisu size of a *small* square drink coaster.  DETAILS: Stumbled upon Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen on a night when there was no food in the house and decided to order out. It is too expensive to do this very often, but it was incredibly delicious, fresh, and thoughtfully and expertly prepared.  My Order:  Agnolotti di Zucca ("Moon-shaped pasta with butternut squash and ricotta cheese sauteed in a light butter sage sauce") -- very modest portion, but exceptionally good -- hand-crafted pasta, like a ravioli, the sauce was just as described, perfectly seasoned, and accented with a jot of fried sage.   Ordered a side of meatballs, which was fortunate, because the portion of the entree would have been insufficient a meal -- with the 3 meatballs, it was perfection! The meatballs were scrumptious, served in its own little container with a flavorful marinara sauce, with a little bit of accenting cheese over the top, and bits of fresh basil. They mischarged me for thee meatballs at $6.00---I later learned their standard charge for THREE MEATBALLS (which, again, are ping-pong-ball-sized) is $18.  The meal also came with wonderful, fresh, bread--and an herbed dipping oil. Complex, subtle, and delicious.  One review said that this very oil "needed seasoning," by which I'm guessing they meant salt.    However, one of the *best* parts of this restaurant--unlike most of the quite pedestrian restaurants you can order from in this region---htheir restraint in "seasoning" (meaning: salt) throughout the entire meal was a relief, and let you actually taste thee natural flavors--not just a salt bomb.  For desert I tried tiramisu--which was wonderful, and in keeping with the thoughtful "seasoning" of the savory dishes, it was not overly sweet. Most places in the Las Vegas Valley, I ave found, smash you over the head with sugar. This didn't.  My first impression was the tiramisu was on the teeny tiny side. However: like everything else, it was of the very highest quality, and in factm among the best tiramisu I've had, with slim slices of homemade, ever-so-slightly sweet cocoa/chocolate "bark" perched on top in addition to the traditional nice bitter cocoa dusting of tiramsu. The cream/custard was sublime. And there was a wee dollop of chantilly cream to the side, along with a spriglette of mint. The only misfire of the whole meal was a 1/2 maraschino cherry in the cream. At first I thought it was a raspberry, which would have been nice, but a maraschino cherry? An ironic wink, perhaps? But unnecessary.  The meal before tax and delivery-tip was $28---for one smallish but delectable entree plus 3 very modest-sized meatballs.   The delivery fee of $6 seemed high.  All told, it was $40 with tax and delivery and tip.  This quality of restaurant--the elevated taste--is rare near Henderson.  Most places that deliver, particularly, tend toward mediocre, run-of-the-mill, and/or chains.  Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen is unique, smart, creative, and could hold its own, and be popular, in any major city with an educated clientele with high expectations and discerning palates. But for me, given the price, a once-in-a-while splurge!

eFKPet7GQu9dAwR6W0R2Cg.text: Nice ambiance, good food, and fresh ingredients. The beef carpaccio and beet salad were amazing. Their spaghetti meatball wasn't the best but no complaint because it tasted fresh. Pasta was perfectly cooked. The lobster tail linguini was really tasty. Lobster was a little salty but the dish was delicious. Saw someone order baked parmesan eggplant with a side of spaghetti that looks really good. Definitely going back.

GNXV26tA5zeyOQ3LffuCjA.text: Wow! Great food, great service, lovely setting.   Whenever I try a new Italian restaurant I have to try the Margherita pizza to see if they know what they're doing. L'ottima! The best. This is a genuine Italian thin crust pizza made with quality ingredients. The smell and taste will transport you right to your favorite pizza pie in your favorite Italian town. Another thing is that they charge a fair price, which makes it taste even better ;-)  We had Marco as our waiter. He was excellent. Great customer service. He made some suggestions for us based on my questions. He also was smart to consider our vegan thing and so instead of bringing their tapenade which has anchovy (as I recall), he brought plain EVOO to go with their delicious bread. Being vegan/vegetarian customers, we got the capellini with tomato and basil, and some squash ravioli with sage. We also got a big bowl of minestrone soup. Everything was absolutely delicious.  We met one of the owners Alessandro who was a friendly and charming guy. It was fun speaking Italian with him. We will definitely return, we had such a nice evening here. The ONLY reason why a 5th star is not added is due to my choosing to reserve the fifth star for delicious establishments which offer all organic food.

Z3APNSUE8AmhOXPxWXys7w.text: Solid solid food. Great bread and salads which is key to getting things started. The salmon was seasoned and cooked perfectly. Definitely going to be making the trip back in the future when I'm in town!

6Cb1Rej-0xC2MTIDMCflYw.text: Wow. What a nice cute local place much needed in the 89052 area with all of the chain stores. Food was so good. Caprese totally delish but ask for extra basil leaves. The olive spread with bread yummy. Bartender suggested Sonoma's Champ De Reves to accompany the melt in your mouth Chilean bass. She was so on point describing the wines and her take but unfortunately coincidentally this was her last night. I will absolutely be back.

Rpfdg8nztXySWlhvsCf9sA.text: Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen is a must try. The staff was very polite, non-pretentious and always knew when we needed a refill on our drinks.   First we were served some fresh hot bread with a side of I believe it to be a pesto like olive oil.   If you like beets, the beet salad was wonderful, combining just the right amount of beets, goat cheese and candied nuts with a light dressing on a bed of greens.  Second course; was the butternut squash ravioli's in a sage butter sauce, Also equally delicious.  I would have liked to try their desert but I was to full but will be going back again.  Great for a casual, yet sophisticated date night, great lighting with a nice ambiance. Prices were reasonable but not cheap either...for the quality of the food, prices were fair. Look to spending for 2 people with drinks, appetizer/salad, entree and shared desert at least $100.

HeoLxUNljY97YGfskmI98A.text: This was a very nice restaurant with good food and good service. I wasn't crazy about the anchovy olive oil dip for the bread. Would have preferred plain olive oil and vinegar or herbs. Linguine with seafood was very good except the muscles had no taste. The linguine with olive oil and lemon had an Alfredo sauce on it which when looking at the menu, I wasn't aware of that, so I didn't care for it. I would go back and try something different and give it another chance. I liked the atmosphere and music. Large wine selection too.

ydq8CDZGbeMlvgqr645KmQ.text: Fantastic food and wonderful atmosphere, its definitely a restaurant for ages 12 and up. This is a high class restaurant with amazing pasta dishes and more. I would suggest only bringing   those 12 and up since there is a full service bar and no kids menu. Also the dishes are made the Italian way with wines, which will put off those with a younger palettes. Great for date nites and special occasions, its a must try in my book.

MHiYXuz5xu8VGyKAYd4aOw.text: My first visit at this place was disappointing and upsetting .  I have severe gluten allergy and informed my waiter of this, my food comes out with bread on it . No apology I send it back and within two minutes it comes back with just omelet no fruit bowl . I send it back as I knew that they just transferred the omelette to another plate.  So then the waiter finally takes me seriously and my friends are almost done with food and I'm still waiting for mine .  The second time omelet was much smaller with no sides . Very disappointed and walked out hungry . Way over priced and subpar service .

J07n_iW8_PVCmE6JbkdF6A.text: Great food, service and price. I went on a Sunday afternoon, no waiting for a table. I was seated right away.

1MGI4H0k6N2igDPhEZed9A.text: After having been delighted at Nora's we decided to try Prosecco. Overall good food, couple areas of fine tuning  Ambiance Mod/European interior with a mix of industrial exposed ceilings and fancier touches like crystal chandeliers and modular art. A mixture of tables, semi-private booths, and more private booths.  Feels expansive and open yet intimate and warm.    Service We were seated quickly and then waited some time for service although servers came to check on us.  Most likely a factor of needing to fine tune team work. One of the owners (the same one who'd seated us) passed by and asked if anyone had helped us and took our drink orders. Later someone else (I think the other owners) told us about the specials. We then placed our orders.  The appetizer came quickly, but the food took a little longer. The guests at the next table looked over at us and asked if we had our food yet as they hadn't received theirs either. I am guessing that there may have been a miscommunication in the kitchen.  We received our food shortly after.  The owners made multiple attempts to turn the evening around as they sensed there was disappointment among the guests regarding bringing out the food.  He offered us free prosecco on the house and a free creme brulee.   I believe that intentions of the owners was for us to have a superb experience and I truly appreciate that.  All of the evening could have been smoother with just more communication among staff.  Sometimes it is not about being "perfect" with regards to businesses, rather to do anything to show that you appreciate the business of your patrons.  Having been a part of opening a restaurant before, I know there are small kinks here and there.  This place has a good start and plenty of potential.  Food 1) Cocktails: Well flavored and balanced.  Spritzletini was one of the drinks and I loved the presentation and flavors.  Nice combination of fruity and aromatic.   2) Appetizer Bruschetta: nice balance of fresh-fresh tomatoes and herbs.  Crusty Bread.  Also the bread basket with tapenade was amazing!!!  They refilled it for us without asking and I'm glad they did! 3) Caesar Salad: nice of the staff to split it into two bowls, going that extra mile. 4) Shrimp and Lemon chicken entrees: Shrimp was jumbo and plump, juicy and sweet.  Sauce tasted really good.  Medium sized helping of pasta.  Sauce slightly on the saltier side, roll out those margaritas....oh....wrong place :)  Lemon chicken hearty with lots of vegetables.   5) Creme Brulee: on the house - beautiful rustic chic presentation with meringue cookie.  Nice touch!  Mojo 1) Go for the ambiance, a nice place to spend the evening and catch up with friends (new and old).  Take a leisurely time and have dinner like they do in Europe: a night of conversation and finishing with cappuccino...and/or fruit/chocolates. 2) Get the cocktails, ask for the dessert menu.

20EPFCi7yKky0lQ578mg3w.text: Had my New Years Eve Dinner here, a chicken dish. It was bland and bone dry. The service was attentive perhaps because of the holiday...the chairs at the tables near the bar sank so low I felt I needed a boost just to sit in front of my plate. I'm a very tall woman, so that seemed very odd to me. Had to sit on one foot to be at the right height. Overall was disappointed in the food. Which really is the point.

02BGzwtvV31mHHSo44JJ0g.text: True Sicilian southern Italian cuisine.  Excellent food, fantastic service. There is a classy bar serving the full menu as well. I make sure to stop by the bar when Teya is working for very good service and conversation. Perfect "off the strip" location in Henderson to bring a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3t4AZjHhUU90k3FhgFJ_RQ.text: We don't live near Henderson so when we do and we are hungry we have to pick a worthy place . This time we hit the nail on the head with Prosecco . This restaurant in a big strip mall is kind of unassuming but is really good .   We ate at an odd time (2:30pm) so we were the only people on their patio . Service was Very attentive although the servers weren't under any pressure. Everything was attended to very quickly and courses were served back to back with no overlapping .  The dishes we ate   Caesar salad - very good salad cold bowl and cold lettuce added to the wonderful crunch . The chunks of Parmesan in the salad were great and plentiful.   Prosecco salad - mango , heirloom tomatoes , avocado , Persian cucumber and a nice creamy balsamic .   Capellini pomodoro- really good angel hair with a light red sauce and basil . Really good classic dish . The Pasta was very fresh .  Cheese ravioli -The best dish of the day. Gray raviolis in a light creamy cheese (beschamel ) . Every bite a gluttonous delight.  Truly a great pasta dish.   Overall we will be back again  . Even if we don't have to be on that side of town.

rlDc3q5AevCtrAHqmMx2Pg.text: Great Italian restaurant with great service. I've been here a few times and this place does not disappoint. Perfect place for a date night or girls night out. I've always sat at the bar since I'm a speciality cocktail type girl I always feel like everything always tastes better at the bar. I have not tried anything here that I don't like . Lobster ravioli is a must.

-kprQEDidpjjLEk0hP0b8A.text: If you'd like to be treated like trash this is the place to go! Worst experience in dining . We were excited to try this restaurant since we'd heard great things about it but I will make sure everyone knows what lack of customer service is provided here!  I originally reserved a table days before to ensure our seats. Unfortunately they didn't listen to me when I told them the amount of people. When we arrived and they realized it was a smaller party they hurried us out of the original table we were seated at to move us to another. The way they rushed us like cattle was upsetting. The server was abrupt and lacked of personality from the moment he asked what we wanted to drink he acted as if we were a bother to him. The server and the owner treated us as if they thought they were better than us.  This is not fine dining! This is a local business so act like it! Treat people as you'd like to be treated. Las Vegas is known for customer service and this restaurant sure missed the mark.  As I was leaving I told one of the employees that I would be speaking to upper management and he laughed at me and let me know he was the owner. He sure didn't act like an owner, an owner would be sincere and apologetic and would try to improve the situation not antagonize the guest.  The only apology we got was from the hostess who mistakenly reserved for a larger party. It's too bad we didn't get to try the food here but I won't be coming back here or recommending this place. I'm disgusted with the way my family and I were treated.

q0SUX5kAi-V8u3U8ZxHqUA.text: My husband and I were out in Vegas for my birthday and decided to find something more local to eat at vs the average buffet. OMG was I super thankful we did and that we found this amazing place! The service was amazing, food phenomenal and atmosphere was very relaxed. We will definitely be coming back!

xeYcOpuPXwhrHdfVsOPCxQ.text: First visit here last night. Very nice experience with food and attentive wait staff. The staff were (almost) literally stumbling over each other to help. I'm experiencing some serious stomach upset this morning, posting this just in case someone else is too.

9jFRUeb1_StBRGbleTpzXg.text: It's not your True authentic Italian restaurant. Yes their pasta is homemade but nothing really special. The sauces were good but no wow factor. Service was excellent.

zoitcahreNKSFsmflwPQMQ.text: Last 2 visits have been meh. It's starting to get that tired feel. Wait staff is extremely annoying, constantly refilling water glass after each sip, or rushing to pull away a dish the second I finish my last bite. Here are some tips for all the non-Italian wait staff that get jobs in Italian-owned restaurants: this is not Olive Garden. Food is served in courses: antipasto, primo, secondo, then dessert and coffee. Do NOT ever remove a plate that still contains sauce. And for GOD'S SAKE don't ever bring the food all at once!!! Repeat after me: served in courses. C-O-U-R-S-E-S. Get it? Let the water glass be empty before rushing to interrupt the conversation to refill everyone's glass. What you think is being "attentive" is actually excruciatingly annoying. Get with the program or go apply at Olive Garden and serve unlimited breadsticks.

FgQMDk6KQRKsZMyDqKTSdQ.text: Reserved for a large party of 20 people for Sunday brunch.  They had the tables ready as soon as we got there and we were seated immediately.    Wait staff was very attentive and prompt.  We had a couple people in the party order bottomless drinks and they kept the mimosas and bellinis coming!!! You can get bottomless for $19 and choose between 4 different drinks or just order by the glass for $6.  They are all very tasty so a great way to start your morning.   They have a variety of options for brunch, most of the party ordered the steak and eggs or the lobster ravioli.   Food was delicious, my steak and eggs were cooked perfectly, seasoned just right and the ravioli that I tasted had a plentiful amount of lobster and shrimp.     A great touch to a relaxing meal was the saxophone player.  He's very talented and we're surprised he was able to keep going without a break during our entire meal.      Great food and great service.

cvpqXTOEr2LU-XSbHBcROQ.text: Food was really good. Casual decor with a high end serving style and presentation in a strip mall. Not what I would expect, but very happy to find this place.

hX0bkWrl519q_pxbhipFTg.text: Get off he strip and head towards 215 and Eastern. Close drive from tourist traps on strip. Most amazing Italian food in town! Totally worth the drive... you will not be disappointed. Promise!!! Great wine list to accompany homemade daily pasta entrees. As local, 2nd visit here and will be back again!

zAIx8JJqDp-zKPnKl47rzg.text: This restaurant is a jewel tucked away in the Regal Plaza. Fresh made pasta, porcini mushroom ravioli with truffle sauce! Everything was excellent.

OjEfXbQzsEVjxugS0zwufA.text: Love this restaurant! Went for New Years Eve and ate in the Bar. Tia is the best bartender she makes us so special every time we go! Food was great and the staff is awesome

K6DP_u2WOStoga6CXrYFkA.text: I have had great food in Italy and for the most part haven't had anything close to what I remember. My meal at Prosecco was fantastic! The lasagna was awesome. Service was great. Really great food. Totally surprised there is this level of quality Italian food in Vegas.

iBXP9_dnnskJnfRhGf0KPA.text: God! Italian food should be a sin -- for it is the most tempting savory in the world! Speaking of the taste: this restaurant has it. Prosecco knows what I like before I order it. I took my friends to dinner to celebrate my promotion, and we all wanted to go to a place where we can get overly-happy and make some noise. Well, we ordered the out-of-this-world tasty food and had our cocktails and wine and got loud and happy (thank you, friends!)...and then the Food came...and we all got so quiet....We all looked like predators over our plates. I ordered the Organica salad & the Scaloppine dish...and I surrendered to the exceptional taste. My fiancee ordered the Italian fillet mignon...Filetto di or al Manzo...and we waltzed in pleasure. I let my friends pick the wine...and, boy, mamma mia, what a finesse! Clink! An extra 3 miles of running next day was worth it for the scrumptious desert: Raspberry ...Bavarese al Fragole..! I truly, friendly recommend this awesome Italian restaurant. Take your significant other or others (LOL) and have an authentic Italian cuisine experience. Loved it! (it matched the quality of my promotion, haha! Vedi Prosecco e puoi ...mangia, mangia! Long live Italy!

AEN0Rt98RNbSe0LyDKMktw.text: Best italian restaurant in vegas , the owner his great and the chef is from italy so the food is amazing like italy. . Grazie Domenico for opening this delicious italian restaurant in vegas

HDwROII5PafWlTFNAtL5cw.text: The service and the atmosphere were excellent. Marco was our server and he was very attentive and had great recommendations about every aspect of our meal. We had a great anniversary dinner!! Will come back for sure!!

2xPiZr9vxrLqUFp0xnWTxQ.text: I had a friend coming for visiting and she likes wine, so I was looking something close from henderson and special. I looked on yelp and i found this place. This is an excellent place to relax, talk and have a great wine. They have a lot of different types of wines and the service is exceptional. We ordered 3 differents types of food and all were GOOD!! The decoration of the place is super chic and comfy. The only thing I will say is a little expensive. I think if they reduce their prices they will have more customers.

lYPJ8fcFgX3ZN60Z35O2lw.text: I stopped by after a hard workout and the Sunday brunch was so worth the treat! I the tagliatelle salmone had so much flavor and wasn't so big that you couldn't finish it. I also really enjoyed the mini souffle that was a special dish for the day! The atmosphere was pretty and light. I can't wait to come back.
