rWqbM78PXbleLrf22nTSHQ.text: Highly recommended this place.  Food,  service,  drinks,  staff - all top notch.  Hidden away in a corner I found this place on yelp.  Thankfully they had room at the bar and I treated my friend to one absolutely fantastic meal.

kVfmeql79-6oAy3YFqljxQ.text: First time being at this restaurant. Oh the food were so good. They provide you with good bread with oil. Short rib was so tender and flavorful. Salmon was big and cooked so tender. The best part on top of all the yummy dinner was dessert! I usually order tiramisu every time I go Italian restaurant. Tiramisu here is far more beautiful and sophisticated flavor. Not so small or big. Just perfect!  Service was great. I will definitely come back here. Highly recommend this place!

cSo4mAU-gpHQjH1EGVtgIw.text: The service sucked! The water I asked for didn't come for 30mins after I sat there for at least 20mins when I flagged the waiter down. I had to "order" the free bread because they never brought that out. The manager with the ponytail visited every table but ours. The food was dry. This entire dinner process took about 3 hours while I saw people come and go. Overrated and overpriced.

uvSixBpEbX-wq25AJvS3aQ.text: Fantastic food, excellent wine cellar, delicious desserts.....what more does one want? Oh and great ambience as well!

vdeyt8E2XAUrDxnVzapzMg.text: Great addition to Henderson restaurant scene. Spaghetti and meat ball marinara was phenomenal. Calamari  perfectly cook. Ruby beet  salad with candy pecans was phenomenal. All entrees came out hot and fresh. Service was excellent and a great atmosphere will definitely come back a lot.

ZnQ4nJC_5s5qYaUBKcS4Pg.text: After seeing the location I was very hesitant to even try this place. But man am I so glad I did. The food is on point ! I've got to say is probably the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever had in my life. Highly recommend giving this place a shot.

dWECy2p8YwvN4jQi0GcZ5A.text: This place is amazing!! Niko and his staff were extremely friendly, attentive, and accommodating. We ordered the bottomless mimosas and the "Oceanview" omlett and both were phenomenal. In terms of mimosas, I'd have to recommend the Rosini but all of them were great. All-in-all, it was a great brunch. The bartender Brandy kept the drinks flowing and really added to the overall experience. Try it....you won't be disappointed.

mSEj5aNOGdGre1VyW2V3KA.text: the food was amazing!! When I took my first bite it was like heaven. The server was very friendly and on top of things. Will definitely be back. I was there Halloween night and our server was a a man. Wish I could remember his name but I think there was only 1 server there but he did a great job anyways. Of the owners see this great service.

5Dzb9c7H5GhfftpyTfAsBg.text: I have been noticing that the previous Italian restaurant was replaced while riding by on my bike. I was sure this would be an improvement. It was in many ways. The decor is a fresh, clean and bright feeling, much more up to date than the old red and white, typically dark Italian restaurant. The food tasted very good. My husband had Caprese which was a step above the norm. I had the quinoa and hazelnut salad which was very nicely underdressed and had good flavor. The dipping oil for the bread did not have the taste of the herbs in it, and might have been better with some garlic or balsamic in it. The bread itself was very good. My husband had linguine with clams and loved it. I had a ravioli with gorgonzola and asparagus creamy sauce. The flavors in mine could have been more pronounced and the homemade pasta was undercooked. For dessert we shared a custard with strawberry coulis. It was not too sweet and a nice way to finish off with something light.  The service could have been friendlier, such as giving us their name and pointing out the special and fundraiser. Also, the I initial contact and bread were slow in coming. Water filling was prompt. Food service was prompt. Service overall had a hesitant feel, so perhaps this can be attributed to their being open only one week. One if the owners came and spoke to us, which was very nice.  We felt the prices were high, so we cannot go often, but we will return

uQxVSileYjWAFBBahvF7Mg.text: Great food great service . Will come back again give it a try .  The best Italian food I've had in this town

DP19a-VcyFcdIWODeaWdww.text: Tomahawk ribeye was awesome! Our waiter, Marko, was excellent and very knowledgeable about the menu. We came here on a whim and I'm so glad we did... We will definitely be back.

c9CHR8u_hkNwNjZWoo5txg.text: We had a great experience here on New Year's Eve, and it was our first time! We sat at the bar and our bartender was phenomenal. She was so personable and talked about how she was from Chicago (which is where some of our family is from). Our drinks were made really well. My husband had the Fettuccine Tocco and I had the Ravioli. Both were very good. There was also live music, which made the night even more enjoyable.

A3QpsBGx8d9hlrGFPVNziQ.text: All I can say is 5 stars all the way. The service was excellent we were waited on hand and foot. The server bent over backwards to make sure drinks were full and we had everything we needed. Food was delicious. We all had the lobster supreme. Absolutely perfect. The presenation on the plates was also spectacular. Desert was also delicious. Hands down one of the best Italian restaurants in town!

OEUN7VFKf1R-IrNclO8BUw.text: The best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas  Thank you for the Amazing food and the Fantastic service

jtjXgFwWCUSABGXRJJ24Bw.text: I love Italian food, so I'm always up for trying a new Italian place. I'm sorry to say, this was a huge disappointment. I ordered the squash ravioli (or whatever it's called). It was green pasta (?) with an aftertaste of fish. I didn't eat even half of my dinner. I couldn't get past the fish taste. For dessert, I ordered their version of creme brulee. I don't know what I was served, but it was unlike any brulee I'd ever had before. It was served cold, and what should have been a crispy layer of caramel on the top was actually a layer of something greasy, like butter that had been melted, then poured over the brulee, then put into the fridge. I don't understand how anyone can screw up creme brulee, but this place certainly did it. No, I won't give it a second try.

fJErXZSiXKucc3vbLiuNjQ.text: Overall Pros: -Lovely environment  - Friendly staff -Since we were sharing the salad and entree, they brought out the food on two separate dishes -Nice presentation of the food  Cons: -Noise easily travels, a somewhat loud environment  -Tables are close to each other - Chef Platter was underwhelming  -Rotten tasting seafood  Ordered Ruby (salad) Chef Platter Linguine Mediterranea  First time here,  will not be returning.   The reason for the two stars is when we ate the mussels in the Linguine Mediterranea, it tasted completely rotten. It was not edible and I immediately spit it out. It was so revolting we cannot even think about the seafood used in that meal.  The main reason I go to a restaurant is the food. So even though the service and atmosphere was pleasant, I can not look past the quality of the food.

3fy_cvXrKKzuQsmpG7-4wg.text: Came here for their Sunday Brunch (we arrived around 1ish) and there was a few parties finishing up their meals. We were immediately sat, but it did take a minute for us to order our drinks (ordered a glass of Mimosa & The Venetian). We were given waters and shortly after our server took our order as well. We decided to try the Carpaccio Cipriani, Pizza Margherita & the Banana Nutella crepe.  I'm not gonna lie, I wasn't impressed at all with the Pizza Margherita - it looked delicious, but as soon as we both took a slice from the plate & all of the cheese slid right off.  The middle of the pizza was just drenched/soggy when we took a bite as well.  I'm usually not a fan of Carpaccio, but I did enjoy the dish.  The Banana Nutella crepe was delicious, probably my favorite out of what we did order. Our server was on point as well with his timing when it came to serving us our crepe while we were pretty much done with the first 2 dishes.  Also, I did appreciate that he didn't forget about my order I wanted to take home with me, but I wanted it towards the end of our meal so it wouldn't soggy.  Service was amazing!  They also had a live sax player while we were enjoying our brunch! Played some good songs too!

MsupdwBNP4OsyxP6R3zvGA.text: We've had a very wonderful meal with the rockfish and a ravioli. I'm very satisfied and would definitely dine here again

Ijt-zRPh8w5-m2_tuKh8IA.text: Came here for date night and I love the look of this place.  It is fancy but also semi-casual.  The decor is bright and fresh and I could just sit here all day.  I have been meaning to come here for a while so I was quite excited.  The bread and oil was good at the beginning and was actually a really good size.  Too much for the two of us.  I ordered a Cesar salad as an appetizer and that was pretty good but too pricey for what it was ($9).  My date had the Lasagna all'Emiliana and loved it.  It was a very good portion and very tasty!  I unfortunately cannot find what I had on the menu anymore so they either change their menu regularly (which is a good thing) or it wasn't popular.  Whatever it was, it was delicious and there was a lot of it!  Even if there wasn't a lot of both of our portions we would've been satisfied because they were so luxurious and decadent.    There are a lot of Italian restaurants in the Henderson area and although this is right over the border, I consider it close enough.  Many don't hit the mark but this place does.  I will definitely be back here.

54sTtMn6lSLr7yU2H9drrg.text: From the high review this restaurant is holding, I ordered their food for delivery. The estimated delivery is very accurate. We got the foods with everything came along w it in a perfect way including well- prepared utensils set. My angel Hair pasta is delicious & the raviolis tastes fresh & there is nothing to complain. We got a perfect meal right at home with a good quality

Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-lVz77dJXB9c7iO9b2UzJA.text: Such a wonderful restaurant with tasty food and EXCELLENT service from the hostess, bartenders, waiters, servers, and the chef! We went here just last night to celebrate my sister's birthday. She had the squid ink pasta with scallops and shrimp and, since it was her birthday, she added a lobster tail on top for good measure! My brother-in-law had the lamb with saffron risotto! Mom had the spaghetti with lobster tail. Hubby and I had the Parmesan cheese wheel prepped pasta with shrimp and truffles! The chef came out personally and kept shaving more and more and more truffles on it! It was MAGICAL! Then, to top it off, they came out with a delicious strawberry shortcake/cream thingy with a candle in it for my sister (free!). Thank you so much everyone for helping a special day be even more special!

0XMQW9ZHxbrgnjvSIKinRw.text: This Is the best place ever because I ordered the lasagna and they made it perfect! I feel like if you are reading this, you should try out the lasagna it was super good! The cheese was topped perfectly and the waiter was so nice! He was always offering stuff and recommending stuff. These people are SUPER nice. They deserve a good review. Totally recommend

3ITTEhvf_7IRwB-7AkLJGw.text: Best find in Henderson!   WARNING: Prepare yourself because you will crave this place multiple times a week. The authentic italian cuisine and service is awesome! I'm actually addicted     Tonight I have to brag about my dish called the Ossobuco special. My taste buds are going insane at the moment. This dishPerfectly braised short rib, with a rosemary red tomato sauce, on a bed of saffron risotto. One word: Omg!   7/20/18 UPDATE: I went to another highly acclaimed  Italian resturant here in Henderson. I had their Ossobucco and at first bite, I realized I had become an Ossobucco snob for the rest of my life because of my experience at Prosecco!!! They use the finest ingredients and know how to cook it right with saffron (not cheap! But worth it!) The way to eat it is to first, break off a little piece of rosemary, with some meat, bone marrow and a little risotto. The flavors will melt in your mouth like a beautiful melody in your mouth. If you are lucky enough to have this on special, I can't recommend this dish enough! Overall, my Moral of the story is, you haven't had authentic Italian Ossobucco until you have had it at Prosecco.

xMNFBBAlYanzpCjiVIVm4g.text: A tasty little find. Not wow'd, but satisfied.  We had reservations for seven and arrived fifteen minutes early. The hostess invited us to sit at the bar, where the attentive bartender gave us a pleasant start for the evening. Our red wines, including the house "Hanh," were both very good. A little past half an hour later (that's more than 15 minutes after our reservation - longer than anyone else's wait), we were seated.  Our meal began with the bruschetta. It was smaller than we imagined, but it was packed with flavor and the various textures kept our brains intrigued. Definitely something to try.  When we had asked our waiter between the two salads we were eyeing - the Ruby and the Caprese - he initially recommended the Ruby, but then remarked that the Caprese "is a classic." We got both and although the Ruby was downright delicious, the Caprese was unremarkable. The heirloom tomatoes lacked flavor (possibly because we just had the bruschetta) and there was one leaf of basil, almost like just a garnish. The mozzarella, however, was creamy, fluffy, and sweet, so that was a small win.  By this time, I was already full, so I'm glad we only ordered one main dish - the cheese ravioli with asparagus sauce. After the delightfully complex Ruby salad, we were expecting something with a bit more depth. Yes, it was good - full of cheesy goodness; the gorgonzola made its presence known without being overwhelming. However, it didn't blow our minds and I think we should have tried something seafood based, which is what everyone else seems to order.  We wanted to try the tiramisu, but we were full, concerned that it wouldn't be worth it, and it had gotten late; our babysitter would be expecting us.   All in all, we're happy we went. It just wasn't our night - half of the food we ordered didn't live up to the hype. If we had a redo, we definitely would make some different choices.  Pros: Wine selection, attentive staff, and the Ruby salad Cons: Unnecessary wait without explanation despite having reservations

LxWJUNXns5FwkMgKcklsoA.text: il migliore - the best.  Loved it and why did I wait so long to come here.  1.  This location, 21 years ago was an Italian Restaurant called Round Table Pizza. Ate there once and always wondered why it was always empty.  2. About 3-4 years ago, another Italian restaurant opened up, called Gabriela's Italian Grill and Pizzeria.  It had a nice decor, nice dessert area and a beautiful kitchen. Ate here twice.  3.  Today in the last year, Prosecco opened up with two guys from Italy opening it and I wanted to try it for a long time. It was THE BEST!  Food -  We went for lunch and they have some great lunch specials for a reasonable price that includes soup or salad.  However, I asked if we could see the dinner menu and if we could order from it.  Pulpo - For an appetizer, we ordered grilled octopus on a bed of couscous.  So tender and tasty was this octopus that I am not sure why I usually order Calimari.  this octopus was tender and juicy.  The couscous was perfectly cooked al dente and that made the taste just right.  Veal Chop - I decided to try the Veal Chop because I have been having this at other places and found it to be a bit hard to make.  Here, the Veal Chop is on the bone and incredibly juicy, tender and flavorful.  A nice cut of Veal on the bone is perfect here and where many places make this a bit tougher, you can tell that this was a quality meat cooked to perfection.  Osso Buco - I always order this as my go-to when available to compare Italian restaurant.  This Veal Shank has meat that falls off the bone and is so succulent and juicy that you cannot believe it is meat.  I am not sure if I actually chewed it or swallowed it.  OK, joking but wow, I was impressed.  When you get great service, with great food cooked amazingly tender and juicy, what more can you ask for as a great meal?  I say check the place out asap!  You will look up.

WbdIGYCA9vzHcu_Y41agEA.text: Though one of my Italian guests had been here before, I had actually never heard of this place even though it is 10 minutes from my house. We made reservations for 4 and the table was ready when we arrived.   The interior was stylish and the staff was top-notch.  We started with the Bruschetta VG, Carpaccio di Manzo GF(Beef), and the Carpaccio di Polipo GF(Octopus). It was all great including the octopus, which was new to me served as a carpaccio.  Moved on to the Minesttrone Soup, Caesar salads and the Heirloom Caprese.  We shared the "Pasta in a Wheel" which was fun. You are paying more for the show. $28 per person for a minimum of two people. But that came with 4 plates. Nothing really stood out other the show. $28 per person for Pasta, cheese and cream is a bit over priced. Like I said, it's fun and you should always order it once.  I had the Chicken Marsala which was wonderful. Another guest had the Tagliolini Neri al Granchio (seasonal) Black ink pasta tossed with Dungeness crab meat and roasted garlic in a light creamy sauce which was very tasty. There were just a few small pieces of cartilage in the crab which is expected.  We passed on desert but I can see coming in after a movie for desert as they look yummy.

5A3VJ9tVMEgll62ZyI9W7w.text: Pasta and service are excellent. Fresh made pastas on menu.  I had the Chicken Parmigiana and both the Chicken and the accompanied pasta were tasty. My friend also disliked the Ravioli d' Aragosta.  Our waiter was very inattentive. We could tell he didn't appreciate the fact we weren't having cocktails or wine. My friend waited for a soda refill for quite a while. I ordered dessert from the waiter, he repeated my order back to me, but came right back with the check - he didn't even put the dessert in. We paid and left, sure we won't be back here.

cOS_LB7zVEc1P2FVZl6WeA.text: Five of us went to Prosecco for the first time based upon the great reviews in yelp. The restaurant looks very nice and seems to be clean but that made the first issue strange. My place setting had a knife which had a dirty spot on it. I pointed it out to our waiter and asked for a clean knife. His helper came by to fill our water glasses and since our waiter never came with a clean knife, I asked her to replace it. This is mid afternoon and there are empty tables all around us so their is no excuse for a dirty knife to be on a table for more than a few minutes before it is replaced. There was a gentleman in a suit who seemed to be the manager and a young lady standing near the entrance so I got her attention and mentioned very calmly that I had already asked our wait staff for a replacement knife and nothing had been done. She finally got some one to bring me a clean knife just before our meals were served.  Now for the food itself. We had 5 different choices from the large lunch menu at our table. The pizza was not good with an oily crust and the lasagna was just okay. The chicken masala and eggplant parmigiana were tasty and the sandwich looked very good. The presentation of all the dishes was very nice but the food itself was just okay. We expected more from a restaurant of this caliber.  Our waiter did split the bills for us but got the two credit cards that were used to the wrong person. He had a 50/50 chance and blew that too!  This was the first visit for 5 of us who eat out a lot but won't be returning here.

plrJpfau6ljZdj70DXtjAw.text: What a find! Service is excellent and the food was even better! My husband ordered the filet mignon. It arrived well done instead of " medium" as ordered. He mentioned it to the server but really didn't want to send it back as he had already tasted it. Our server insisted on making him a new one and would replace my meal so we could eat together. I kept my meal and they replaced my husband's. My husband said his filet was the best he had ever had. I got to taste and it was so tender and delicious! We will be back for sure. Corkage if you bring your own wine is a little high at $30. My only negative but not worth losing a star over!

9zWpAqMvGi0fK2z-EhrCeA.text: Go!  This place is so delicious!  The quality of food was superb and the flavors layered. This is not your average Italian dinner, it is several steps up. One of their specials was making fettuccini tableside in a wheel of Parmesan with a porcini mushrooms sauce--this looked incredible! Unfortunately being diabetic I couldn't order it but I did drool when it was being prepared at other tables! Our bill was $80 which is not bad at all for an upscale date night--we will be back!

fvoBws_o75BrHxCkwvgqoQ.text: Really amazing Italian kitchen. Awesome atmosphere, service, and of course great Italian food.

VTfnpZlbxHpMF7TO7xGMnA.text: I live in SE Las Vegas.  My sister and I gave it a try for lunch at 11:30am on Oct 3, 2016.    SPECTACULAR.  Ambience:  inviting, modern, hip, non-pretentious.  Best use of orange I've ever seen. Attire:  consider dressing casual with a bit more effort    :-) Menu:  much enticing variety. Food quality:  casual gourmet, noticeably fine ingredients. Food prices:  Very Fair.  Pasta entree $12.  Big soup $7.  Coke $3. Presentation:  Artistic, classy.  Probably the best you'll get in zip code 89123.  Service:  MUCH better than most LV restaurants.  Hostess - classy, warm welcome.  Server Juan Carlos gracious, professional, impeccable level of service.  The Chef personally presented our entrees, including a magnificent ravioli truffle special-of-the-day.  Juan Carlos and his assistant kept our drinks full, anticipated our every need, made appropriate menu suggestions.  Thank you for a WONDERFUL spontaneous dining experience.  My sister and I enthusiastically tipped 25% on this lunch.  The owner's attention to detail and quality is so important to him that the restaurant's business cards have his personal cell number on it.  I called owner Giuseppe moments ago to congratulate him on his marvelous dining offering, and he answered the call after two rings!  (He was mixing drinks at the time and was delighted that I called.)  And then he called me back five minutes later to add more information to the answer I was seeking.  How's THAT for entrepreneurial excellence!  I recommend Prosecco Italian cuisine for a bright and cheerful lunch with your sister, for a romantic afternoon or evening dinner date (with someone other than your sister), for a business lunch, or for any well-deserved meal in a casual setting but with first class service above and beyond what we Nevadans usually get at other equally respectable restaurants.  My next visit to Prosecco will be a date night.  I'll catch a 7pm movie next door and then go for a later dinner seating.  Caveat -- although the dining room stays open later, last call to place a dinner order is 10pm.  As of today (Oct 3) their website is not up yet.  But for questions, just call them.  Again, they're very gracious.  A very refreshing lunch or dinner experience.  They're newly opened.  Try it now while you can get a good seat -- it's a matter of time before their reputation makes them the new hot spot in the area.  Thank you for a superb lunch.  Johnny (with Jessica) in Las Vegas

4s43xBmgZgGXsC0JXAmZOQ.text: The attention to customer service was amazing! We came in 30 minutes before they were to open, but we were happily greeted by the host Nick who introduced us to the head Chef Daniele. Even showed us around a little where their bar and wine room was. We definitely didn't mind coming back in 30 minutes and they did not disappoint! The food is so fresh and delicious! I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and it is SO good! The meatballs were moist and flavorful and the sauce was like simmered for hours. Waiters were all friendly and checked on us throughout our meal even when it got busy. I will definitely come back and try their desserts. Prosecco is located next to the Regal movie theater on Eastern and Pebble and it has outdoor seating as well. The decor is modern contemporary and it has a vibe of fun without being pretentious. I'm so glad this place has opened here. This will definitely be my new favorite Italian restaurant go-to.

ET4VzGacFDrXCZBjy6H76g.text: Customer service is good, our delivery arrived early right at dinner time and our delivery driver didn't mind my crazy dogs at all, but our pizza isn't cooked all the way - it's so doughy & floppy on the inside I can only eat the crust. dhtsHmOkAZ8kJ7VODVcpig.text: I had the lasagna. It was overpriced and bland.

xdRx3guHqArpov9qmgVn3w.text: I've tried this restaurant twice now, and the first time it was decent, but the 2nd time around I'm not so impressed. The location is nice, with pleasant decor and outdoor seating.  The tables and chairs outside are a bit cheap in quality, as they are wrapped in a plastic wicker cover, and they've decided to place an untethered seat cushion on each seat.  This arrangements is a bit frustrating on two levels, the seat cushions easily slide off and/or move so you have to be annoyingly cognizant of what you're sitting on, and, the plastic wicker table obviously has holes in it, so be careful not to spill anything as it will drip through and on to your pants/skirt/legs.  The Staff was courteous and friendly each visit and pleasantly accommodating. The reason I gave the review two stars is for both quality of the food and for lack of concern when the problem was pointed out.  We ordered the mixed cold cuts and cheese appetizer for two, which I would have expected generous portions provided since the appetizer was $30. Instead we got paper thin 4 slices of Mortadella (Italian bologna), 5-6 small slices of Prosciutto, and 4 slices of salami (ea. paper thin and the size of 50 cent piece).  There were 4 small cubes of cheese (unknown kind because the waiter didn't bother explaining what's on the plate), a dollop some marinated green peppers, a dollop of some marinated mushrooms, one small artichoke cut in half, and 5-6 Kalamata olives.  There's no way you convince me that was a $30 appetizer. I've had much better at other restaurants for half the price. (So I would recommend avoiding that at all costs) The quality problem was actually with that very same appetizer.  Parts of the Mortadella were dried out and had the consistency of a potato chip.  There's only one way that could happen, and that is the meat had been previously sliced and not stored properly, as the meat dried out and hardened.  When I pointed this problem out to the waiter, he said he would let the chef know about it.  Sadly, 10 minutes later the waiter came back as though nothing had transpired, and asked "So, how was the appetizer?"   Needless to say, neither the waiter, the chef, or management ever came by to address the problem with the meat.  I guess I was just expected to eat it and pay for it, regardless of how it was mishandled. The other issue I had with the dinner that evening was the timing.  After we got the appetizer, it literally took 35 minutes for the entree (pasta dishes) to arrive. So about 10 minutes to get through the appetizer and 25 minutes of waiting for the next plate. At the end of the dinner, as we were leaving, the waiter checked with us and said "I hope everything was good" and I replied "everything except for the appetizer" and his response was "Yea, sorry about that."   Well, I'm sorry too, but my sorry is that I'm not going to be spending any more money there anytime soon. Overall, nice place, but needs some significant fine tuning.

_3_G3z1l6PvUqXaCBv37Xw.text: Great authentic Italian food.  They had live music on Sunday for Brunch which was a nice touch.  We will definitely be back.

FkKwaJdfE7S_zTKWiVjftw.text: Been here twice, and both times it's been on point!  I definitely recommend this restaurant. Cocktails are great too!

tO_XqNI8sKEh6qExgL_g8g.text: Came here with a group on a Friday night. No reservations and got a table quickly. Service was good. Everyone enjoyed their meals. We ate a LOT of bread (because it was yummy) while we waited for the food to come. Will come back.

ZWbHCffMoWJb5QfGOCnVPg.text: Great spot for good Italian. We sat in the bar with the bartender, Nicole. She was a sweetheart and made great wine and entree recommendations. The Burratina appetizer is delicious. So are the pizzas. We had the Bianca - so yummy.  Great spot for neighborhood Italian.

ejfZXLB3p4tFonI531BH8A.text: We were seated for 20 minutes before the waiter came to greet us and waited another 10 min without drinks before we decided to just leave.

BEM11BQEzJsl-LNK-q8k3A.text: Fantastic food in a beautiful restaurant!  The flavors are very authentic with impeccable service.  So great to have Italian this good in this area.  Bravo!

-7E47MU-B_S72wKuduXFOw.text: The only True ITALIAN food in Henderson!  The best True Italian food I have tasted in years. Customer service is was perfect. Like Vegas use to be 20 yrs. ago! Every part of our visit was perfect!  It's all about the customer! And perfect Italian food! Thank you so much!

T3gVCddeZxhA8m1-2rOciQ.text: had dinner there for new year eve very good deal 75$ 5 course meal food was very good, you could feel the touch of a family owned restaurant, simple fares yet done in a complex manner, like the lentil soup, or the flourless choc cake ill be back for lunch and dinner great value , easy to find from the 215...

ftRcrLRZhYfcuVURIUhoRg.text: Although we waited 15 minutes before anyone came over to acknowledge us the manager and waiter deeply apologized for what happened and everything from thereafter was a great dining experience. The food we had was UNBELIEVABLY AMAZING!!! I had the special Osso Bucco with Saffron Risotto, my wife had the Cioppino, my girls shared a pizza and pasta with meat sauce. We have found our new Italian restaurant to eat at and it is close to our house will definitely be back!!!

x-ce4jF9jdeojv5RKBWZvg.text: Had a spectacular lunch outdoors--the hand made ravioli and osso bucco was delicious And perfectly prepared! Can't wait to go again.

U8zzLp0DfxNWvXhX3wOgpA.text: Great food at fair prices. The carpaccio and calamari were excellent. I had stuffed salmon and it was awesome

jgwUpKYayvGgYOhIxHSQwg.text: Simply amazing!! Everything about this restaurant is amazing! Great ambiance, friendly servers, music, and food! We loved the flavors of each dish. Finally an authentic Italian food on our side of town. We will definitely be back!!

hnx6LT4YwH19mqEdVzDDjQ.text: I was given a ridiculously small portion of pasta when I ordered from this place through Eat24. I would say to anyone thinking of ordering here find someplace else.

vKVixm05q0hRCmvlXEbspA.text: Love this place! Great bread, reasonable prices and nice happy hr! Lobster ravioli is awsome and great patio!

z8fWj3rqSECxBrVQy7e2Dw.text: Came here less than 40 minutes before they were closing and my boyfriend and I were greeted with the best service. I'm use to restaurants being extremely irritated when you dine in near closing, not this place. We were seated immediately and our server or servers (we definitely had more than one) came over timely to take our drink order. The place wasn't crowded but there was definitely a steady crowd for a Thursday night. While my boyfriend had wine I opted for just water so I can't speak on their wine selection but from what I saw they have a book full of different red and white wines. I ordered the Caesar salad and my boyfriend ordered the minestrone soup. Both were absolutely delicious. The salad is big enough for 2. I couldn't finish it by myself so we ended up sharing it. They brought out bread with some type of olive oil dressing/spread. Whatever it was, it was good. When I asked for vinegar as well our server kind of looked at me dumbfounded for a second and then brought out vinegar but with no saucer bowl. Idk maybe that's an east coast thing, olive oil and vinegar with bread. I had the spaghetti and meatballs and it was absolutely superb. The sauce was simple and delicate yet flavorful and the meatballs were big but not too thick whereas they end up dry in the middle. The meatballs were delicious down to every bite. Towards the end of our meal a gentleman who seemed to me as though he was the owner came by our table to check on us and ask about our meal which we raved about. This place has a romantic and sophisticated vibe. I love the design. The bar area has TVS which truly gives it a different vibe over in that area. Overall we enjoyed our food and will definitely return.

Rhv4EsTuckDJyFBBHqB7ug.text: Very good ambiance and an awesome job by the waitstaff.  They really seemed to be in concert.  The food was great, and the Cream brulee was fantastic.  Perfect birthday meal.

E-sC8Z2hDzJDsJhD5CJ1tQ.text: Good food, good service, can't go wrong.  Patio is great this time of year. My favorite dish is the fetuccini tocco. Calamari is a great appetizer.

swXMJGhmzQt1LMply440Uw.text: I ate at Prosecco on 3/17/17. My wife had the shrimp pasta special and I had the salmon special. The service was excellent and the meals were sooooooo good that the taste stayed with me after I left the restaurant. Highly recommended

L0v_HTdrXAjSjrcaekSNKw.text: This place is new, and it's a hidden gem.  Drop everything and make your way over there right away.    The menu is familiar in some ways, but nearly every dish has a fresh twist.  I enjoyed the fettuccine with braised short ribs--a combination I've never seen before, and I'd go back for more tomorrow.  We met the chefs enjoying their own late night meal at the bar.  They're both Italian and well versed in the local eating scene.  Their motto, "You eat what we eat."  And they eat very well indeed.    P.S.  Ignore any claims of poor service.  Marco (and Joachim!) made us feel as though we were in their own home for dinner.

mxbjm441HkiM-vgCcDsgKQ.text: I went there for my dad's birthday and the food was phenomenal I also thought the atmosphere was family friendly and casual and the food was 5 stars,the price is very reasonable for the quality of food you receive.

6RSc5GfMUsI4R3ShptEJ4w.text: If your looking for cheap spaghetti and plaid table tops with a wine bottle candles you will be disappointed. If you are looking for a hip restaurant with a True Italian flair then you are in luck. Atmosphere is great. Not a quiet dinner spot. It's vibrant for a better word. Wonderful set up. Open kitchen. Modern bar and great patio.  The food shows a real Italian sensibility and flavor.   The owners are more than skinny jeans. A real love for the business and the desire to please. Nico is a great guy who hopes the draw of style and friendliness isn't the only draw....they want you to love the food.  Good ingredients aren't cheap and cheap ingredients aren't good.

SC5dcBhAhUC6Xfhoy0kOMQ.text: Everything was great especially with the addition of Walter. Walter makes you feel like family. Prosecco is my new favorite restaurant in Henderson. Good Luck Walter and good move Prosecco

JxbJVRCSQzNCVnV7ciSIsA.text: I liked the very modern and cozy restaurant, 5 stars for the food and good service. for sure they will return to eat

N_apKDjWsE2U5URZjrt-AQ.text: Came to check out this new Italian restaurant in Henderson. First of all, the owners are present and friendly. When you first walk in, Nico is here with open arms and eager to show the beautiful restaurant off.   The decor is modern and bright. There is an open kitchen where you can see the cooks make fresh pasta and cook in the wood fired oven.  We had an appetizer of crostini with fresh tomatoes and ricotta served with cured meats. All the entree were cooked perfectly, my eggplant melted in my mouth. My roommate had the Cioppino and I got to taste some and it was fantastic.  They also have a happy hour that I glimpsed at the menu of and I'm definitely coming back for a $7 pizza and a $9 waygu burger!   This place will be a local gem. I can't wait to see how it grows!

05RxXGuzhYEIrkIdvFIS3w.text: Delicious dinner, attentive staff.  Tried the Chilean sea bass w/lobster sauce special and lemon pasta dishes, both fabulous.  The apps, dessert and wine list weren't disappointing either! Will be back!

We came for an early Valentine's Day dinner and enjoyed an extended evening w our friends... 5 hrs +   I enjoyed the Penne Vodka w chicken and hubby noshed on the Osso Bucco   We also snatched a piece each of our friend's Margherita! Yummm, Napoli style!  Food is the closest you will get to eating in Italy.   Location is ideal as well... right off the 215 / Eastern   Qui, si, se mangia bene!  Your constant companion,   ~deirdra

FrUGNYpXvFborX-FYy7z_w.text: The food here was actually wonderful. Compliments to the chef. I had the moon shaped pasta stuffed with squash and a sage sauce. My boyfriend had the surf n turn. We were both really happy with the flavors and quality. Our waitress was very polite and friendly. We sat outside because there was a nice breeze and we were the only ones out there so it as really nice and private. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the hostess kept calling me ma'am (most women do not like that so I am not sure why it is done). But I am not going to deduct stars because the food was so good and everything else went so well.

Gq-2r7c1OdliW8s5JjCIkg.text: We had a terrific brunch today. Attentive service and delicious food. And a very handsome manager!

RC4R5Z1d03HXwTLKKdUrhA.text: This is hands down my favorite authentic Italian restaurant ! Everything on the menu is delicious . We had the fried octopus to start and beet salad . Then I ordered the special which consisted of striped bass, mussels, clams, lobster, and shrimp. The dishes had so much flavor we really enjoyed our meal. We've been here a couple times and it's always been good.

VBzkRRLrjalqsTQ28imaJg.text: I was here on a Saturday early evening after wedding. We took a chance as we didn't have a reservation. We were told we could sit at the bar or at the few small tables in the bar. Very tight in the bar and the dining room. I am not a large person by any means.  But to walk to get to the bathroom I had to go through the dining area and turn myself sideways to get through.   It is like this throughout the whole place. At the bar were 4 younger adults two of the girls sharing a chair. They were fowl mouthed and loud. They apparently knew someone who worked there.  As far as food I will comment on what I ordered as it was awful.  I ordered the Golden Knights Special.  Consisted of 3 beef medallions in special sauce, giant prawn, potatoes and veggies. Let me tell you the beef was horrible. At first I thought it was the sauce. So I scraped off the sauce. Nope. Than I went to try the second medallion. Nope.  It tasted like rotten meat as well. The manager did come by and ask how the meal was but this was prior to me trying the medallions. He never checked back. I did mention it to the bus boy as he cleared my half full plate. He said sometimes we get a bad chef.  I guess I complained to the wrong person. After we left my husband said I should have said something to a manager which I'm surprised I didn't but just wanted to leave.   The prawn was huge and very good but as for that beef it left a rotten taste in my mouth all night.

qvVHVzu26BBhu6pzh85YOg.text: I decided to order for pickup because my kids wanted Italian for dinner. First, they got a really good menu, and everything on the menu sounded really good. I got the spaghetti marinara with meatball, and my kids got a cream pasta, mixed in with a little tomato sauce. I cant remember what it was called, but overall, the food was fantastic. This restaurant is very close to where I live, so now, this has become my go to spot for Italian food cravings. Definitely give this place a try, I can confidently say, you won't be disappointed.

JfHD9peS2kAGD9tE2oS0Eg.text: This has been a restaurant I've been meaning to try! I am so glad I did! My boyfriend and I went out for a date night and this was the perfect spot. It's hard to find a restaurant this nice off of the boulevard. From the attentive, welcoming service to the perfectly set table and INCREDIBLE food... everything was wonderful. I highly suggest the lobster ravioli; it blew my mind.

2kVfjzVVgkc3vv2KTLdU2Q.text: This restaurant was a perfect fine for patio dining. The food was excellent everything was fresh and homemade. The kids choices were excellent. The service was top-notch very attentive and friendly clean and lots of big portions. We will definitely be returning

K5zy3uba0Ck40xMp5GbSvg.text: What can I say about this restaurant? It's awesome! This neighborhood restaurant is a great place to have a nice dinner with family, friends or date night. The staff is friendly and very attentive. Even the owner/chef walks through to check on the patrons. The menu is not overwhelming, not too pricey and the food is terrific. We had the Linguini and Stuffed Lobster Tail and Spinach Pasta with African Shrimp (huge shrimp!). There's also a bar area with TV's to have a cocktail if you prefer. It is a small place so I would recommend making reservations We can't wait to visit again in the future and highly recommend it.

cPxhfNReQq4RIiZEeYYShA.text: Oh My God! This restaurant is a gem tucked into the Regal Plaza at Eastern and Pebble. My husband and I celebrated our 27th wedding anniversary with friends here. The waiter and entire wait staff were fantastic from the hostess to busboy. The food... I'm Italian so I'm used to good Italian food. I ordered one of the specials which was a veal chop with potatoes and carrots. I could have gnawed on the bone! Hubby had the lobster shrimp ravioli and he cleaned his plate. My friends husband had a huge piece of lasagna. I've never seen him eat that much and that fast! My girlfriend had the Chicken Marsala and enjoyed it very much . Then Tiramisu, creme brulee and a strawberry crepes! I thought pricing was good, not cheap but won't break the bank either! Go to this restaurant!

8XHsK6Pr7HQZbYJD2jV9AQ.text: My first time dining here was incredible, and I forgot to write a review so here are my two reviews for my experiences at Prosecco. (Yes I came back within 2 weeks because it was THAT GOOD.)   First time: They serve complimentary warm bread with pesto which is to die for. No shame that I ate almost the entire mini-loaf of bread and left one piece for my partner.  Ordered Burratina as an appetizer. It was delicious, fresh, and plated beautifully. The prosciutto was crispy and delicious. I could have eaten an entire meal of just that.  For my entree I had the Agnolotti alla Piemontese which was one of the best pasta dishes I've had in a long time. The ravioli were clearly handmade and the creamy truffle sauce was rich and flavorful. I made sure to use every last drop of sauce because it was so delicious.  We shared a bottle of Prosecco which was chilled and refreshing on a hot summer day. The atmosphere was nice and we had an amazing time dining here. The owner came to the table and we mentioned a hilarious review we saw on Google about a delivery driver hitting on someone's wife. We laughed while reading it, but the owner was distraught. He told us they use GrubHub for deliveries and this person was not affiliated with Prosecco at all and was NOT an employee. He was extremely sad that this bad review brought down his overall rating, which shows he cares about his customers and his reputation. He chatted with us a long while & offered us some Limoncello on the house.   Second time: We enjoyed our last meal so much we decided to come back for dinner again within two weeks of our last time dining here. This place is truly a hidden local treasure.  We once again ordered the Burratina (the fresh mozzarella and crispy prosciutto will have you coming back for more too, I promise.) I once again ordered the Agnolotti alla Piemontese because like I said before, I have not had such a rich and flavorful pasta dish in a long time. It may not seem like you get a lot of ravioli, but they are extremely filling and both times I could not finish my meal.  We shared a bowl of muchroom risotto which was probably the best risotto I have ever had. That is a bold statement because my mom makes awesome risotto (sorry mom). We DEVOURED the enormous bowl of risotto like it was nobody's business.  My partner had the Branzino fish which he finished so fast I wondered if he even took a breath between bites.   We love this place, it's one of our new favorites. We will continue to come back here for dinner. I have a feeling this is one of those places that no matter what you order, the food will be good. The staff are actually Italians at straight from Italy, the hospitality and service are amazing. Definitely recommend you give this place a chance!

At one point I had to get up and search for him because he disappeared. No apology. The service doesn't reflect the service you would expect for the prices you pay.

EIxFfg7aidynxAjpyg4AyQ.text: Love the food and ambiance at Prosecco.  Jozev on the guitar playing in the background was an extra, special treat. Nico, the owner, makes everyone feel special. ,

pHPW8dUQ46zX2tD6PiW5aA.text: Surprisingly wonderful Italian restaurant we sat on the patio and the weather was so nice. Their pasta is truly homemade we had the Fettucine Tocco which was ribbon pasta with braised short ribs unbelievably flavorful and the Agnlotti alla Piemontese a stuffed pasta filled with porcini mushroom and ricotta cheese with creamy black truffle sauce. AMAZING. I normally never indulge in pasta but this was truly so good and am so glad to of experienced what homemade pasta tastes like. Our appetizer was the octopus carpaccio and it was huge in portion and so delicious. The octopus was infused with lemon and a garlic sauce. To end our meal their dessert the Bravaresa al Prosecco a delicate Prosecco custard served with a strawberry coulis was light fluffy and the right amount of sweetness. Service is exceptional and our waitress Rhonda was wonderful. I highly recommend this place food-atmosphere and service was great

cDJe6d3qG8tzTit_FTXyQg.text: Came in with my lady and son for a lunch date.  The kids pizza meal isn't something small. It's a legit medium-large size pizza with fries. The kiddo loved it.   My burger was humongous as well, flavorful and beautiful.  My beautiful lady got the lunch option of lasagna, she ate it... ALL.  When we left she asked me "when are we goin back again?"

hLGhiCvJwLc2AIQ7yPX2jw.text: The service and dinner were impeccable. Prices were reasonable and it got pretty busy on a Monday evening in a sleepy neighborhood. Kudos to management!

fQf3s36twcT_G_vTNr8ClQ.text: What we had:  House bread and olive oil:  5 stars.  Tasty olive oil with herbs and olives.  Bruschetta:  5 stars. Nice crisp,  sweet tomatoes, well balance flavors.  Calamari:  3 stars.  Calamari wasn't crisp.  The batter felt too soggy in texture.  The sauce that wa served on the side was great and help add flavor and made the soggy texture bearable.  Veal:  4 stars.  Veal was tender moist and juicy. Risotto was okay texture wise,  it's the flavor of the risotto I wasn't used to.  I can't quite put my finger on it.  Maybe it was the taste of saffron.  Idk.  Overall I enjoyed it.  Margarita pizza:  5 stars,  fresh made tomato sauce from scratch really added to the freshness of the pizza.  The soft airy dough also make it enjoyable.    Lobster supreme:  4 stars,  lobster cooked perfectly.  Good flavors.  What you'd expect from a white wine tomato sauce linguine dish.  But it felt something  was missing.  A key ingredient to give his dish that "BAM"! Still a great tasting dish nonetheless.

zWrjzGaxs3dQjxCwvRhOSg.text: Out with the old  In with the new  I'm no being bitter just raw... I always read, see and digest reviews so I feel responsible to give an unbiased review.  Party of 4 (we are a rough group to please) drinks on point ok not fair we had two bottles but all were served rarely did we touch them.  Food on point to say the least I even used snap chat for our pasta wink I won't spill the beans ask your server.  Lastly service I know you want all Italians but hey one out of three makes my heart complete!  On a serious note give them a chance!!!

nWMfY7Prywckcrb5qNnnpQ.text: Love this neighborhood restaurant.  My family and I each had different dishes that we each enjoyed.  And service was great!!!   Lobster Surpreme  Thr pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce complemented everything. I would definitely have this again.  Burratina  I love love love burrata and this did not disappoint at all!   Clam Linguini  This was my husband's dish and he said it was good.  Kids Pasta with Marinara Sauce My daughter had this. The bowl was huge and we couldve split it between all 3 kids. She ate half the bowl and this is impressive for someone who doesn't eat much.  Kids Pasta with Butter Sauce Very flavorful. My baby had this and we had to bring leftovers home because it was such a big serving.  Kids Cheese Pizza and Fries LOVE that they put the fries on top of the pizza. My oldest only brought 3 slices home! She said it was delicious with ranch!   We will definitely be back!

49JkjdCpw8WcEmyFQ8OzdA.text: You won't be disappointed by the food or service at this Italian spot. However, what brings me back is the patio dining area.

oWtndZkKhoVqnDU4UtRn2w.text: We sat at the bar upon arrival and there was a really bad sewer smell. Luckily the rest of our party arrived and we were quickly seated. We started off with a glass of Presecco which was refreshing and delicious. They offer daily specials which are recited by the servers. On this night our server hadn't tasted any of the dishes he was trying to sell, and couldn't give us a knowledgeable answer. I ordered the Fettuccine Tocco - Rosemary infused fettuccine with braised short ribs. It was delicious. For dessert we brought home a slice of Tiramisu. The restaurant was slow while we were there, but had plenty of staff on. We would definitely go back for some great Italian food.

A_YB8CmAMYNTYu86lVv0_w.text: One of my new favorite Italian restaurants in the Henderson area. At first glance, you would never expect the inside of the restaurant to be what it is from looking at the outside. The inside is absolutely gorgeous and the customer service was amazing!  The pasta is made from scratch and when you taste it, it has a fresh taste to it. Very lite and fresh, which it was delicious. I had the ravioli with the asparagus cream sauce. I also sampled the chicken, and it was cooked perfectly. Everything I had here was lite, fresh, and not to heavy but with an absolutely amazing taste.   I will be returning here for sure. And A+ for the service, some restaurants it's hard to find how great of service it is here.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I3VcYQiK7PpaRMS8yXfUcg.text: Today was my first time eating here with my 9 year old daughter and husband. The atmosphere is wonderful. Classy but approachable. Out server, Joaquin was attentive and knowledgeable. We had wine, appetizers, main courses and dessert. At every course, we asked Joaquin what he recommended and he never steered us wrong. The menu of set items were perfect and the many specials were fantastic. I had a pork special, which was cooked to perfection. The osso bucco was the best I have had since I was in Italy. The head chef, Daniel, made an appearance from the kitchen as we were finishing dessert. He is so sweet. They also do brunch with sweet and savory items on Saturday and Sunday that we are planning to catch soon. I highly recommend this place for its atmosphere, staff, and delicious food.

vQIDYrXfjAsdvcCff7rDpg.text: Great Italian food in a very welcoming and also trendy atmosphere.  Usually modern and welcoming don't go together but this place somehow feels homey and trendy at the same time. The atmosphere is definitely appropriate for a date night or special occasion. The staff are super friendly and the owner even greeted us at the door. Our server was super funny and chill. I think everyone is actually Italian which adds to the authenticity of the place, it was cool to hear the different accents in the place, let's you know the food speaks to all people.  The menu is surprisingly extensive, the wife and I split the mushroom ravioli and the braised short rib pasta with red sauce. Sorry I don't remember the actual names from the menu, they were all in Italian, and our server pointed out how horribly I butchered his language (much to the humor of the rest of the table). I thought it was all fantastic, the mushroom ravioli seems small with only 8 pieces but was definitely deceiving, we agreed it was quite filling. The braised short ribs were cooked well and it was so umami tomatoey beefy good I definitely think I'll get it next time.  Drink menu looked good, cocktails beer and wine but we had after dinner plans so just split some coffee and gelato. They give you huge servings of gelato, definitely something to share!  I definitely recommend you try out Prosecco!

rN8lkwV4OwH56a_S8DgIsw.text: Great brunch!  Very attentive and amazing staff, wonderful food. A little hidden gem.

BAy172Gjx37GpaVd8CpVlQ.text: We were in the mood for Italian and decided to try a place we haven't been. Went at 4pm in a Friday and there was no one there, we were the only ones! There is seating indoor and out. It would be nice to sit outside in the fall/spring when the weather is nice.   Dinner begins at 3pm so we didn't qualify to order off the lunch menu. First bread was brought out. It was so crusty on the outside and soft on the inside, so good! The ravioli with the truffle sauce was the best, chunks of truffle in every bite. If you love truffle, this dish is for you. The scampi paprika had some very large shrimp and was also a great dish!   The kids pizza and fries is quite large, I wouldn't recommend it unless you have 2-4 kids to share it. The fries come on top of the pizza. It's a wood fired pizza and very thin crust.   For dessert we had the chocolate gelato. Also, large portion. But so delicious, tasted just like the gelato in Rome. The espresso was perfectly made as well.   The service was great. The restaurant is truly authentic Italian from what we experienced.

fVMGz5uhdysgodzwtxY39A.text: Came on a busy night, Christmas weekend. Made reservations and when arrived they told us they were going to move us to another table. After being moved we waited a while until we saw a server.   5/5 - We saw the Truffle Cheese Wheel Pasta and was impressed... Had to order it. It is a two order minimum. It comes with shaved truffles that didn't really taste like much. The truffle oil brought out more of the essence than actual truffles. I thought this would be a very salty dish but it wasn't that salty. I think that the cream sauce it comes with made it less salty. It was pretty good and better than when I had it last in another state. So I would say this is one of their better dishes.  5/5 - We also got the Chicken with Lemon and Capers. It was light and chicken was moist.   3/5 - The Linguine Mediterranean was average. Wouldn't order it again. Nice homemade noodles though.  4/5 - The Spaghetti and Meatballs was pretty light. The noodles were cooked perfectly and homemade. The meatballs kind of reminded me the taste of Vienna sausages. It was more on the pork and veal side than beef. It was light in color, almost white and very bouncy. The sauce was light and almost a pink color, as well.   4/5 - They brought out various Desserts and Lemoncello. The Lemoncello tasted housemade because it was very strong. The Tiramisu had a lot  of liquour, not my fav of Tiramisus. The Cannoli was nice and light, the shell was crunchy. The Strawberry pudding like dessert was light.  I would come back and try their other dishes and definitely get the Truffle Cheese Wheel Pasta again.

GqwgUfkY6XGfhHzEZJwopA.text: I have been here several times and this is definitely my favorite italian restaurant in town. The ingredients are definitely fresh and the food is to die for! Thinking of the food here is making me hungry right now...  UPDATE:  I came here recently with my boyfriend (we've been here numerous times now), and not a single time has the owner not greeted us. They have excellent service with other waiters who arent even designated to your table asking how you are doing!   The food us PHENOMENAL. Period.  -The chilean sea bass is quite possibly the best version of cooked fish my boyfriend and I have ever had the opportunity to feast on (and we eat a lot of fish!). It's INCREDIBLE! Go try it now before it is no longer a special! -The ambiance is nice. They dim the light perfectly--just enough so you can still read your menu without putting it right in front of you face like a blind woman, and just enough so it still feels romantic. -The butternut squash ravioli is my go-to every time and you cannot go wrong there! -Their bread and spread is the best. -They gave us a free creme brulee last time and my boyfriend doesn't even like dessert but he told me it was SO good he was going to eat it all! Haha.  Any food lover needs to come here ASAP because it is seriously amazing and you need to experience it at least once in your life!

lA850u7hn1fi2FX7NYesnA.text: This is one of the few restaurant that offer a real authentic italian food... The owners are italians and food is not loaded like usually the American italian food is. Pizza is really like in Italy but you probably don't wanna go for that since there's a huge choice of other good food. Something impressive is Pasta in the Wheel (it's called like that because they prepare your plates in front of you in a big parmesan wheel), the Fettucine Tocco and the Ossobuco. I'm italian and when I want to feel home I go there... I went there for lunch too and had a burger. Pleasure to taste an American classic prepared with the Italian high quality. Super suggested!

hL3_1JP-mtt2XY_DFzGkEw.text: It was our first time having dinner, we went to celebrate our 19 wedding anniversary. The place it has a beautiful decoration, staff very friendly and an excellent service.  I don't remember the name of our waitress but she was great and very knowledgeable about the dishes. Food is wonderful and delicious, My husband had a lobster tenderloin, pasta with lemon and butter and for me the ravioli. They send us a delicious desert with two candles for our Anniversary. All the food is handmade we'll come back again to try the rest of the food

MjQsOmP-PGZU4pP5DyvHdw.text: So this restaurant is close by to my house and I've been dying to come here! A few weeks ago I came here with my friend to have an early dinner here. Upon entering the place looks open and airy. It was a busy night and we got a booth in the back area. The place looks nice and clean. The waiter we got we weren't crazy about. It looked like he was just doing his job ... not very personable or friendly. No smiles or anything. BUT the manager that walked around to each table was super friendly and personable! he seemed like he cared about his customers that comes in there.. making sure they are happy! Before we got our meals he was already at the table greeting us and being friendly. We enjoyed talking to him.   Okay so I ordered a cafe latte to start and enjoyed the drink. The bread with the oil dip sauce was so tasty! loved eating it. Anyways we asked about the specials and opted to order one.. the fettuccine pasta with a pink sauce and a GIANT shrimp cut in half was on the plate as well. Well when we got the plate.. the shrimp was overcooked... it was hard and dry. the pasta was okay but nothing amazing. We sent it back and the manager made sure they cooked it right this time.. he even said when he brought the plates in the back and cut into it...it was indeed overcooked. The second time they made it the shrimp was cooked okay.. wasn't overly cooked. The pasta dish we opted for alfredo sauce instead tasted kinda bland... nothing amazing. Overall for this dish i probably won't order again.   I was impressed with the manager on duty tho.. he knew we weren't too satisfied with the second dish and took 1 plate off our bill.  I honestly really wanted to like this place! i wanted to try so many other dishes they have on menu!! but this experience wasn't too great on food and service. The only great thing about this experience is the manager who was extremely accommodating to the situation. He was super nice and charming. He aims at making sure the customer leaves happy or at least not mad. His customer service skills is amazing. He was hands on throughout the night and just awesome! the 3 stars I'm rating this place is for him!   Overall I would say that I wasn't impressed the first time coming here but am willing to come back again to see if service will be better with different waiter serving me.. and if the food that i order next will be tastier! :) I look forward to coming back for a second dining experience and maybe i can change my 3 star to a 4 or 5 star the next time around!

j-EPjHcHPqLx1hp_yiE1Lg.text: The food here is very good.  Owner comes around to ensure your dinner is good.  I've had the Sea Bass and the lasagna on two different occasions and it was very good both times.  Make a dinner reservation, or it can be hard to get a seat.

o8TGIHxjm0soPrYedqCcqg.text: Been looking for a new Italian place and finally found one. Service was outstanding. Food was great and priced reasonably.  Will definitely make that my new go to spot

rFuiz4G3vgWzvFY_DVXjnw.text: On Saturday night we dined here with friends. The food was pretty good, but I'm still cringing at the awkward service.   This is obviously the hot, new spot. I made reservations for 6:00 and I'm glad that I did because the restaurant filled up quickly. OpenTable didn't show availability, but when I called the restaurant they took my reservation.  Let's start with the food since this was pretty good. To begin we were given a bread basket with a sauce that looked like pesto, but seemed to be made with olives. The sauce was tasty and a nice step up from the usual bread or oil for dipping.   I began my meal with the Ruby Salad. I really liked this salad and the portion was large, too large for me to finish. The beets were tasty, the salad dressing was delicious, and the goat cheese was the perfect amount to round out the flavors. The Scampi Paprika didn't disappoint. The paprika sauce had a nice flavor and I enjoyed the simple spaghetti served with the shrimp. My husband had the Salsiccia e Rapini all Cabrese (sausage) and he said that he liked the dish. For dessert I had the Tiramisu. It had a nice flavor and was okay, but it wasn't something I would order again.   It's not often that I say this, but the food was overpriced. The Scampi Paprika was five pieces of shrimp with spaghetti so $29 seemed a bit steep on this dish. Even my husband's sausage dish seemed overpriced at $18 for a sausage with broccoli. Starters and dessert prices were comparable to what other restaurants charge.  I'm sorry to say that the service is the main reason that I probably won't return. I wanted to like this restaurant since it's close to home and located in a parking lot that is simple to access. It started with the wine. Long story short, our friend asked if they had Moscato and the server said yes, but returned with Riesling in the hopes that she wouldn't notice. The wine was served by a different person which made the situation more awkward and he was rather pushy with trying to get her to take the wrong wine initially. He ended up backtracking and insisting he would take it back if she didn't like it, but he'd already pushed quite a bit by this point. Through the evening it didn't seem like we had a dedicated server. I've seen the team approach at other restaurants and it works, but here it just began miscommunication after miscommunication which made the whole experience feel awkward. At the end of the meal a gentleman came by to ask if we could repeat everything we ordered so that he could prepare our checks. What? Why didn't the person that took our order share that with him? It was, you guessed it, awkward.   Overall, the food was pretty good and we enjoyed the evening with our friends, but the service soured the overall restaurant experience.

4zH-tk9S_W5sileDzDtcKg.text: Love the family atmosphere of this neighborhood gem! Vast menu, different specials daily. Excellent service. On my last visit I wasn't sure what to order, the owner came by our table and gave me options that neither were on the menu nor on the daily's special. The extra mile for service makes a customer feel heard and appreciated. The food is terrific. Amazing cheese board,  great steaks, fresh tasting pasta sauce. I would not only be back as I will recommend to others.

a7CysPM5ygR3OepcBaMD3g.text: Everytime we eat here we full, happy & satisfied! Emmanuel was an amazing server, very attentive and efficient!

iCBK_Ce9Co85dvWiEK9s5g.text: Solid brunch. Bottomless really means bottomless here and service is complimentary and continuous. The food is interesting as it's more Italian (I.e. many pasta offerings rather than traditional hash and waffles) but still enough options for a brunch aficionado. I had the shrimp and lobster omelette and the person I was with had the salmon pasta. The pasta was devoured in a tasty vodka sauce and could have been a suitable dish for brunch, lunch, or dinner. The omelette seemed a little empty outside the seafood, but was good once the toppings of avocado and tomato were sort of mixed in. The bottomless was top notch and worth all $19 for sure. And the prosecco they use is very sweet so be sure to ask for additional prosecco for side pours to make the brunch more memorable. Prosecco is solid and with the patio seems a nice leisurely Sunday on many occasions.

gF9doPneIbPpFCMEN4vdyQ.text: I've been here for dinner a bunch of times and each time have been incredibly impressed with both the quality of food and the service. Today we were looking for a place to go for Sunday brunch. Several breakfast/lunch only places have opened in the area. While most of them are OK, none really distinguish themselves. It was a beautiful Autumnal morning, soI thought I would try Proseco because they have an nice outdoor patio area that is nicely separated from the parking lot. Made a reservation which they honored. To our very pleasant surprise, they had an outstanding jazz sax player on the patio. Really nice touch!!! The brunch menu has a good assortment of omelets and other standard brunch items as well as a couple of more traditional Italian offerings. I went with the Ocean View omelet. Loaded with shrimp, avocado, feta cheese, and some lobster. Yummm! Best brunch experience I have had in a very long time. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ocean View omelet on the brunch menu. Delish choice.

9_biNeI_0-22B2MocTFROQ.text: Decided to bring my mom here for an early Mother's Day dinner since she likes pizza. It's a bit more upscale than I thought. We came on a Saturday around 5pm so I thought we'd be the only ones, but there was already a large group and the tables started to fill up quickly.   We ordered - Grilled octopus, served on a bed of couscous  - Ossobuco with a saffron risotto  - Asparagus with lemon and butter sauce - Pepperoni pizza with bell peppers and mushrooms added  My favorites were the veal shank and octopus. Both were so tender and seasoned just right for my taste. I wouldn't usually order asparagus, but my mom likes it so we ordered it. We both thought it was ok, but probably wouldn't order it again. The pizza was a bit salty for both of us and the crust was too thin...or maybe the topping was too heavy?! In any case, I prefer my pizza to be of the Unfloppy variety :) But it did force us to fold to eat it and look like we were from the east coast!   Service and vibe were quite pleasant, food was mostly good, but the bill seemed a bit high considering we didn't have any drinks. So overall I give 3 stars using my very scientific method of taking the excellent service and 2 out of 4 dishes (5 stars), and subtracting for the 2 out of 4 so-so dishes, price value and likelihood I'd be back for dinner (2 stars), making it a strong average 3 star.

rIlI7xjuyZtqhplCmFEEnQ.text: Just ordered delivery from here and have to say this is a pretty good Italian joint! My girlfriend and I tried this for the first time and were pleasantly surprised about how great the food was!  We ordered the bruschetta, it was delicious, not too bad for $6! Wish there was more though!   My girlfriend ordered the lasagna, it was good, fresh! But the portion size was small for it being $14. I ordered the eggplant, it was good, better than most Italian restaurants that either drudges it in breadcrumbs or doesn't season it well. This one was worth $14! It came with spaghetti as well!  The added bread with the garlic oil or whatever it was, was super delicious!!   We did order the banana Nutella crepe for dessert and it wasn't bad! I didn't know there were nuts on it, but my girlfriend loved it!!  Hopefully we can go eat there next time! Try new foods!

V8RRSSH1ye6VAqpEV4NoKA.text: We were visiting Vegas from LA.  Stopped by because of the great reviews. And have to agree with the reviews. 5/5.   Husband and I shared the special pasta of the day with speck ham and a Caesar salad. It was delicious.  My eight year old got the kid's menu pizza and fries. The pizza - the simple cheese pizza was absolutely delicious. The best crust - the foldable one ... like the ones I have had in Italy. But wait for it. The fries - the best fries we have ever had hands down ... the kids pizza was 12" - more than enough for three kids or two adults to share even!  Also got the capellini with pomadoro. It was simple yet so delicious.   The wait staff were attentive - the place elegant and simple. Simply just great and hit the spot!

gULve0SzJhZEY91nC3jk2A.text: The food wasn't bad, but I don't think it was worth the price. I wouldn't choose to come again unless a friend of family was in town and they wanted something close since I live nearby.  The servers were very friendly, but they interrupted us way too many times. There is a fine line between being attentive and being intrusive, and I felt they went a little overboard with the service. Asking me way too many times if I was still working on my dish.

sgQoEJDCFvAgmnbJ2Venzg.text: I was a returning customer to Prosecco.... up to today.  I placed an order with Yelp / Eat24, received a confirmation by email and I waited.... waited.... waited.... After more than 1 hour, I called the restaurant. The lady who pick up my call told me they didn't get any order from me / Eat24 and she told me also "we're closed tonight"...Uhhh seriously ? You're closed and you answer the phone ?!!  So I decided to take my car ( I was still expecting to get my order... ).  The restaurant was open, we talked to the staff.... maybe it was the manager(s) or the owner(s) I don't know... but I really felt like they didn't care about our order or... us. They did not offer to do anything for us. Even not a smile. Rude attitude and unprofessional customer service.  Congratulations guys : you lost a customer.

nYrl9HJyhvWff3amoSalFg.text: Loved the fresh pasta and fresh bread. Everything my fiancee and I ordered was delicious, from beginning to end. Very cute restaurant. Nice little place for date night. We will definitely come back and recommend this restaurant!

RzRuD1u4jqxppEN7tViQpg.text: Fantastic restaurant! Superb service! Great vegan options. The staff went above and beyond to make our party, including 3 kids, feel welcome. My nephew ordered a cheese pizza and French fries were added - a True surprise and delight moment of the evening. Very nice decor throughout and quality wine glasses. Loved the salt scrub in the women's restroom!

_rTWU0bw05GXScC9bKVVxg.text: I really enjoy taking my wife here for dinner. The owners are always on site. The servers are always friendly and accommodating, and the food is excellent. Even with all of the choices in Las Vegas Prosecco is one of my favorites.

qDbD89A6J7ocQvPAKV0ssQ.text: Never had a bad meal there, beet salad at lunch to die for.. A must go to for excellent Italian food

1ButIMAI8kgrDPtPGzMEwg.text: I think I found my favorite Italian restaurant here in Vegas :) great service, atmosphere and food was absolutely delicious. Pizza was a good price for its size, chicken and I had the lobster/shrimp ravioli. Bread was also good :) my moms boyfriend got a coffee and he loved it. Also whatever desert they have us for my moms birthday was very good. I'll Be coming back :)

w0DbxurD9pXzrOsI4-xigA.text: OMG!  This place is AMAZING!!!  My wife does not cook and we eat out every night. I've been to practically every restaurant in Las Vegas and with out a doubt this is the greatest meal I've EVER had.   The best fresh pasta ever! Including my trips through Italy. Amazing staff amazing food.  My extreme gratitude and appreciation to the Chef the owner the manager and the waitress.    WOW! Is all I can say.  Just simply WOW!

VPM229g2Dsr5z3CxUZxypA.text: One of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas! The pasta tasted very fresh and the service was friendly. I hope to return very soon.

27vXFp-d6qcV-szs45VA_g.text: I discovered this gem randomly and now I keep going back :) Really good Italian food - a lot to choose from, everything I had was amazing. Their soups, their appetizers (especially their octopus), their pasta, and their creme brulee (has a different name but you'll recognize it) - everything was delicious.  On top, everybody working here is nice and accommodating - I reserved a table for 18 this past Saturday for an event and they were very helpful and nice. We all ended up being half an hour late because of the event before and I was freaking out. I called and explained and I was very surprised how nice and accommodating they were. I will be back. Soon!

b02v4H4lAt9JpRwZOzs9HA.text: I will preface this review with the fact that I am Italian and I am from Long Island, N.Y (roll your eyes, but the fact remains I know great authentic Italian food)..  Ordered delivery from this establishment this evening via EAT24. I have been dying to try it.. as authentic Italian cuisine is obviously up my alley, especially on days when I don't feel like cooking. Ordered a margherita pizza, calamari, and tiramisu. I figured the old standbys should give me a sense of quality with this place.  Delivery was 20 minutes earlier than the EAT24 app estimated. Great!  Everything should be hot then. Wrong!  Pizza and calamari were stone cold. Tiramisu was so-so.  I'm half dressed (Hello! Hence delivery), so I couldn't really run after the delivery guy.  I immediately put the tiramisu in the fridge and heat my oven to 500 degrees, in hopes of saving the pizza. While the oven was going, I attempted to place the pizza on my pizza stone and it was such a project because of how soggy it was. Still, I hoped that I could save it in the oven.  I start eating the calamari, which was edible and probably my favorite part next to the complimentary rustic bread (that's where your 1 star came from, thumbs up on the bread and tapanade). $13  When the pizza came out, it was even worse than when I put it in. I gave up and just ate it because I was so hungry. Flavor was "eh" on top of it. I make a better margherita pizza at home. I'm so disappointed and I was most looking forward to this pizza, I wanted to love it so much. $11  Tiramisu pictures from being served in the restaurant (posted by other Yelpers) show a nice, huge piece of my favorite dessert. That's why I ordered it at $6 a slice. My slice is the tinest piece of cake I have ever had from a restaurant.   With tip, I paid an even $40 for utter disappointment all the way around. But here's my tip for YOU, Prosecco.. if the quality of your food cannot be upheld, and the integrity of your product is at stake during the delivery process, DON'T OFFER THE SERVICE.

w260wmj4iNBFj17hRBQ8fg.text: A great neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Pasta is made fresh daily.  The service is outstanding.  Rhonda is the best!  She is knowledgeable, polite, and makes the dining experience great.

qPCElpAQcufLmFe3fSG--w.text: Absolutely magnificent! This place provides a very authentic taste of Italy. If you want quality Italian food I recommend Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen. I observed them mix Alfredo fresh ... the cheese wheel melted over and mixed with noodles. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan and the potion was very large, I had to take some home. The ambiance is great as well and they have pleasant live music as well as a nice playlist.   I will definitely return.

L8Wc0dy3PfRgxa9M0mIFqg.text: Surprise!!! I got some gift certificates for my birthday (a year ago) and finally I got to visit this restaurant!!! We just came back from Europe vacation ( Hungary, Serbia, Croatia...) and I was thinking, no restaurant will feel good after that trip!  Well, I was wrong!!!  This was like little bday surprise wrapped up in the lamb dish!! It was almost like lamb stew! White fish was good, they deboned it next to the table. Also meet stake was very soft and tasty. Vine list has good variety and ok prices for bottles.  Tiramisu was very coffee tasting! Let me not forget the bread! It was very rustic, original Italian ... anyway I liked it. Also there is some kind of dish for two, with big cheese wheel... they put pasta inside cheese wheel and they melt cheese inside... cheese wheel is like a big bowl ... I know it sounds confusing but I am interested and I will try it next time I am there!!!  I recommend this restaurant for all fudies!!! Enjoy!
