H6yFoMSL1qIAGe6ffVwaUA.text: This was my first experience at an Italian kitchen and I was so very impressed. I ordered a bottle of Riesling and our server gave us great bottle service- showing us our bottle, letting me smell the cork, pouring it and allowed me to try it before continuing to pour the remaining glasses for the rest of the table.   For app we got the calamari and that was amazing.   For entree we got the golden knights combo, the lobster supreme, the spaghetti, and I got the special which was asparagus risotto with a paprika prawn.  The Golden Knight Combo has seasoned veggies, prawns and sirloin medallions served with a wine and bleu cheese dipping sauce. This was my dads order and he recommends that you dip the meats in the sauce!   The lobster supreme must have been really good if my Mom didn't offer us any and ate it all ( she's usually the Last to finish)   The spaghetti was good. It has giant meatballs on it and my sister really liked that about the dish   I had the special and this was different from what I order. The prawn was HUGE but the all star of the plate was the asparagus Risotto.   For dessert we got the gelato, in all three flavors, the creme brulee, and the semifreddo. All amazing! The salted caramel on the semifreddo was addicting and I couldn't stop eating it!   Service was great! I'm sad I didn't catch our server's name but everyone was on point in there.  Can't wait for my return visit!

They say that you know an ethnic restaurant is good if you see people from that ethnicity patroning it. Been here a few times for dinner, will try their Sunday brunch.

1j_TTnfRKztCFs6fco_r_A.text: Prosecco is a beautiful Italian restaurant, with a sun-drenched dining room and large booths for seating, and a glassed-in kitchen where you can watch the chefs hand-pulling pasta. Their welcoming patio makes me pine for cooler fall weather to return for HH, but we came for lunch.  They have a menu of lunch specials, which are slightly smaller portions at a couple bucks off of their dinner menu prices. We opted instead to order from the dinner menu, allowing us to try the octopus carpaccio and burrata apps- both were super fresh and beautifully plated, easily could have been my entire meal. We also shared the Fettuccini Tocco entree, featuring handmade rosemary infused pasta with braised short ribs in a red wine and plum tomato sauce. Even split, portion was large an though the meat was fork-tender the dish itself was somehow one-note as though missing something. We also had the semifreddo dessert with salted caramel sauce, which was one of the more interesting desserts I've tried at an italian restaurant. Glad they offer options beyond cannoli and tiramisu!  Though we were overall happy with our meal and the quality of food, the service was not quite up to par. Hostess greeted and seated us and the bartender/runner got our drinks and checked on us throughout the meal, they were great. Our actual server didn't make an appearance til 10 minutes after our arrival, at which point we were debating leaving. We never got an explanation for his absence and I also never caught his name, but he was overly casual for the price point and setting, doing the bare minimum. I suspect Nichole C and I had the same server. This makes me hesitant to return for dinner.

vU13U_HRuaNDEOyI22sb_Q.text: My better half and I were looking for a low key dinner date off strip tonight and we were in the mood for Italian. After a quick google search of "homemade pasta Las Vegas", I found a list that included Prosecco. After a quick look at reviews on Yelp and Open Table, I made a reservation. As we got to the restaurant, we were pleased to see ample parking since the restaurant is located in a strip mall type of area. The patio looked really nice but was empty (probably because it was still 94 degrees at 8pm) but I bet it would be really nice during cooler times.   The hostess was nice and seated us a table. The restaurant is dimly lit, perfect for a date night. I saw tons of families, too. A male server quickly greeted us and offered to get us beverages. We both got ice waters and I got Bocelli extra dry Prosecco ($10) and my husband got a Tanqueray and tonic (also $10). We were quickly brought a bread basket with the pesto anchovy dipping sauce right before our drinks were brought.   They accidentally brought me a glass of Chianti instead of Prosecco but Edith, our server, quickly fixed it and apologized and I assured her it was absolutely no problem.   My husband and I shared the lentil soup. It was great and the serving was HUGE. We both ordered the same homemade egg pasta entree: fettuccine tocco. It was rosemary infused fettuccine sauteed with braised short ribs in a red wine and plum tomato sauce and was priced at $20. It was a little bland to be honest.   We both got Parmesan cheese offered to our pasta which we accepted and it helped a tiny bit. Everything was fine and I couldn't finish all my pasta because the portion was so generous and I had already filled up on bread and soup.   Edith was always nearby to ask how we were doing and if we needed anything else. I also spotted the "Italian John Stamos" manager walking around.   We skipped dessert because we were so full.  I think we'll both be back to try a different pasta dish because there is potential.  Edith was great and was so sweet. I hope next time to save room for cannolis or the custard dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Tocco $20

noT-zwG-kYYYUYimQSVerQ.text: Posting this a little late but wonderful fare on a Tuesday!  The Tomahawk Tuesdays at Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen was excellent! Got 2 side or Ceasar salads, a 48oz Tomahawk Steak, and dessert! Thoroughly enjoyed by me and my husband.  Hoping to get a chance to try it again before the special ends.

JlYv9KPLtWN9XE590EF9rw.text: Wow! Today was my first time stopping in, but definitely not my last. The restaurant is clean, open, bright, and the service is impeccable. I was casually dressed, but still felt comfortable. It feels high end without being pretentious. The food is so fresh and the meatballs were melting in my mouth, they were so soft. The calamari was crispy and the marinara was flavorful and tasted homemade. I had creme brulee for dessert with a cappuccino and the flavor of the brulee was sweet and so good...I would say the best I've had. Will definitely go back again!

K_f8yatmN5M8UucZWKhQ4A.text: Ordered pollo marsala, on the photo examples there were two pieces of chicken. For $24 I only received a small one piece of chicken breast with veggies. Everything else was delicious, also a complete 5 star because of premiere service from Rico, the manager / owner he went above and beyond.

nEL6R2rKmLl5yID3ilIwzw.text: I used to work in this shopping center, so when my go-to Italian spot was closed I decided to stop by here.   Upon arrival and being seated the server came over and asked us what we wanted to drink. No introduction or even a "welcome to...." never caught his name through the entire meal.   After water arrives we ask what he recommends to eat and offers meat more so than pasta instead of just maybe going over the most popular items, seemed off. We ended up ordered lasagna and the black squid ink crab pasta. Also, it was difficult to flag anyone down for a water refill or oil and vinegar as I don't eat olives that were in the pesto dropped upon arrival.   The food runner brings over the food and was very helpful and didn't recommend any Parmesan as cheese would destroy the crab in my dish but did offer black pepper. The lasagna was delicious and had a great smokiness from the wood oven and my dish was overly rich that I did have to take it home it was just too much.   The busser proceeds to clean off our table and asks if we want dessert and we decline. Minutes later, the server comes over and just hands us menus doesn't really say anything. Disappears again as we just wanted our bill at this point. He comes back many minutes later and finally can close out.   After this experience I would come back for lasagna but definitely hope for a better server, I'd take the food runner in a heart beat! But this is also a little farther than I normally prefer to drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dungeness crab with squid ink pasta.
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna.

2EDx4hpG4T_s_2JWJmqXuQ.text: We stopped in here for dinner this evening. We were immediately greeted by a young lady and shown to a table with no waiting. The place was not to busy. It appeared only 3 or 4 other groups of diners were in the place. It was around 5 PM  Rhonda was our waitress and she did a great job all night. Rhonda, as well as some of the other staff, were attentive all through our meal. We never had to wait to get a drink refilled.  Once seated we were asked if we wanted anything to drink. We ordered a glass of wine and a iced tea.  After the drinks were served we were asked if we'd like any appetizers. My wife ordered the bruschetta and I asked if they just had classic garlic bread because I didn't see it on the menu. I was told they did and they'd bring me some.  They brought my wife her bruschetta and a basket of bread and some oil which I assumed was the garlic bread. I wasn't a big fan of the bruschetta.  My wife liked it. The bread didn't seem very garlicky.   Just as I was talking about the lack of garlic flavor they showed up with the garlic bread. I wish they would have told us they were going to serve us bread because then we wouldn't have ordered the other breads. Our table looked like we were having bread for dinner LOL  Anyway the garlic bread was not what i was looking for. It was very moist and had hunks of garlic on it. It really didn't appeal to me. I had one of the staff take it away. Rhonda was nice enough to not include that on our check.  We both had the Capillini al Pomodoro for dinner. That's a fancy way of saying spaghetti with marinara sauce I think. We both enjoyed this plate.  For desert my wife had the Crema Bruciata. We both liked it.  I had seen strawberry crepes listed on the dessert menu on Yelp, but apparently they've been removed from the menu. I was really looking forward to them. I mentioned this to Rhonda and she said they could be made for me. They were great!  They did have some easy listening music playing, but it was down low and wasn't so loud that you had to talk over it. As we were leaving we noticed a guitar player tuning up in the corner. Apparently they were going to have some live music, but we left before he began.  The place is very open and roomy. It doesn't have that dark closed in feeling that some Italian restaurants have.  Our bill came to just over $73 before the tip. We had some of the less expensive items as we weren't really hungry and just wanted a simple spaghetti dinner. So it's a little pricey, but they do seem to go out of their way to make sure your evening is a pleasant one.   We both agreed we'd visit this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VvrPr1G9NP4fpFoT40F4uw.text: Sometimes I find a gem while having a business dinner as is the case with Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen.  It helped that I know my business companion well enough so I was able to take pics of the food.  I did a bit of research and was craving something Italian ~ more Italian than Italian-American and this was where I found this restaurant thanks to Yelp.  Whenever I come to Vegas for business  (fun fact - I'm actually a NV resident and live here part time) I try to find some yummy neighborhood finds.  Their pastas are made fresh and they really have fresh good Italian food here.  We ordered the burratina appetizer and it was super fresh and delicious.  If you're into burrata cheese or fresh mozzarella, this is a dish you must order!  Bonus is the prosciutto was delectable as well.  For our main entrees, we ordered their Ravioli d'aragosta (shrimp and lobster ravioli in a light saffron cream sauce) - I'm always a sucker when I hear a dish has saffron in it -  and also their pollo parmigiana.  The raviolis were freshly made as you can tell by the texture of the pasta and the seafood seemed fresh as well.  The sauce was creamy but light at the same time and the saffron essence really came thru.  As for the pollo parmigiana, it was superb!  Huge piece of chicken with a side of pasta (I asked for capellini instead of spaghetti) and the sauce was marinara. Once again the pasta was fresh and it really makes a difference.  Service wasn't quite up to the level as the food but it wasn't bad - it's more of a testament to how good the food was.   If you're looking for delicious fresh Italian cuisine, I highly recommend this Italian restaurant that sits in a larger strip center off Eastern/215 fwy.  Please support small local businesses that go the extra mile.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli d&#39;aragosta - shrimp and lobster ravioli in a light saffron sauce

lmk0lk59LC6DnzoTDsietw.text: Guess where we went last night for dinner.....duh....We have lost count of our reviews of our favorite restaurant where we live. But  the freshness, quality, and creativity of the food continue to bring us back. The ambiance, service ( Gianni, thank you ), and warmth is given to all, whether your a regular or there for the first time. mO8vfAExYUV4HAtQOiURrQ.text: An Italian food extravaganza w a touch of just the right amount of flavor and character. Amazing service and detail oriented team makes this place one of my new favorite places to eat Italian food in town. Try the octopus salad to start and go from there but don't forget to try and finish your meal off w a tiramisu that's finger-licking good. Cheers!

Zfln5SPyMXjKkPVkIaN7_Q.text: Our first time here was about a month ago per my son's recommendation. This place is absolutely beautiful and we were able to get a reservation within a few hours. Upon entering we were greeted and promptly seated by the hostess. We ordered a glass of the best and only Chianti Classico wine I've ever had, Strada al Sasso. We then ordered lasagne and pasta cheese wheel with black truffles. The cheese wheel experience is amazing! And the pasta was authentic and the best I've ever had. The black truffles are very robust so I removed some of those. If this place was located near me I would dine a few nights per week. It has a fantastic ambiance and great staff.  I brought a friend here to celebrate her birthday. We ordered the ravioli ai formaggi, pasta cheese wheel and the fettuccine tocco. It was all good and my friend was happy.

DnvEJD2n8HhEhOZibzQPDQ.text: Had a grt service delicious food.   Thank u.  Graze    From the star to the end I enjoy the food service my waiter lovely person.  My son came from San Jose Cal so perfect Dinner

lISMDE25uoUnLvyOictB7w.text: My first time here!!   Every Wednesday us old guys get together for lunch at various restaurants, pubs and cafes on the Henderson area of Vegas.   We ordered three lasagna dishes, one chicken parmigiana and one meatball sandwich.   The meatball sandwich had very little sauce but the very attentive waitress Rhonda brought extra sauce with the sandwich. My buddy didn't care for it so the waitress brought us a complimentary plate of cannolis as a surprise. FIVE stars!!!! Delicious.   ALL three lasagnas were homeruns on taste and size. I was full all day. I HIGHLY recommend the lasagna. Plentiful cheese, meat and right amount of sauce.   Chicken parmigiana was huge and good tasting per my buddy.   I rarely give five stars on one visit but this restaurant deserves it.   I'll be back and our old guy lunch group will be back. I don't even live on this side of town.

tBb76JvyRRPQZpEniv7jbA.text: Super cute Italian spot. My review is just based on a quick trip in for drinks at brunch. The decor is light and fresh, the staff is super friendly, and the bar area is cozy! I met a few girlfriends for drinks at the bar before our brunch at Truffles N Bacon (they don't offer alcoholic libations).   Bartender was very accommodating and prepared a mimosa for me without a lot of juice (just the way I like them). I did check out the menu and their brunch menu looks solid! -WpKmxElDQz17Hu7n7HqPA.text: I never fail to be impressed by their cuisine...except tonight was exceptionally subpar or at least food court quality. The Ravioli was bland and the lasagna was tasteless. I was a bit disappointed since i paid over $80. The bruschetta was amazing though. I love this family restaurant. You will see all kinds of people and families here. Just when you feel self conscious about how you're dressed and that this might be an upscale dress code enforced place...out walks a happy unshaven man in Khaki shorts, faded black tee, and a backwards hat with family in tow. You walk in and see people of all walks of life. You feel comfortable just being you surrounded by upscale ambience and great food!

fhyT2dlfUDrpkZ-x4YcxJw.text: They live up to their name and more.  5 stars! Thank you for being great hosts and making our exquisite meal so memorable.

H86jlkYljYYybGoZY4xK4A.text: Best Italian food in vegas. Love this place.  Nico took very good care of us.  Definitely coming back!

YULfdC36UbxnrVU0G6CUdQ.text: Very nice place - went for lunch.  Italian music was playing and my husband and I had a pleasant meal with great service.

JkEqLggnur8X-z1f81M5jQ.text: I've been here a few times and I'm truly blown away. Staff is attentive and friendly. I really enjoyed the lobster supreme . It was so tasty and the lobster was tender and delicious. I also enjoyed the ravioli in an asparagus cream sauce! I'll be going make soon for sure!

QTQ3OTF2fFg01MsgA6Ugtw.text: If you're looking for incredible, authentic Italian food, you need to check this place out. From the moment you walk in the service is great! The owners come to your table to see how things are going. Now the food, the food is hands down some of the best Italian food I've had in Vegas. They have a great wine selection as well. This is my wife and i go to place.

oJPfw7VCqw5kUzN5d82wQA.text: Great food and atmosphere. Top-to-bottom the menu is amazing and all of the staff is very friendly. If you get a chance, introduce yourself to the owner Nico, very friendly guy and has a lot of passion for the place. If you like seafood definitely try the black ink pasta with shrimp!

_62Ev83uWjsM2o-UmbDjRQ.text: So pleased this location has reopened. Food, ambience, bar and staff are excellent. The place has a very Italian feel which is a must. I highly recommend this restaurant.

p3D0KAzRMaMUQi0Gm6IV8A.text: What an excellent restaurant this is. Lovely decor, friendly staff, and amazing food. My wife and I loved the fact that they time your food appropriately, they don't rush your meal out right when you get your appetizer.  My wife had the oso bucco which was soft, came right off the bone and amazing. I had the linguine Mediterranean which was filled with fresh seafood. The tiramisu was the best I had ever had and the cordial was a delight to top off the meal. A great restaurant to have a wonderful evening with friends and family. Looking forward to returning to try other menu items.

w85SN-3JOaY_lcFSjNfQlw.text: Awesome addition to the Henderson / Eastern Ave restaurant scene. My girlfriend and I live just right down the road from here and we have been waiting forever for this gem to open. We went on a Thursday night and had such a great experience there, the chef absolutely knows what he is doing and the front of house staff are very knowledgeable. If you are looking for authentic Italian food then this is the spot, we started our meal off with a Caesar salad and calamari. The calamari was excellent, great breading which was very light and seasoned just right. My girlfriend is a huge Caesar fan and gets this salad almost everywhere we go, she said this was one of the best dressings and I totally agree with her. For our entree's I had the Ribeye medium rare, the steak was cooked to perfection and was much better than any other strip steakhouses in my opinion, just salt and pepper seasoned so you are actually tasting the great quality of the beef. My girlfriend had the Linguine Mediterania under dry pasta's, they sure do not short you on seafood with this dish. Her scallops in the pasta could not of been cooked any better, they were like butter! Nico one of the owners was a very nice gentleman who made sure he stopped by every table to ask how things were and to tell a little bit about the restaurant which was very nice. Overall this was a great experience and we will most definitely come back. Next time I am going to try the pizza from their woodfire oven! Great Job Prosecco!

otwXYort1pxvf9qfgieRtA.text: Really want to like this place; but can't.  First visit was good enough to get us to return; but service was spotty and mashed potatoes were cold.  The menu is good and the ambiance is nice.  Second visit was worse.  We made a reservation and when we arrived we were told the only available table for us was outside...which we really didn't want.  They should have asked when the reservation was made.  It took forever to place our drink order and even longer to get the drinks.  The entrees were delivered at different times and mine was cold and had to be sent back.  Another in our party got cold food as well; but didn't send it back.  Probably because it took 5 minutes to get someones attention to get the food back to the kitchen.  Not a lot of flavor in the dishes combined with poor service and cold food....not going back.  Sorry, wanted a new favorite place but this isn't it.

1vMtnhmYD4OYt9IXwwDePw.text: We checked out this new restaurant in our neighborhood. I was surprised at the beautiful, interior. I didn't expect it to be so elegant inside. It's also very clean looking. The servers are courteous and friendly. And the owner himself visits the tables to ask if everything is okay. Food and presentation are good. The wait is reasonable time. We'd like to return and try other dishes. I think we're going to be regular customers.

0HNXxvX78mo8u6guae7vUg.text: Decided to give this new restaurant a try and was not disappointed.  The portions are not huge,but large enough to fill you up. The menu selection and specials give you a wide array of Italian dishes.  The wait staff was very attentive. Giuseppe and Nico the owners are present and actively involved. The decor is simple and modern the open kitchen concept is really nice. The live music was a bit too loud but very good. Everyone that went in our party had different main courses and enjoyed them.  The desserts were amazing

dcRe6ArEQuLdi5UWitSwlQ.text: First time visit and I LOVE this place! The food is exquisite, the prices are quite reasonable and the service is flawless! Giuseppe (co-owner) really took care of us when we went for Mother's Day dinner, making us feel like family, not just another table of patrons. He patiently guided us on our individual orders, including the bottle of wine (a smooth & tasty chianti). When I confessed that I couldn't decide between the filet mignon and the filet medallions with mushroom sauce (non mi piace il funghi), he suggested that I should get the tomahawk. Although I love a good steak, but having never heard of such a cut, I told him that I don't know what that is. "It's wonderful. That's all you need to know," he assured me. When a server (or owner) of a restaurant boasts emphatically about the quality of something particular on their menu, I have learned that such advice is prudent to take. A tomahawk is a jaw-dropping sized hunk of beef at the end of an approximately 18-inch bone (I regret not taking a picture of it to show you before I dove into it.) And it WAS incredible, just as Giuseppe had promised. He told me that it had been aged for 80 days, but all I know is that it was absolutely the best steak I can EVER remember eating! I also got the ruby salad, which, if you like beets and goat cheese, you will love! My wife got the salmon in a lemon-based sauce with a prawn that arrived at our table looking magazine-perfect, and she said it was delicious. We also ordered the minestrone soup, which we thought was perfect. My brother ordered Branzino (sea bass) ravioli in a lemon butter sauce. Delicious, perfect portion. For dessert- Bavarese al Prosecco e Fragole (creamy delicate prosecco custard served with coulis) and another similar custard item, creme brulee, both of which were as outstanding as they were beautiful. There's something for everyone on this menu. I felt somewhat remiss in not ordering something more typically Italian, but I have no regrets about my tomahawk (other than not taking a picture of it). And I can always order something like that next time. Can't wait to go back! Grazie, Giuseppe!

gWgp_6HCY0wE29aZvVUsPQ.text: We went to Prosecco on Friday night for dinner.  Having heard what a great restaurant it was we were eager to try it.  Friends had told us the food was great, the service was great and what a great host the owner was.  We were excited.  True the food was good, the service was good.  Our waiter Joaquin was terrific.  However, the owner, Guiseppe, was a great disappointment.  As we sat there I watched him go to every single table, sometimes twice, spoke to the guests and even sat down at some of the tables to talk and ask how everything was.  We sat there for a good 90 minutes and never once did he come to our table to see how the food or the service was.  He did visit the table next to us twice.   Our bill was over $100 so it wasn't as though we were just there taking up space and not ordering.  I was insulted.  My husband stopped to talk to him as we were leaving and told him that the food was great but that we had noticed he did not stop at our table and he had gone to all the others, he lied and said he "was putting out fires."  We had watched him for over an hour as he visited each table.  We paid and left.  Never to go back again.   You only get one chance to make a first impression!

bftVrC4oRi__fgnEFOXvpw.text: My mom and I decided to try this new place for lunch, it was INCREDIBLE!! I am a picky eater and not a fan of tomatoes or tomato based sauces. I asked if they had a regular fettuccine Alfredo as I didn't see it on the lunch menu. They have it on their dinner menu so they were able to accommodate my request. When we got our food it was a generous portion and it was absolutely DELICIOUS!! You could tell instantly that the pasta was home made as it was light and airy. The sauce was a perfect creaminess with just the perfect hint of garlic (not over powering at all). My mom got their Tacchino Sandwich and again, it was a generous portion and all of the ingredients were a perfect ratio to each other.  The bread was warm and the cheese was completely melted and tasted like it had just come out of the brick oven. The restaurant atmosphere is clean and simple yet rustic decor. All of the staff was so friendly, it truly was a great experience. Mom and I cannot wait to bring our husbands to Vegas' new Italian gem!!

20ftV8onHCaK95Nvsuqv8Q.text: Round One - What a surprise!  This was our first visit to Prosecco.  My Lady and I had gone to the movies next door and afterwards walked down to Prosecco to see what their menu was like.  The decor and configuration of Prosecco invited us in, BRIGHT, COLORFUL, WELL LAYED OUT!.  We decided to have a late lunch/early dinner.  What a great decision.  The menu was impressive to read.  The food was fantastic to eat.  I ordered the Cappelini Pomodoro and my Lady ordered the Enslata Prosecco and we split the meals.  WOW, WOW, WOW!  The Cappelini was spectacular and the salad was fresh and delicious with lots of colors and flavors, just like the decor of Prosecco.  We sinned a bit at the end with a Cannoli for desert and that too was wonderful.  My Lady is 100% Italian and she was so happy with our experience at Prosecco.  We will be back for Round Two in the next week or so.  Hope to have a similar experience.

rOiFdQGYmufHZ0p-bGjbAg.text: poor service,high prices and small portions  wish gabriellas was still there

U9ypDz9YN6hPV975nElOqA.text: In our opinion, this is the best Italian in the area. We have been here multiple times and Prosecco offers excellent, fresh food, great waitstaff, friendly, hardworking owner and a really polished and clean atmosphere. Excellent calamari, pasta selection, chicken parm, various specials, bread. It's not cheap but it shouldn't be. Give this place a chance as we'd like to see them do well and stay in business.

g2u81PyDkeF6FQ6xTpAj2w.text: The bartender and atmosphere were wonderful. Unfortunately, the waiter was very unresponsive and the food was not enjoyable. I will give tons of credit to the owner, who tried to pitch in when needed.

BWTrCxXBYV-S7A9ekzCpHw.text: Great atmosphere and excellent food. The ownership (Chef & Manager) are always working and want everyone to have a great time. Stop by this place!

iQle5vsyEP1lFL7iQWtpMA.text: Wonderful little Italian restaurant in Henderson Nevada. The food was delicious recommend the baked eggplant.

6XF2Ym8xnamzBm3iLcVvQA.text: We were looking for a fresh place to have lunch- and found this restaurant on Yelp.  I had the insalada with fresh chicken.  It was a wonderful combination of mango, cucumbers chicken and lettuce with balsamic vinegrette.  We also ordered a canneloni - stuffed with chicken and covered with a bechamel sauce. This is definitely a find for a nice quiet lunch-

sYCNAE8SRiuWiQyEw72oag.text: My new favorite Italian restaurant. Home made pasta, music on the patio..terrific. Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

K5paztPLfIX1HDqthzcc-A.text: Found this place on Yelp...I was looking for someplace new, that wasn't a chain restaurant. DELICIOUS! Nice wine selection, absolutely authentic dishes that taste like they came out of grandma's kitchen. Ambiance is appesling, service was great. Give it a shot! You won't be disappointed.

VkLA9BlhS6UR-MUWAdupKA.text: Chef Giuseppe knows us, we are regulars. He suggested two meals that were simply amazing! My husband had Sole served table-side by Giuseppe and I had lobster on fresh pasta of the day. The salad course he suggested was the roasted red and yellow beet salad on fresh greens with goat cheese and candied walnuts. Layered full flavors, paired expertly, for a wonderful experience. I noticed he greeted each guest and escorted them to their table. It was thrilling to see someone with such passion for what he does, taking personal care of customers.

bTBtNYUWsIrXZqLD69zCPw.text: Food was excellent.  Large window opening into kitchen from dining room.  Looked like you could eat off the floor it was so clean.  Staff was very friendly and welcoming.  Service from the kitchen was VERY slow.  This was the only reason I did not give it 5 stars!

fsD7xdx4_pG6ZKHMcZdV4g.text: Never knew this place existed despite it being open for several months. The food, service and atmosphere all were A+. We started with the calamari appetizer and a Caesar salad. The flavors were great. The bread that came with the meal was freshly baked and accompanied by a great olive oil, pesto, olive and anchovy concoction that was tasty. I had the Rigatoni Paesana  and my wife had the Pasta Mediterranea. The pasta and ingredients were super fresh and flavored perfectly. Overall this was a great experience with a super friendly and attentive staff. I would put this up there with any of the fine Italian dining found on the strip.

MZO_UTLQ8b6NuyyKxaNxlA.text: Amazing Sunday brunch! Excellent service. Great live music! Owner Nico- top notch! We will be back!

-7MO1-Bd6lbRPp0TsRSC5g.text: Good but not great.  Octopus app was well prepared. Ricotta and tomato bruschetta very colorful with sweet glaze on the tomatoes, but needs more ricotta to balance all the tomatoes  and bread. Lobster and shrimp ravioli in saffron cream sauce was beautifully presented but lacked overall flavor.  Seafood was generous in the seafood linguine but all were overcooked.

v7g7SOy2Oab9IrOFtpttJw.text: Great atmosphere and friendly staff - service was good. Only odd thing was putting fries on the kids pizza, led to a soggy bottom layer of fries. Pasta was cooked perfectly (it is surprising how many Italian restaurants can't get the pasta right).

Q2oBZpMN43YN4QMWiNSJcQ.text: We stumbled upon this by accident, and it was the most Wonderful find. The atmosphere, the service, and most of all the food was wonderful. They had several specials plus the menu, which was hard to choose from. Both our meals, plus our appetizer were amazing. We are so glad we found this little gem and will definitely be back. It was  busy for a Friday and we had no reservation. They said it was no problem and sat us.  The restaurant is super clean. We had a great meal and Teya  was our mixologist / server. she was extremely helpful and makes the best Expresso martini ever.  GO... You'll fall in love.

1jEt9jwi_FPTSiJn30QSKg.text: Been there 3 times now. The first two times we had a great experience. The third time the waiter ruined the night. He was short with us. Did not help with the menu and apparently didn't know how to smile or even pretend to be happy. The food was pretty good. I think it's the ruby salad the we really enjoyed. The pasta was great. The 3rd time we shared the ribeye of the menu. It was cooked perfect and seasoned well but the quality of steak was terrible. A step above a steak you would get from a bar when ordering steak and eggs. It was 38 $  they need to take off the menu. Terrible. The first time went I got the 8 oz shrimp special. The shrimp was over cooked.  I'll go back again with hi hopes that they are improving.

bcSPYoq6iR7EiywEDB3vzA.text: My husband and I ordered dinner to go. Dinner came with what seemed like an entire loaf of bread and incredible herb infused dipping sauce! We had the half moon butternut squash "ravioli." The sage and butter sauce was incredible. The chocolate cake was also so delicious and we are not even huge chocolate fans. We cannot wait to go back and dine!

LdugK_8L-XfJcr0DD9jEnA.text: Great service, everything is very fresh.  Try the limoncello!  We will definitely be going back.

AbWgmPiaLuw48aXHG2eFVw.text: New, modern, great Italian menu. If you're in the mood for great food and ambiance this is your place.

I1LHuz1gXMEon0WSoMjU0Q.text: A little gem of a restaurant right in our neighborhood.  I dined there with 3 other friends, we all loved it!  Food tasted great, our server was very attentive, which was surprising because we were all women!  Generally, women get the short shrift where service is concerned, not so at Prosecco.  Kudos to the staff and Chef, also the entire kitchen staff, our meal exceeded our expectations!  All of us will be recommending Prosecco to family & friends.  I hope others in our neighborhood try this restaurant, unless you have already discovered it!

LTazQ7MetJhdb5_c43-XlQ.text: My favorite little spot to go. Fine dining without the hassle or cost . Very lovely vibe!

I ordered a salad, mushroom ravioli, and a creme brulle & it was absolutely delicious. So glad to have come To this place. Hostess was very sweet and welcoming & my server was aswell (sadly I did not get his name).  Definitely worth trying out.

h_LxdNeM_jDZ1kATuWJmnw.text: Great new place to dine! It was very good. Nice decor and atmosphere.  The staff hustled! Tracy the bartender was awesome.  The fresh bread was very nice. The dessert looked so freaking good.  We will be going back again.  Took an Uber here. So that was nice.  They have delivery too.  Check it out!  Reservation was easy to make. I used open table.  We ended up sitting at the bar. We asked for that area. They have 2 TVs over the back bar.

UNxBENMAoecCHzWZkogsBg.text: This place kinda classy food is good I order Bruscheta with prosciutto on the side Spaghetti with meatballs and basil not bad at all a little bit pricey but worth it.

xYt930q5DbPphAjuq2_SWQ.text: Their garden looks very nice. The staff is very friendly,prompt and polite. The food is to die for :) First thing I ate was spaghetti and meetballs. The serving is nice, presentation of the food exquisite. Ambient and atmosphere just amazing. I got the food super fast and everything was fresh. Warm fresh bread as an appetizer won me over. y2ULkSqzD_cXankO20LXbQ.text: What a spectacular restaurant! Everything was fresh and incredible! Great staff!  The ambiance was perfect, a beautiful interior.

oul3TYet-xKWCNbqzSGfwA.text: In our adventures in new-parenthood, we decided to meet up family for a dinner out at this new restaurant I'd just learned about through them!   Atmosphere - the decor and atmosphere is very warm and inviting here. Everyone was buzzing and enjoying their dinner on a Friday night, that's for sure! The waitstaff and hostesses were very friendly and accommodating as best as they could be. We did have the baby in a carseat and ended up keeping her in the booth to avoid her being tipped over with narrow space between tables. The booths were just a tad too small for 2 people and a child.  Food - The food was awesome. I had the chicken with lemon sauce and capers. It came with very fresh baby carrots and green beans and had the perfect balance of savory and tangy - it was around $21 which seemed fair for the portion size. My husband had the ravioli which seemed to be a pretty small portion for $22. My family had pasta dishes that they enjoyed. We all shared the mango salad and the quinoa salad which were both very fresh and delicious and reasonably priced around $9.  Overall we enjoyed our dinner out here. The owner came around to the tables to welcome everyone and our server was very polite and friendly to explain everything  It may be a hard place to bring kids or a baby -- it's more of a restaurant for a friends night out or a dinner out with your sweetie -- it's not super quiet though, so don't try to have a super romantic dinner here on a busy night.

Lrxxwjzw6PAyLrulv9jRdg.text: Very delicious!!! Ordered take out and was still very impressed ! Had the bruschetta- 5/5 Chicken Parm 5/5 stars! The chicken Parm dish seemed small for the price but I couldn't even finish it! Portion is really not that small after all. Hard to find good Italian food, so I give 5 stars!

jSrXQBqOmAtuiLPd4lKTRw.text: Nicely greeted and decided to sit on patio for lunch.  Patio has plenty of outdoor seating and big umbrellas, succulents. Very nice waiter with Italian accent. I hope they get more bushes and trees to block parking lot and give it a garden-type ambiance.  Lunch included margartia pizza and salad w/mango - both very tasty.  Mango was delicious, butter lettuce & avocado fresh.  Pizza had the right amount of cheeze, not too salty. I also received a tray of oil & chopped basil & fresh warm bread-- both delicious and aromatic. I put the basil-oil mixture on my pizza. After lunch, sat at bar. Two big TVs for your watching pleasure.  Wide variety of drinks and good wines.  Beers on tap.  I liked the red chandeliers over the tables near the window.  I am looking forward to my next visit.

3yhpi0xEowP-Lpqmdoz62g.text: Went here on a date this past Sunday. I used to live half a mile away from the place and never even knew it was there. I loved everything about this place. As soon as we walked in, the hostesses were warm and welcoming. The restaurant itself is modern and sleek, and very clean. Our server was amazing. He was knowledgable and kind and did everything he could to make sure we were okay. I loved the fact that all the wait staff and managers were italian, from Italy, with their beautiful accents. I ordered the seafood linguini, which was delicious, and had more seafood than I would have expected. My date ordered the cheese ravioli, which was also very good and flavorful. We also had calamari, which I am extremely picky about, but this was perfect. This place is a hidden gem, and I will absolutely be back.

xZF3vAIp5Q136bLxumxjpA.text: I love this place!  The food is amazing, its a great local spot.  Highly recommend!

fExhtOhRda6uOGLNRAswfQ.text: Meh, looked good, smelled good, disappointed.  The place has a disorganized staff, although it amusing to see cute waiters run around without a clue we went there to eat.  The food was not that good, just average, too bad I had high hopes for this place!

5r_ilwcA9bTDY3gOLxf1xQ.text: Great date spot! Found this adorable restaurant through its raving reviews in Yelp. We just moved into the area and this place did not disappoint, absolutely fantastic!!! The menu is amazing from pizza to homemade pasta but, I stuck with a favorite of mine.. eggplant parmesan. It was to die for! The ingredients were very fresh, the tomato sauce was bright and extremely flavorful!  We ordered a bottle of wine and neither my wine nor water glass were ever empty, the wait staff was on point. Rhonda was our waitress and was very helpful and kind. However, all of the wait staff assisted us, they seemed like a very functioning machine working together. Great food, amazing service and an extremely cute and comforting decor made for a wonderful dinner and I will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The eggplant parmesan is to die for!

A-zoOnFlkJu0fJAB8UY_1g.text: Had another amazing meal here again probably my fifth or sixth time here in three months.... Beef carpaccio was amazing and so was the short rib!!!

IzzsCLWaFfV9hku3ZkM33w.text: Get the spaghetti and meatballs. The sauce is amazing and addicting. The ruby salad which has beets,nuts, & goat cheese is refreshing and delicious before any main dish here. The grilled lemon chicken is savory with a wonderful sauce over the chicken. The food here is delicious in the restaurant or even to-go (unlike some restaurants that the food tastes different when picking up to-go).

AJS1JaP7Pnhz6UO08sddwQ.text: I felt good when the bread and pesto came out. It is rare to get really good crispy, chewy bread served in a Las Vegas restaurant. The pesto was also excellent. My wife and I ordered a Margharita pizza and cannelloni. The latter was fantastic and served in a very generous portion. The pizza's toppings were first rate, the crust a tad soggy, perhaps, because we ate it after eating the cannelloni. One of our friends had spaghetti and meatballs. He gave me a slice of meatball. Fantastic seasonings! The flavors all hit the right notes in this restaurant.

mBXr-cPnIEfQHzFbrfuLbA.text: This place is so good and I love that it is in the Henderson area! The staff and ownership was great both times we went. Rhonda took care of us for brunch and was very attentive. The beef carpaccio is as good if not better than  Ferraros and the creme brulee is the best I've ever had and that is saying a lot as I have had many! It appears they are coming out with a new menu and looked liked they were adding some additional great stuff. Can't wait to try more things on their menu! I only regret not taking pics to share with you; next time :)! If you live in Henderson and want to try something new and other than a chain restaurant, check them out. It will be one of our new monthly spots, I'm sure! They also have live music often!

I5RQpa_AexLjM_lSqF7iqQ.text: Everything was delicious! Excellent service and great atmosphere. I believe the gentleman was the owner he was very attentive to us. Our waitress also gave us some great recommendations. We will be back. I'd also like to comment on how nice their hostess Krista was- she managed to get us a table for a party of 8 on a Saturday night with 20 mins notice.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7HvmZGXpjeoRcxNuqBa8ow.text: We used to come here when it was "Gabriella's", this is better!  The ladies bathroom has baby wipes! So convenient. They also have sugar hand scrub that you can use after you wash your hands with their soap so that you can exfoliate! Such a clean place. The good is so fresh you can see the chef cook your food right in front of you!

EQeLdRDk6-gpX64egUJPIw.text: Located in the corner of Eastern and Pebble next to the Colonnade Theatre, Prosecco Italian is a welcome change to that location. Having friends that recently became employees there, my husband and I decided to give it a try.  Arriving around 9 we were immediately seated. Red shade lighting hangs overhead and setting is slightly intimate.  Cocktails orders placed and add bruschetta, the cocktails came and were stiff, bruschetta on crispy Ciabatta with delicious yellow and red heirloom tomatoes with a zesty seasoning was a good start to the meal. Food ordered, squid ink spaghetti and prawns, and Chicken Marsala.  I'd requested the prawns in a spicy fra diavlo sauce which he said he could do, however when it arrived it was essentially plain tomato sauce, totally void of any sort of heat. The prawns were huge though, I must say. My hubby's Chicken Marsala was pretty tasty, accompanied with baby carrots and a handful of green beans, artfully arranged on a long rectangular plate.  Service was attentive and friendly. The owner (I think he said his name was Giuseppe) came over briefly and introduced himself. Dinner minus tip was $122. Kind of steep for two at a strip mall Italian place, but I would consider returning. I like supporting small mom-n-pop places.

6D1h1o6fDjK1zoLciWSWYw.text: Prosecco was absolutely amazing!  We had dinner there on Saturday night.  I had Dover sole which was deboned tableside.  It would have been good enough just by itself but it was served with a lemon butter sauce that made it remarkable.  My wife had a pasta dish with lobster and prawns.  The pasta was amazingly fresh, you could tell it was made from scratch.  Her lobster and prawns were also delicious.  Prosecco was one of the best dining experiences we have had in awhile and we will definitely come back again!

dzbl_tOMj7rQY_1s-ItHhA.text: We paid our first visit today to the newly opened Prosecco Fresh Italian Restaurant in the Colonnade shopping center off of Eastern Avenue. The food was amazing; the staff attentive and friendly; the decor fabulous; and the owner engaging and friendly. If you are looking for authentic, fresh Italian cuisine prepared by a chef from Venice, then this is the place. We will definitely be back.

Grilled octopus with couscous was very nice!  Octopus was fresh and big!  Couscous was moist and tasty!  This was one of the best octopus. We also oreded salad and black ink pasta.  Pasta came with lobster and shrimp.  Not over cooked and not too salty. The manager or the owner was very attentive and friendly. I strongly recommend this place to everyone.  Great food and service.  Great for nice dine out.

2OyGRT7D4zTtdMnnUPdztQ.text: I order by phone for a delivery, the lady at the phone was nice and the food ( 2 pizzas and 1 calamari ) was delicious. But We wait 60 min for the delivery . Thanks so much, i will order again for sure !!

7Ve_-WVaaGFIvFP9qY3DtA.text: Love it! Upscale Italian eatery. We had a lobster pasta, osso bucco dish and bruschetta appetizer. Loved all of it. Delicious. Great service. Nice wine selection. Pleasant ambiance

c43IF0DWmgHIIb6HGKWGvQ.text: What an amazing experience.  Our fab server Rhonda told us about the specials and we couldn't resist. We started with Calamari with spicy marinara. Definitely worth a go. Crunchy and spicy, not chewy. Then my wife had the double stuffed pork chop. So big she could finish, not to mention tasty.  The ricotta cheese stuffing was to die for. We opted for the seafood ravioli.  They were cooked perfectly with more seafood on top and a light tomato based sauce. Desserts were a delight: creme brulee style custard and I had the Nutella and banana crepes both had the best cappuccino we've had in forever. Be sure to ask to have Rhonda wait on you. Kind pleasant service that's not overbearing. We will be back!

doWUZ1Th1ZYNxQ5OkXb6Nw.text: Just ate here tonight.  My goodness the food was amazing.  I got the Veil, it was tender with a delicious pesto cream sauce.  Owner came by to greet us and was wonderful to meet.  This will be in my rotation for great high class Italian food.

BRQtwdkoto5ecY9bDOm2hA.text: OMG! Off the hook home made italian food..would recommend this place with very high marks. Had the stuffed pork chop special and calamari appetizer. The service and atmosphere are wonderful. Our new favorite place.

ylI3ouJwtRUS5pees64Jbg.text: We were anxiously awaiting this restaurant to open where Gabriellas used to be.   The food-4 out of 5 stars. The owner is from Sicily and the chef is from Venice. So I guess we can call it Italian fusion if fusion can be used as a replacement for over priced. Sauces are very good but for what you get it is not worth the price. The over priced food can possibly be the downfall of this place because I do not see many return visits for that reason.  Service-3 out of 5 stars. Our waiter was eager to please but had zero knowledge of what was available from the bar and I had to get up and walk to the bar to see what beers were available on tap.  Ambience-1 or 2 out of 5. Far from a quiet or possibly romantic place for a quiet dinner. High ceilings and kind of loud. I normally like and get a good feeling when the owner is present,this place the exception. The owner Nico interrupted our dinner conversation twice and he comes off as a bit of an arrogant prick in skinny jeans. When he talks to you it feels like he is talking down to you and I don't think the employees respect him but they are certainly afraid of him which makes for a very uptight feeling amongst the staff. I think he would be better served staying in the kitchen and keeping things running smoothly from there and find a nicer restaurant rep for out front.  We will return but not often because of the prices.

rOf8bL4hIOY5q6h4Jprw_w.text: We really enjoyed our experience here. The prices were fair considering the outstanding quality of the food- the wine selection was very appropriate and the service was good and timely. The ambiance was also refreshing.

6Ra-q5GQwEXNAC2VNBazdw.text: I came to Las Vegas with my family to celebrate my fathers birthday. We wanted something low key and fabulous without breaking the bank. This exceeded all expectations and more. The place is a fabulously decorated, pristine True Italian feel. The service from hostess to server to the gentleman serving our water, gave us warm and skilled service. The food... fresh, authentic, flavorful and exciting with every plate that arrived at the table. Beautiful bar and menu. I loved it, we will be back!

IzEyb_ABrZF7dCZb5pJAMQ.text: I was so excited to try out this place that is just a few blocks from my house. Me and my wife were seated promptly and then we waited . . and waited. The restaurant was less than half full so we were a little confused as to why we were being ignored. We waited for a little over 10 minutes and then just had to give up. The food looked good, unfortunately I can't judge the taste . .

EhxMum17ezgpKr3zFvG1YQ.text: Good location, staff is nice, the food is ok too. Not the warmest welcome when we arrived but still ok place. I wouldn't come back though.

xBCq3RGishUwSRJTMd28Xw.text: The restaurant was recommended by a friend. My first visit was tonight for dinner and what a fined. This restaurant will be listed as one of my best.  Everything was perfect! The service, food and ambiance is just what I want. Who could ask for anything more. The grilled octopus was amazing to start followed by a fresh salad. I had the special which was a whole Dover that they deboned table side.  We also had the  fresh home made ravioli stuffed with lobster. Oh my lord my palette was dancing with joy. The owner Giuseppe was warm and welcoming to us. Will definitely be my go to for Italian food. My complements to the chef.

HU5WiiEU4QJ_MaTj3zY5qA.text: Came here because of yelp reviews, and I was so glad we came! Arrived for lunch menu and ordered the calamari to start. The calamari was breaded lightly and the marinara was extremely tasty.  The calamari was tender and not rubbery at all. For the main course I ordered the lobster ravioli with the shrimp saffron sauce and it was the most delicious creme sauce I've ever had. The service was great...Claudio was our waiter and he was friendly, accommodating and answered all my questions regarding the menu. I highly recommend this little gem.

2JqG5f79qkgp6KlYe_lasw.text: I've been here 3 times. I have taken my son (age 10) after work and I've been there once during lunch. I own a spa in the same center plus I live 2 minutes away. It's convenient.   The service is quite good. They do their very best even when they are busy. There is a little disorganization during busy times however, everyone is friendly and I can tell that owners or investors are there or very hands on. They just opened and I'm truly impressed with their operating ability. It's obvious that there are passionate owners, I've been here 3 times. I have taken my son after work and I've been there once during lunch. I own Axiom Spa in the same center plus I live 2 minutes away. It's convenient.   The service is quite good. They do their very best even when they are busy. There is a little disorganization during busy times however, everyone is friendly and I can tell that owners or investors are there or very hands on. They just opened and I'm truly impressed with their operating ability. It's obvious that there are passionate owners, investors and management. Being this new, it's amazing that they are doing this well and are this busy!  The food is great. The bread is warm and fresh tasting. I've had the chicken, steak, salads and calamari. Everything was good except the organic salad which was utterly overpowering sugary sweet. That is not the flavor one typically seeks when ordering a mixed green organic salad. Perhaps a vinaigrette or lemon dill and oil would be a bit lighter as not to overpower the fresh organic greens prior to a hardy main course. Other than one salad dressing issue I had during lunch, the food is on point.   I've told my staff that they must give this place a try. I seldom review small businesses unless I have great things to say. I seldom post bad reviews unless my experience is a total fail! I am reviewing because as a business owner myself, we thrive on honest positive reviews.   Will I return? Heck yes I will.  management. Being this new, it's amazing that they are doing this well and are this busy!  I'd say they are casual nice and older children friendly. Bring your tiny screaming baby and it will be disruptive in my opinion. This is far nicer place than Olive Garden (I refuse to eat there again). The decor is a bit romantic and chic. It's great for date night and families with older children. They play excellent music, light candles and dim the lights at sunset.   The food is great. The bread is warm and fresh tasting. I've had the chicken, steak, salads and calamari. Everything was good except the organic salad which was utterly overpowering sugary sweet. That is not the flavor one typically seeks when ordering a mixed green organic salad. Perhaps a vinaigrette or lemon dill and oil would be a bit lighter as not to overpower the fresh organic greens prior to a hardy main course. Other than one salad dressing issue I had during lunch, the food is on point.   I've told my staff that they must give this place a try. I seldom review small businesses unless I have great things to say. I seldom post bad reviews unless my experience is a total fail! I am reviewing because as a business owner myself, we thrive on honest positive reviews. This place deserves a mention.  Will I return? Heck yes I will. This place just opened their doors and they are doing what few can do straight out the gate. I can see great things in the future for them.

hb-0vR6dHwmybvRr0fQAzQ.text: I saw the sign and decided to stop in with my husband to check out a new place. It's their first night but everything went very well. The food was good, Branzino especially flavorful and I'm a tiramisu snob and it was very good!! Nice open decor and friendly service. We will definitely be back, especially during fall for the patio.

fFkLROJruv15fi4I66OjEg.text: This was my first time here and i have to say it is one of the best Italian restaurants. Chicken fettuccine Alfredo is always my favorite thing to get and it was absolutely delicious. The staff was also very friendly. I will be coming back

ULPMjS4WhLHJCVe-NhaQ0A.text: Finally the neighborhood has a healthy modern Italian restaurant!  I don't like to leave Green Valley and am getting very tired of the district and don't want to go near eastern(this is between pecos and eastern) on Pebble.  Love the Patio, why don't more restaurants realize people move here for the weather? I live to dine Al Fresco!!  It has a very warm, welcoming vibe, great energy from the staff, a True Italian run restaurant.   Service was excellent but not stuffy or pushy. Our food came out in a timely fashion, the quinoa salad with hazelnuts and blueberry dressing was an exciting new twist,so sick of the ceasar salad and caprese salad. There is so much more to our culture than these cheese laden salads.  Our chicken dish didn't come out drenched in wine and butter, it was light and flavorful.   I'm definitely going back this weekend as they invited us to come and hear the music, and I have to try one of the homemade pastas. I cant wait!     If your looking for a casual, healthy, Italian restaurant with a modern vibe... Prosecco is it!!

d1i-15hwIMO8gu-xOoay2Q.text: I love Italian food and I go to a few places in town that serves authentic Italian food.  A good Italian friend, Morati invited us to try this new restaurant, Prosecco. Oh my gosh, this place is amazing!!  We had their mouthwatering pork belly, calamari and bruschetta for appetizer.  Then for the entree, I had the black pasta with squid.   It is as good if not better than what I had  in Italy! Chef Daniel Dotto and his business partner, Pino, came to introduce themselves.   Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and exquisite food !   Best Italian food in town!!!!

0JpRFczQgWFeljYo2sPGQw.text: Amazing place!  Food was fresh and spectacular! Service was the best it can be.   We ordered the buratina that came with prosciutto and the carpaccio for starters. They were simple but high quality dishes.  They give complimentary bread that was crispy fresh and very interesting yummy dipping from olive oil and herbs.  For the main dishes we got home made ravioli with butter nut squash filling and sage butter sauce, and my friend got rigatoni with tomato sauce, mushrooms and chicken.  As for service, our waiter was quick, very patient to all of my questions and very nice and pleasant.    I absolutely loved this place and will be coming back.

h0bMiCSi7HRehXy_GkTbpA.text: So we came here at the end of brunch kind of sad because the only vegetarian option they had was a pizza I think, which would have probably been phenomenal! But we were about to leave but they handed us a lunch menu so we could see what else they had and they had a vegan pasta that is absolutely amazing, I'd order it again and again and it's angel hair which is my fave! They also do have vegetarian friendly food too! And gluten free. It's a very modern food type Italian when it comes to health concerns which is the best thing ever. The raviolis my mum got and she finished them and she never finishes them! Anyways. Hands down amazing. Can't wait to come back for dinner and get down in food.  The olive oil bread dip does have anchovies, so if you don't eat meat, be ware, but mum said it was amazing!!!  Love this place already. Thank you for such amazing food and service! Recommending all my family, friends, and clients to come here too.

d1CGDcijFHs54vrjqqKDyQ.text: Great food and decor, hidden gem thank you yelp for helping me find it! Only thing I would change is the music. It didn't seem to go with the Italian theme and was not relaxing. Food was amazing We split  a pizza and beet and goat cheese salad with shrimp which had amazing spices on them and we were definitely full The Nutella. Crepes with bananas were amazing  Wonderful wine selection

nUXiMRs_JvdxYVe0EJuURw.text: Not sure how anyone would give this place less than 5 stars!  First let me start by saying the atmosphere here is great.  I went this weekend and they have a guy playing the sax to all sorts of different music.  So fun!  The service is fantastic, and you won't have less than half a glass of water, EVER!  The food, however, is the best part.  I've lived in Vegas for 6 years now and been to so many great Italian places, but none this good (including i Mulino, carbone... etc). Prosecco has the best meatballs I've ever had and every entree/side I've ever gotten has been 5 stars.   I can't stress enough, go here.  Everything is fantastic. I have an old client coming in town tonight and this is where I'm having him meet me for dinner!

9vhToM1nLCt-8rNyUSXD_Q.text: May not be the best review as we ordered take out and did not dine in but food was really bland. We ended up seasoning and adding veggies from the fridge to brighten and add flavor. The dipping sauce that came with the bread was the best and had all the flavor the main courses didn't. We ordered the pasta in lemon and olive oil, which didn't have that fresh citrus flavor.

UQD8h3NVoWBjL5g16j9qGQ.text: Went for an appetizer before a movie and after looking at the menu and saw the food coming out of the kitchen stayed for dinner!  Their mantra is "fresh" and it was.  My Agnolotti alla Piemontese (stuffed ravioli with mushroom, ricotta and creamy black truffle sauce) was incredible.  This was probably my top five meals in Vegas since I moved here 6 years ago.  AUTHENTIC Italian, hand crafted pastas, great wines, lovely server, upbeat atmosphere, great attention to detail and the restroom was spotlessly clean.  Easy parking, outside seating, they expedited our dinner because we were going to a movie...top notch.  I will be back next week.  Attire: Dressy is appropriate but jeans were fine.

cdUGA2J4UMwCQ8_bEfDNAg.text: The food was great, music is inspiring and Marco our server is very knowledgeable of the food they serve, he's very pleasant. We will definitely bring our friends and family here.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mark the Saxophonist was awesome.

1Aro43fL6FlGYBPkFZqHFQ.text: Ordered Caprese salad at $13.00 and chicken parm for $24.00 delivered. Both were very small portions and boring flavors. For $40 per person I expected to be dazzled. Very disappointed and will not recommend this place to anyone.

AmWNTxUVmAKO2rQy_LSAQQ.text: We went here for Sunday brunch. The manager (owner?) Nico, our waiter (didn't catch his name, #7) and the saxophone player were all amazing! Portion sizes and prices are very fair and the food was excellent. The waiter went out of his was to help us out when we didn't have cash for the saxophone player. We tipped him an extra $10 and he put the $10 into the tip jar in front of us. We will definitely be back!

3hz6yiizH95zO2ZxmocZ5g.text: One of my new favorite, if not most favorite, restaurants ever! I have never been more impressed flavor wise. My husband and I love this place. This. Place is a MUST try- you will not be disappointed!!

3jAthV74ZiF4tKnQVBOPKw.text: My first time here and all the food we ordered was delicious!!! Between the 3 of us, we ordered 5 items. We scarfed down the food so fast that we forgot all about taking pictures. Its a nice spot away from the strip. Its not overly priced and the service was spot on. I'll be back for more!

xspkb4dewdezJPi3uGDn5w.text: This is a friendly, comfortable local restaurant with fresh food. The pasta they tell me is from Italy, which is why it tasted better than the stuff I serve at home. I had the lobster pasta with shrimp, (which were few) and my guy had meatball pasta. Both were very delicious. The service was friendly and prompt. The owners were there, greeting everyone and answering questions. It was a little noisy inside. Maybe next time we'll sit outside.

yP1fditGdOr38XLb5w72xQ.text: This is a standard setting Italian restaurant. As I told one employee, Italian is easy to prepare, difficult to differentiate. The Insalada Caprese was the real treat. The wine list short but high end. My lasagna was great as well. I'll come back some time.

bbePuJ8CGZcW6kG5DiGvwg.text: We went to Prosecco Saturday night and sorry to say I was not impressed. The service was fine and the atmosphere was pleasant. However the food was just ok. I ordered the Mediterranean seafood and the lobster portion was basically empty. The sauce is not so Italian to me, it was a bit weak. I probably won't go there again. So sorry.

pgHu6NUUdHcMsJ87kkSdbQ.text: Very friendly and helpful staff, food is excellent! I'm very picky with Italian food. I was surprised that the pasta was cool correctly!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very impressive food! The staff was very attentive and helpful. I recommend sitting at the bar and enjoying the artwork!

v6fckIq22XvMEEAkkUJyig.text: Went on a weekday during the evening and the restaurant was almost full house! It was my first experience here and it was a pleasant one. My friend recommended this place to us. Being a pasta fan, I just had to check this restaurant out.  Service wise, my boyfriend and I had a bit confusion when we asked about the specialties and menu items. The server has a thick accent so it was more like a language barrier but I can tell he knew his menu very well. It wasn't a big deal at all. The wine list was all reasonable priced too so we couldnt miss out on a drink.  We ordered three entrees-  Canellonni Gratinati: Very cheesy oven baked pasta. We wanted to order the alfredo but went for this instead. It was equally delicious and we did not regret ordering this instead  Bianca San Daniele: Pizza with proscruitto, arugula, and truffle oil. The hint of truffle oil was great. We had left overs so we took it home. 2nd day pizza tasted much better.  Lobster Supreme: Lobster seafood pasta!!! This one was devoured first. The lobster tail was soft and tender. I am not a pasta expert but the pasta noodles were so soft and yummy! Cant beat house made noodles.  Creme brulee: My boyfriend said he was stuffed and cant eat any more. Guess who ate more because it was delicious.... (yup). I am not the biggest fan of creme brulee just because sometimes it tastes way too sugary or you can taste the vanilla extract a bit too much but it wasn't overpowering at all! Perfect for my little sweet tooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8QnWYhPrII3UzNcZS42NvA.text: Some of the best Italian food I've ever had! The service was great and was excellent.  We had the Fettuccine Tocco and linguine medeterraneo. Both were incredible!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GYz4tXFTRdSb7nfNsS913A.text: The food and service are always amazing. A real hidden gem for the locals. Highly recommend.

cRsU5WHWQyEmL5-juAHwfg.text: Mama mia! Im so glad we found this hidden gem! Its a cute little place that we go by all the time and would have never went into but saw it had amazing reviews on yelp and did. We had the Bianca San Daniel pizza for appetizer that was FOODGASMIC, my favorite. Thin crust with mozzarella, mushrooms, truffle oil, prosciutto, arugula and sliced parmesan cheese. Definitely a must try and I will be back for.  I had the fettuccine tocco, short ribs that melt in your mouth its so tender and pasta with what tasted like the short rib sauce. It was good. My husband had the lasagna, he liked it and to go we took home spaghetti and meatballs for our son, it wasn't his favorite but still good. I cant wait to go back for the pizza and try some more dishes.

d4Yp57Ds9ZaUcUY5P745tg.text: My father-in-law was visiting a couple of weeks ago and requested Italian food for dinner on a Tuesday. Popped on to Yelp for ideas and Prosecco wasn't too far from home.  The whole experience was awesome. We had the Calamari Dorati for our app - so good! Everyone loved their entrees. FIL had spaghetti and meatballs and remarked several times that he liked the smoothness of the pasta sauce vs the tartness you usually get. Husband got the Ravioli d' Aragosta and he was in heaven. He offered me a tiny bite and it was delicious - strong on the shrimp and lobster flavors, which isn't always the case. Our 10-year-old got the pepperoni pizza, which was nice and large. She wasn't a fan of the pepperoni they use (it's not the red circles that you're used to), but the adults thought it was very good. I ordered the Agnolotti di Zucca and it was life changing! The combination of the freshly made pasta, the butternut squash and ricotta filling, and the butter sage sauce was phenomenal. The sauce was beautiful.   Husband and I had a date night 4 days later and came back to Prosecco. It was PACKED on Saturday night, so don't forget to make a reservation! We got lucky and the owner seated us at a table in the bar area. Husband ordered the Ravioli d' Aragosta again because he loves it so much. I ordered the Ruby salad. I could live on that salad! It was delicious.

HVlK3Yj6WslYSvC13djpuw.text: We go here almost on a weekly basis.  The service is not only great, the staff and owners are very welcoming.  The food is very good and they just enhanced their menu by adding many of their popular specials.  Great value for the experience too.

itPtT9jqpxd_5Q_Y3c4ziQ.text: What an amazing experience we had dining here last week! The service was amazing, ambience was excellent, and the food was absolutely superb. The spaghetti & meatballs along with the cannelloni were authentic and delicious, but the calamari with their homemade spicy marinara sauce was out of this world! The bread is divine as well, I think we ate at least three baskets of it. Can't wait to go back!

1kN4Dd-tp3J41zWaBhxF3w.text: Our Second time in 10 days and again Superb!  Last night the place was full and everybody was enjoying.  Our service and food was terriffic.  My wife and I enjoyed a great meal and were welcomed back which was nice.  Every dish we try is great.  The desserts are made in-house and the Tiramisu is super light and delicious.  We will definitely go back!

W-R4KvohMQdZZh1EjdQDnw.text: Great Fresh Italian food. Live Music! Nice seperate bar area and modern decor. Great service. Amazing menu with top seasonal specials. We will be back! Try Chillean Sea Bass, or Lobstertail pasta. Yummmy!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple, spicy meatballs! Yummy
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moon shaped butternut squash pasta. Yummy Yummy!
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live Music!

MGBg8jm36xdFyckk21Cq9w.text: I've been in Vegas 43 years. Can't count the Italian Restraints I've eaten in. This place is hands down one of if not the best. Service..Excellent..Atmosphere..Excellent..Presentation..Excellent..Food.. I've been there 4 times and every time it is Of the Charts!! Had the lunch menu raviolis  today for lunch..The best ever!! Everything I've had all,four times, has been absolutely excellent. Give this place a try and you will become a regular, guaranteed.  Back again with family for Christmas Dinner. Everybody loved it. This place Is well ran, even the owner is running around helping. It's a winner in every way. If you try it you will LOVE IT!!!

0SQCZeFZmksD587uh4qNjA.text: Excellent food, excellent service! Found this place via yelp (of course) and they have well deserved 4.5 *plus* stars. Staff was super friendly and progressional, the owner was rotating and checking on tables and the hostess was delightful. I'll be back! I'll let the food speak for itself!!

mdXpXmEYlu55c74nRRAQkg.text: The service was good - food was pricey for quantity and quality. Not my favorite Italian spot.   I had the chicken Parmesan which is one of my favorite go to Italian dishes and my boyfriend got seafood pasta. Mediocre - especially for the price.

M1_-8IlZPMjMnPrFQLNOHQ.text: We've been to Prosecco at least 5 times in the last 2 months! Our first visit there was on a Sunday while the brunch menu was being served. I was banking on shrimp pasta. Seeing that it wasn't being offered at that time, we were about to politely leave BUT the owner accommodated us so we stayed and we are so glad we did!   HANDS DOWN ONE OF THE BEST PASTA DISHES OF MY LIFE! 4 big shrimps, the pasta was perfection and the sauce was OMG heavenly!   This place transcends you by their authentic, deliciousness! I may not get to go to Italy soon but I love how I can get close to it by a having a meal at this hidden gem!

V-qfbW75JxhNG89IyjBzLg.text: I think I have bad luck when it comes to Italian dining.  Prosecco fits the bill.    Looking forward to a nice dinner with friends, we were all anxious to experience a new place.  An experience it was.  The service wasn't quite what I expected.  We didn't have a definitive waiter.  Many gentlemen stopped at our table during the evening.  It was unsettling when we had to repeat our order at the end of the evening because he didn't know who ordered which entree.  It was also unsettling when I ask one waiter if they offer Moscato and he says yes.  A different gentlemen comes back with Riesling telling me it's the same and they don't have Moscato.  I reluctantly took the Riesling but the magic act was unnecessary.    For my meal I started with the Caesar Salad.  It was a very large portion I which I could share with my husband.  Great flavor with freshly shaved Parmesan was delicious.    I also opted for the Stuffed Salmon.  Well, you could probably just name it salmon because there was very very little crab stuffing.  The fish was also over cooked. It was not a dish I would recommend.    With a competitive restaurant town, I would've hoped for a better presentation.  A three hour overpriced meal left me underwhelmed.

E4E2T6GqJI_VIBxxOH-mOw.text: Ordered delivery last night, the lasagna and the eggplant parmigiana.  The lasagna was pretty good as well as the pasta that came with the eggplant.  The eggplant parmigiana was not good at all.  It was very bitter, very chewy and just did not taste good.  My wife was not able to eat it and if we had been in the restaurant, this is a dish we would have sent back, but unfortunately we were at home.  I do like this place, we've been here several times and have never really had a bad dish until last night.  I guess this is one dish we will stay away from next time.

wdBkbCk1gG_W8JdKP9fMJw.text: My new all time favorite Italian restaurant!  Service, food quality, ambiance, and menu were all on point.   Prosecco servers treat you like family when you dine at their establishment.   Their bread and tapenade are to die for to start - don't skimp or pass on their bread you will regret it!  Their have a good wine list and an extremely reasonable bottle of prosecco on their list for the table.   Their pastas taste home made. My favorite is the rosemary infused short rib pasta.  Charred octopus grilled perfectly al dente.  Outdoor patio available. Full bar available.   My go to Italian restaurant of choice moving forward

0LY1e3ohXlvQsGr9RlyrJw.text: Fantastic as always! Being that it was Mother's Day, we didn't realize they were only serving a specific menu for brunch. We come here quite often and love the spaghetti. So we asked if there was a way to get spaghetti and they accommodated us! I Couldn't have asked for a better experience! I highly recommend this place. The food is incredible. Thank you Chef for making my mothers day! Nicco was so helpful and our waitress Rhonda was great!!! Highly recommended!!
