Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Mediterranea
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small side of spaghetti and meatball

kqaCZ3EVxlzEbbLdQt_MhA.text: Four of us went to dinner on Thursday night we had a very pleasant time. 2 of us ordered chicken Parmesan one order the special sea food risotto and I ordered the pizza. Presentation on all of the food was great I had the pizza which was really really excellent. The seafood risotto was fine..The two persons that had the chicken Parmesan were satisfied but the chicken was slightly dry. All in all it was a really good experience and we would go back.

MMcqXO-65p9W5WwZmjR2tg.text: I do not understand how this place has 4 1/2 stars. I came here to give it another chance and this will be the last chance. I ordered 2 pastas to go from the hostess and it was $34 and I give her $40 and her response was "do you want your change?". What kind of Restaurant has their hostess begging for tips from takeout orders? Also i brought the food home and the oil for the bread was opened and leaked all over everything and the Pasta was just cold and horrible and bland again. The customers that come here obviously know nothing about real italian food. If you want real italian amazing pasta try Chef Marc's.. his food is amazing.

CuBEi1CPPH4xPQSU21hrMQ.text: So happy we decided to come here!  This restaurant is truly amazing!  From the owners, the chef, the staff, the food, and the ambiance.  I made reservations a couple weeks in advance for 2. We were celebrating our anniversary and decided to try some place new.  From the moment we walked inside, we were treated like royalty.  The hostess greeted us with a huge smile and one of the owners welcomed us to the establishment. It was an uphill experience from there.  We drank and ate with gusto.  The staff was attentive and made sure we were set.  The lasagna and scampi paprika were fresh and delicious. My favorite part of the meal was dessert.  The tiramisu was the best I've tasted in Vegas. Hands down!  Their espresso martini paired wonderfully with the dessert.  If that wasn't enough, we were presented with 2 limoncello for our anniversary.  It was a sweet gesture. The other 2 owners (one of whom is also the chef), came out and greeted their patrons throughout the evening.   This was such a wonderful place to enjoy an amazing meal in a warm, classy and welcoming setting.  We will definitely be returning!

5-RsoTL-USo1ODFJJRMU3w.text: This was a  disappointment! I had chicken parmigiana and it was so tough I could tell the chicken is not fresh and it was frozen. My husband had pasta and it was terrible as he couldn't even finish his dish. We decided not to have dessert as we were afraid what it would taste like. I will definitely not return. I was hoping it was authentic Italian and it was nothing close to it. I know what good Italian food taste like as I come from New York where there is a lot of great Italian restaurants.

zNTJwL5_Pm9-tBDmRxDGsA.text: Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in Henderson and probably our favorite place to go to in The Las Vegas area for Italian. Authentic and has a great ambiance. Quality of Service is amazing. Very consistent experience. Must have their Branzino and their Seafood pasta. Yum!  Last night was so amazing. Can't wait to go back

Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass over risotto

SLB9xL1VaWXFDNePnra28w.text: 0 for 2 with Prosecco. I will say all of the staff are very italian and very friendly, but that's where the fun ends. On our first visit we ended up walking out after no one ever came over to us after being seated.   I only returned because my mom chose Prosecco for mothers day brunch. We arrived right on time for our 10:30 reservation. We asked for 11:00 but were told it was overbooked. Needless to say there were many open tables the entire time we were there.   We were seated quickly and had our water glasses filled. Again it took quite a long time for our waiter to come over and acknowledge us. He took our drink orders and said he would be back for our food order. Someone else brought out the drinks while we watched our waiter visit many other tables. He did finally return. My mom ordered the strawberry crepes and I ordered the "benny and the ham", their play on eggs benedict.   The food took a while to arrive, but that was expected for mothers day brunch. Although my mom enjoyed her crepes, my dish was absolutely terrible. Overcooked eggs on top of bland potatoes and the most dried out overcooked piece of ham I have ever eaten. The poached eggs were cooked completely through. Our waiter never returned to check on us and see how the food was or ask if we wanted drink refills. Dirty dishes sat in front of us long after we were finished.   After two very disappointing visits to Prosecco, there won't be a third.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Over cooked dry ham and over cooked eggs :(
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry crepes

DVogGzI6gSaLoL91Xkf7ow.text: One of my favorite Italian Restaurants to hit up when I visit!  The pizza is amazing and so is the Eggplant parm!  Very friendly staff and excellent service!

A3_qrHNj6mVALmQ38oLgIA.text: Great atmosphere and fresh food.  Wait times between courses were perfect.  All the staff we interacted with were friendly and talkative.  Great neighborhood place.

MQBWpnp3zRvHG5h-mWCd6Q.text: First off, I can't believe I haven't been to this place before. I've lived in the area for years and finally tonight I decided to come and had a great experience! This is some of the best Italian food I've had in years, and my husband agrees. I got the spaghetti and meatball, and he got the chicken Parmesan. Everything from V sauce to the cheese and the margaritas tasted exquisite. I really felt a genuine Italian vibe when walking in the front door. The manager came and spoke to us personally and was very hospitable and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nD-_cr820aKXfULl0HRAsA.text: The best Italian restaurant ever!!! Very good, professional, fancy, and inviting! Will definitely recommend and will come back. Decor is very nice feels like we are on the strip at a restaurant.

ONUvzr7jBNLoGeCEYL6zkg.text: I've been here twice now! Ordered the Beef Carpaccio both times, outstanding. Everyone else in my party enjoyed the linguine Mediterranean ,ravioli d'arogosta and veal chop. The one thing we did not like were the desserts. We ordered one of each. Not sure why the cannoli had a lemon flavor, the mousse prosecco with strawberry coulis had no flavor, however the Nutella crepe and Tiramisu was delicious. The atmosphere is nice and the service is always good. Looking forward to returning for dinner soon. Great for parties, families and dining with friends.

7kM96jwmEZ-6zuGo8ahLNg.text: Our second time here, but we ended up leaving before being seated. We made a reservation but they wanted to seat us at the bar - I don't understand why restaurants do this. Reservations are intended for dining room seating. There were other open tables but the hostess said they were reserved for other reservations. She made it sound like we were walk in customers or that our reservation was less important than the others. The hostess kept claiming they were fully booked, but they were still taking reservations on the Open Table app!  The first time we were here, the food was excellent, but service was extremely slow. It took over 2 hours and we are fast diners. After this attempted visit, it seems they need to improve service all around.  Disappointing because we live 20 minutes away and drove all the way here, only to leave and go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini Mediterranea
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Insalada Prosecco (cucumber, heirloom tomato, avocado, mango)
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari (marinara is slightly spicy but good!)

YVophN9ocqlM-J93KFet1A.text: I'll start by saying that our food was delicious.  I had the chicken marsala and my husband some sort of seafood pasta. Yum! When we first arrived we were seated in the bar because the dining room tables were all reserved.  Service was great, the waitstaff was very attentive.  But then as the dining room filled up we seemed to be forgotten. Our entrees arrived in a timely manner but then we had to ask for a box and a dessert menu, then the manager finally came over to take our dessert order after we had sat with the dessert menus for about 10 minutes then it took forever to get our dessert,  a self saucing pudding (which was over cooked and definitely did not have any sauce). Its a great little place they just need to work on consistent service.

L80f7Xlh0NsAcvVMV4TJJA.text: We went to Prosecco based on the great Yelp reviews and boy were we NOT disappointed!    The atmosphere is great.  The food/wine was spectacular.  Rhonda (our waitress) was funny, pleasant and helpful with the menu; she made dinner that much better!  They had an off the menu tomahawk steak!  If you're looking for a remarkable and affordable Italian restaurant give Prosecco a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Lobster Supreme.  It&#39;s linguine sautéed w/lobster tail &amp; baby shrimp in roasted garlic white wine tomato sauce.  It&#39;s awesome!

q142bKNgXv-TI6ud3k_gsw.text: One of the owner/managers has left (Guiseppi?) and while still a pretty good place, the level of friendly service and ambience has declined IMO.  That can happen with a management change.   First, turn the music WAY down.  The interior is very pretty but with high ceilings and full house, it *is* noisy.  Combine that with SANTANA on the speakers and we were leaning in to talk.  Second, our server was efficient but had a bit of an attitude, meaning when we commented that the Pinot Grigio seemed unusually sweet, she promptly contradicted us, saying it was not sweet (!?).  OK, that was uncomfortable.  Third, the meal was good but not outstanding.  Our party split the check 50/50, and left, leaving a nice tip despite the apparent adverse changes since we were last in.    But wait, there's more!  We were *in the car* leaving when the host came running out into the parking lot yelling there was problem with our check and the charged amount was incorrect, meaning my portion was UNDERCHARGED!  Can you imagine an 'upscale' establishment chasing its customers around for an additional lousy $20 bucks outside claiming they owed more the meal, after the restaurant had made the mistake in the first place?    Then, the real jaw dropper:  as I was signing the "revised" check, the server (who also chased us into the parking lot), asked if I was going to re-add the $10 dollar tip.  This was after she screwed up the bill and chased me down for it!  You can't make this stuff up.  Isolated experience in an otherwise good place?  You be the judge.  I'm not going back.

dJOweX4LWPhPlNnAugnpNQ.text: I take my wife and kids rather often to this place and I have never been disappointed. Staff is super friendly and accommodative (kids make a mess) and the food is always top notch. I usually go for the items on the daily special menu but I highly recommend the Ruby beat salad and the Carpaccio. Outdoor seating is nice and the interior is modern and very nice too.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AYR2rky_slVuYoo_4sXYKA.text: Wow, amazing. Authentic cuisine. Moderately priced for everything being homemade. The chicken parm was so tender, no knife was needed. The meatballs were perfect. The bread, so rustic and delicious with a fresh made olive oil basil dipping sauce. Dinner starts at 3 so go for a late lunch to enjoy an expanded menu and Chef specials. I can't wait come back and try the homemade ravioli. Save room for the Creme Brulee, you've never tasted anything so smooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z8sRsf___1pau3bBMn8NyQ.text: Great authentic  Italian Food. The ambiance is great. Can be romantic or good for family. Service is wonderful. The bar area was Festive with what seemed like regulars. A great fine in Vegas.

rvIc-rpMPTlCDQ568CrjMA.text: One of the best Italian restaurants I have eaten at. The service is outstanding. The ravioli was excellent, outside dining was beautiful.

_4TI4HTE-LoIOdSLujZ9Ag.text: LOVE.   This restaurant is on Eastern and the 215- which is a short drive for me.  The atmosphere is classy and yet casual.   My husband and I sat at the bar for a drink before the rest of our party arrived.  We were there early enough on a Saturday that it wasn't too busy.  The bartender recommended wine, and I loved what she let me taste- a special reserve Chianti.  The second time I went to this restaurant, I had Prosecco which was also great. We had the burrata cheese appetizer and carpaccio which was excellent.  The entrees were all fantastic- and desert was even better.   I love that the owner/chef walked around to talk to people, and the bussers/waiters were friendly and attentive.   If you are looking for authentic Italian, off the strip, this is the place to check out.  I will be going back!

The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable about the whole menu.  We tried two of the appetizer specials and throughly enjoyed everything.  The tiramisu and expresso martini ROCKED! Looking forward to going back.

zk9MZiYzhpe83goKGRNtMQ.text: It's an okay place to get a drink as the bar and atmosphere was nice, The food we got wasn't to my liking, it's a little too rich for me and not was what I was expecting.  2 stars at best for the food, 4 stars for the atmosphere and the bar.

S3x5LXBvgAJ9Tl0okUuczA.text: My entire family was craving Italian after we left the movies and we didn't want to deal with the hectic craziness of the strip . so we looked up this restaurant on yelp!!!!   it was amazing the dip from the appetizer bread everyone's dish they ordered was very tasty   there was a price difference from what I looked up online thru yelp and when I got there the menu item were more $$$

6k2YFSXOD5N2pUEWly2Jzg.text: Seriously authentic Italian food. I knew the owners must be Sicilian and Southern Italian because their special was pasta with black ink sauce- very Sicilian. Then I overheard a conversation in Italian, and finally heard my favorite Italian pop star, Jovanotti playing in the background. With all of this observed as I sat down I asked for a Moretti and wouldn't you know it- they have it dark and light and on tap.   I really didn't even need a menu. I had to try the calamari and eggplant. Eggplant is my personal  test that soooo many Las Vegas Italian restaurants fail. I am a Jersey/New York transplant who had a 100 year old grandmother from Calabria cook me meals every weekend until her death. I am not easy to impress.  The calamari was perfectly cooked, my son loved it and their red sauce was spicy but not crazy hot. The eggplant was done the right way- not some crazy California interpretation. It was just a little mushy in the center, but eggplant parm is not easy.  The gelato and cannoli were excellent! The menu said Sicilian cannoli and it does the island proud. The service was very good, very friendly and I look forward to returning with friends and family.   Mille grazie, Prosecco!

7bP0PaNbEBqQJ4AAzpBa_Q.text: Worst Customer service ever....... Food was nothing to write home about. Wobbly tables, tried moving tables, waiter flipped out  & turned into douchbag cause restaurant was empty. Took forever to receive order in a empty restaurant. Busboy was nice, but we won't be back.........  Bye Felicia

m73_tpV9KN355BQ_ncgRTQ.text: Amazing service! Legit best Italian spot in Vegas and you don't even need to mess with a strip hotel. Had the Ruby salad and Lobster Tail, both excellent.  Place was slammed but one of the owners took the time to come over and check that everything was cool. Will be coming back for sure.

Pr1t66a5M_tO4Fay9k07tA.text: Delicious authentic Italian food . The place is very cute modern and elegant . The staff is great I always seat at the bar and the bartenders are very friendly and make your experience the best . My favorite spot if I'm craving Italian food :)

XOuaqxk4D0G1yy5fHpQ_zA.text: I was so excited about Prosecco, I live so close and couldn't wait to make this my new Italian spot. I've been here two times before and something's always been a little off but it wasn't worth mentioning. But today will be the last time I ever step foot in this restaurant. I decided to stop in for lunch, I had the Caesar salad to start and it was terrible. Oh my gosh the lettuce was wilted, yellow and a little red I was actually scared to take one bite. I couldn't believe they would try to pass that off to anyone but nevertheless things happen so it wasn't the end of the world. What bothered me was the servers reaction to our concerns and also that it was still on the bill at the end. When we mentioned it he seemed so irritated. Also, being here previously I was expecting the delicious complimentary bread and olive oil but it never came and I never mentioned it because I assumed that it must be just for dinner service. I was really disappointed when I saw that the two tables beside us were offered the bread. Maybe I'm looking too much into it but words can't describe how this type of service can make a person feel, was it the way we looked, the way we were dressed? I don't know, but being in this industry myself, I expected so much more.

W9g3w8nHtWc5HTuENKHfjw.text: I have two young daughters and much to my chagrin, they love Olive Garden. I don't mind it terribly; the OG is affordable, consistent, and very family friendly. But I was able to convince them to step out of their comfort zone to try a new Italian place in our neighborhood. Unfortunately, Prosecco didn't do enough to earn our return business.   Service was friendly but slow. Waters sat empty. Drink orders were forgotten, came out wrong, and then to add insult to injury - double charged. Since it took 40 minutes for our food to come out we were now hungry, thirsty and annoyed. The kids love to play restaurant where they stand at the table and "take our order." Despite half the tables having kids with them, the owner came over and asked "are these yours?" (Our children) and then lectured us on how unsafe it is for them to be standing where waiters may be walking.  It's a shame because the meatballs and calamari were both quite good. Clam linguine was pretty light on clams, including multiple shells that came out empty.  I want to cheer the arrival of an upscale new restaurant but they left too much to be desired and worst of all left us feeling unwelcome.  Ps over $100 for an appetizer, a side, an entree, a kids meal and wine.

4dkPkUy0vWhXWw8yuP06Wg.text: Wow!  Thanks "YELP" for a fantastic find for out-of-town visitors searching for fresh cuisine!  We are spending just a few days in Las Vegas enroute to our final destination and wanted a fun restaurant with a great Happy Hour and quality food and drinks. We tried Prosecco our first night and have been back every night since to explore Prosecco's culinary creations.  Be sure to ask the friendly staff for the daily specials that local residents crave. Special shout-outs to knowledgeable staff members Brandy, Teya, Nico, and especially Giuseppe (he looks so much like martial arts master Steven Seagal that I had to order everything he recommended .... and it was DELICIOUS!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino Wet - perfect, bold taste!

6RGm-2wUR-d8lHsLn_VVtQ.text: My family came here before my daughter's college graduation. Beautiful atmosphere. Delicious and fresh food. My family will definitely will be be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry creeps.

ZgZjT4EehZ9zxz5tmSLZUQ.text: Hands down this was one of the best experiences. Took my girlfriend and her mother here (had to make a good impression).First, we were greeted by the hostess and the owner right away. Was seated in front of the kitchen so we could our food being prepped and all the handmade pasta being created. Already amazing. The server was very friendly and prompt. Introduced himself, memorized all the specials, and made some great recommendations. After snacking on the homemade bread or food was ready in an instant. You can taste the love that was put into the food like it was your own mother! Every bite was better than the last. While enjoying, the owner stopped by to check on us and made sure everything was going well. To end the night, we had Crema Bruciata (highly recommended) and Limoncello to finish it off. Everything was very reasonably priced for what you are getting. On our way out the owner thanked us for our business and hoped to see us again. Well my friend, you will.   If you are looking for a great Italian kitchen, look no further. This place is relatively new, but seems like they've been doing this for years. A+ service, food, and atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rigatoni Paesana! So much flavor! Goes great with the leftover bread too! ;)
Photo of Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dessert is to die for! Crema bruciata and Limonchello. This is a must have when stopping by for lunch/dinner.

1CvA6DmFLkBfpDeJSQCIAg.text: Ate there yesterday, as usual.. great food, excellent service and fantastic atmosphere. I laughed so hard after reading a review from a chef from San Francisco that didn't like the food but want a free dinner with his family there again for FREE.. LoL that was amusing and real funny.. I love reading the reviews on Yelp, there's always an free loading idiot there..

wRbFjgtDXdTsOG_p7d2PUA.text: Great food, wonderful atmosphere. Great wine options. The waitstaff was very knowledgeable about the wine selection and flexible about subbing out sides. The sauces tasted super-fresh! The restaurant was incredibly busy, so there were times where we ran out of wine and water and had to flag staff over. Prices were exactly what you would expect.

F6MsQFMuboIpCiW2SoYyqw.text: If I could give ten stars I would. Beautiful atmosphere. The staff is so genuinely nice. Never once were our glasses empty. Tables were cleared quickly. The owner walks throughout the dining area greeting his guests which is a plus in my book. Even the chef would come out at times to say hello. Very family friendly feeling. Now the food? Wow! I am Italian and my family is from Bari Italy and let me tell you? Venetian food (Venice) it melts like butter in your mouth. Just like being home in the old country. Wonderful selection of wines. This will be our home away from home from now on!

cm-BXFVfZ0W7yOHknx6dNA.text: Brand new Italian restaurant located in Henderson hits the spot for authentic Italian cuisine.  Friendly staff all around with a very clean and open restaurant that definitely reminds you of being in Italy.  The outdoor seating is great when the weather allows, unfortunately everyone moved inside on my first visit due to winds but I'm sure it didn't take away from their excellent dining experience at Prosecco.  Great place for a date or a romantic evening and there's even a bar to dine at if rolling solo.  The portions are just right and perfect for family style.  My first meal at Prosecco included the lobster ravioli as my entree which was delicious preceded by the mango salad which was large enough to serve 2-3 people in my opinion.  The taste and presentation of both dishes were excellent and pricing was very reasonable.  Definitely going back soon!

rzDtYjpv4z6f06PMKkZ7fQ.text: Ordered take out and loved the pasta with Vodka sauce! The pizza cane with salami instead of pepperoni a tiny bit odd but ok! Just salty.

9OcC6uyT9qvcwjzQUmgY0w.text: What fresh flavors. Made reservations here based on Yelp and Open Table. Great decision. Not busy for Sunday night dinner. Caesar salad was only so so part. We had Koranic salad and insalata Prosecco. Both were so fresh and delicious. We had salmon, Chilean sea bass, and angel hair pasta. We all loved it. Top 2 picks- Chilean sea bass and insalata. Yummmmm!

8subpVwHwM2Pk2bFdim4QA.text: This is a vast improvement over the last establishment at the site. Service was excellent and the food is fresh and tasty. Good selection of wines as well.  The Managers/Owners work the floor well but tend to spend more time at certain tables with I would guess "favorite" customers and seem to pass by our table and others.  That would be my only negative but after mentioning it to our server we did get a visit better late then never I imagine.

DZnadvYl_CnlxpH0IO7WHQ.text: I was recently in New Orleans and attempted to find good Italian food, not so lucky.  I couldn't wait to get back to Vegas and make reservations here.  The food is amazing,  if you're visiting it's highly recommended to get off the strip and dine at a locals favorite.  I would recommend making reservations,  as on the weekends they are packed.  Trust the locals on fantastic food, you will enjoy the experience and dream of the food when you return to your home town!

WmuitA8sH5p2tTFH6WR42g.text: Found this restaurant driving thru the plaza at Eastern/Pebble on a Saturday. Read the reviews and decided to go for Sunday dinner. There were 3 of us for dinner. When we walked in, we were asked if we had a reservation. We did not and didn't think we needed one. The restaurant was less than half full. We were seated and no one came to greet us for at least 10 minutes. Finally "someone" came over and asked if we wanted drinks. I say "someone" because we were never told his name. It took a while to get a coke, iced tea and a water. At this point it started to get busier so we ordered. We had the calamari appetizer. It was good. Our meals included lasagna, eggplant parm & canneloni. Decent sized plates except for the lasagna. It was not thick and was more flat and long.  The taste of the food was decent. Prices were a bit higher than average.   I paid great attention to the details and the surroundings. As the place filled up, 2 men walked around introducing themselves and spending time with each table full of guests. No one came to our table. We had to ask for refills on the water and eventually the other drinks.  It is a cramped setting. Too many tables inside along the front area. Perhaps the tables (for 2) along the windows shouldn't be there. The guests had trouble getting through the table area and the servers certainly had difficulties as well. We had approximately 1 foot between our table and the one next to us - I felt like I was on their date with them.   Plenty of wait staff, but seemed to be still learning since they weren't very attentive.

NiQhtvqgM4CdQvTTaR_Ijw.text: I wanted to like this place based on other reviews but I unfortunately I did not.  The food was okay, really nothing special.  I had the Pollo Limone e Capperi and It wasn't very lemony and while there were capers I couldn't really taste them.  I also had the tiramisu for dessert and it was soggy so i couldn't each much of it.  A good thing was the service was pretty good, they were attentive and very nice however there weren't many people in the restaurant so I'm sure if their attention is due to the lack of customers or if they're normally like that.

LvW_oUwv_pozKtED3cxvzg.text: Worst service ever! Didn't bring my food on time. Messed up the order. Food did not seem fresh either! I would expect some service for the money I pay!

ZdNVJ_VwXFUWD4TP5UP4GA.text: We had not been her in at least six months and i must say, it was better than i remembered. The service and food were excellent.  The only negative was that in felt a bit rushed when our meal was completed. We brought friends for their first visit and they ere impressed and can't wait for another meal. Worth the money for sure.

qsdWtb9BESfq59UpgJT-1w.text: First time visit was Christmas Eve, it seemed like a club that everyone else was dining was known and greeted, we were put by the door and had very slow service. Manager stopped at every other table but ours did not feel welcomed. Food was good but will not go back.

gAK5sdlUHYOTnSdW55zi8A.text: Food was great, service was awesome, and the atmosphere is elegant yet casual at the same time. Loved it here!! Definitely order the calamari appetizer and Lobster ravioli! Food is authentic and tastes amazing.

O6dqEz3kR9VYW48n4lmK3A.text: A hidden gem.   The decor is modern yet classy, the patio is large and tasteful, and the food is fantastic.   We had the beet and goat cheese salad, meatballs, pasta, fish, desert, wine, and more, and everything was top notch.  And it's not that far from the strip.  And it's reasonably priced.   Highly recommend the detour.

jI6b8_HP4utC5c7ICGtWSQ.text: Had eaten here last Friday with my fiance and my in laws and I honestly have to say that their food tasted amazing. Definitely recommend this place and will definitely come back.

bYp-EVtGrMZ4RKX_pSwORQ.text: This place is fantastic!!! From the minute you walk in, until the moment you walk out the door. The whole staff provides excellent service. The food is absolutely fresh and delicious. My daughter, her friend and I truly enjoyed the whole experience.

XhY2JVFkWD3WawdXqb7row.text: The food was of good quality, but delivery took almost an hour and the pizza we ordered arrived almost cold.  It had to be reheated in the microwave and I'm sure wasn't as good as it would have been fresh and hot.  It was very disappointing, especially for the price.

KBtShjuTVwbXc5UfqXXD2g.text: We found this restaurant by mistake, however, this is one of the best Italian restaurant we have been in. Great food, hospitality, we enjoy every moment. Def worth it. Enjoy

U0uFSQypSgZ_i8_ix5lcNQ.text: We had a lovely Father's Day Brunch at Prosecco today! The atmosphere was lively with laughter and beautiful live music! The food was out of this world...Amazing!!! My son and I shared the Eggs in a Nest and the Banana Nutella Crepes...both absolutely delicious! My husband enjoyed the Morning Star and couple mimosas...it was as a Happy Father's Day! So happy to have another fantastic place so close to home...We will definitely be back!

xfBLEzpaaiSrZRAdE_htEQ.text: Great Italian food. We are foodies and Italian is my second favorite. We have been to most of the Italian restaurants in LV. This is a new one and it is worth checking out. I had the lobster ravioli. They were great and the lemon butter sauce was maybe the best I have had. Service was good with very friendly wait staff. Prices are very reasonable with a good selection of Italian and American wines. Try it, you will like it.

Hw4UB0ZFYPIbsbxK9LVOBg.text: Started with carpaccio, pretty standard and burratina, spot on especially after taking our server's suggestion of not having the prosciutto fried.  All entrees were huge.  My seafood linguine had a lot of seafood, all very fresh except for mussels which tiny and rubbery(over cooked?).  Daughter had cappelini with shrimp...very standard.  Hubby had spaghetti with meatball.  Meatballs were huge but not what we're used to...it was very grounded with a lot of breading and barely had any taste of meat.  Excellent and attentive service.  Would definitely come back and try other dishes.

fSgQLF-LHXKGK2vS3MkfsA.text: We had dinner at this restaurant last week. It was the BEST osso bucco my husband has ever had He wants this to be his "last meal" if he is going to die soon. The staff is wonderful  The service is impeccable. Can't say enough good.  So we had such a great experience last week....we had to go back this week! We were not disappointed. The food was excellent, the service does not disappoint. Definitely worth trying. Better than any other Italian restaurant we have tried in Las Vegas!

z-9nKl-kW64S-bdPvuV-Lg.text: Pizza and eggplant parm was amazing. Pasta and cheese are fresh. Everything cooked to perfection. Will definitely go back. The only reason not 5 stars is service can be slow when you're trying to leave And the music doesn't match the ambience at all.

1FweelvgOOQk6XLlK-_Jaw.text: Raviolis and sauces are very good not generic tasting. Service took alittle too long for my preference, getting our meal took longer than 20 mins I think, maybe they are fresh made to order ? Not sure. Would not suggest ordering the Bututa Chicken, it's expensive and flavorless with some arugula on the side. My husband had to put my sauce from the cheese ravioli on top of it. The strawberry crepe wasn't the best either- too thick to be a crepe and the strawberries inside were not fresh and soupy. The special chocolate berry mouse was good on the other hand!

BhNwKKnWTdeJ5uBkf1bfwg.text: When I first walked into the restaurant I was greeted with amazing welcoming staff :)  The food was amazing ! The recommendations by our waiter was on point .  I couldn't be any happier than my first experience at this amazing restaurant .   Thank you Nico !:)

p6XwFiu1WSB8cWeGeTxXjA.text: We are picky especially when it comes to Italian food. (My husband is Italian and a chef).. This place has earned our loyalty :) great food, great ambience, amd great service!

g3_7RZEA0qe_wtq7g67oJw.text: Great place ,nice atmosphere fresh owners spirit amazing dressing for the bread, Parmesan eggplant is my favorite dish .

_DYGmXxYzs5WFgc_5Pfh0g.text: Really good food and service! This is a noisy place for dinner but not so much you can't have a conversation at a 4-top table.  Nice place in Henderson for dinner.

gSyaTT-f3BMq6E8qxGvS3w.text: This is a great little Italian spot in Henderson right by 215. It has a good sized patio as well as a very modern feel to it on the inside. The managers and wait staff are very friendly as well. We tried the Burratina as a starter and it was excellent. It was a cripsy crostini, some burrata, tomatoes, greens and a balsamic glaze. I would say that i would have liked more tomatoes as there were only 2 small ones for the whole plate and maybe add some of their great tasting homemade pesto that they bring to the table to start with bread. For main courses we tried the 4 cheese ravioli which had good flavor and the pasta had great texture. The chicken parmesan was good, although nothing that special and could have used a pinch of salt. I would have also preferred freshly chopped basil on top to just the simple placement of the basil leaves. Overall, fairly authentic Italian food for decent value and great service. Solid 4/5

6Xf5t7_G-1lHp-ksZxo7_A.text: Wow! That's what I am going to say again! WOW! Fantastic, authentic Italian food, not NY Italian, not Italian American but more Roma Style with a touch Taormina. They don't bang you out with nonsense and over rated prices and wine list. Prosecco is done right at the right price and amazing service. As you can see from my other reviews, I am rather picky and snobbish when it comes to food because of my 30 years executive Chef credentials. Believe me or not but believe me, you will not be disappointed at all and you will walk out feeling good about just happened. I highly recommend Prosecco. You will thank me.
